Reviews.Title: “great for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Borobird68
Reviews.Content: stopped for one night. Large room with kingsize bed, no noise. We went and spent the night in the sports bar which was really buzzing. great service and food, but be prepared for the bill at the end of the night.we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: JSScott
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because we needed a hotel by the airport before we left LA. The room was so tiny, it was like being on a cruise ship. Could barely move around without tripping over something. The bathroom was even smaller. No wonder why flight crew members go bizerk after staying in such a tiny room. The room was clean though and quiet. We had a nice view of the pool from the 12th floor. We ate dinner in the sports bar, food was pretty good. We had the breakfast buffet the next morning and the food was good and there was plenty of it. I'm not sure if all the airport hotels are like this, the price wasn't bad but the room was just so small.

Reviews.Title: “Great for quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Airport Marriott but have no complaints. Handy location, free shuttle, rooms were clean, quiet, well equipped and the bed was wonderfully comfortable after a long flight. We definitely didn't hear any airport noise so either we fluked a good room or we were too tired to hear it. They also offered us a 12pm check-out which I thought was handy. We didn't get to try all the facilities but the check-in/check-out process went smoothly and breakfast was excellent, if a little pricey compared to others we tried. I would definitely stay here again if flying in or out of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't bother with this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Vittoria S
Reviews.Content: There are many LAX airport hotels so in choosing I selected by the name, Marriott, which I thought I could trust. The hotel seemed to have been recently renovated and all effort was put into the lobby and restaurants, very little into the rooms. They were average and had no amenities such as a mini-bar or even a shower cap as most hotels offer. The whole thing was bare bones. But the worst is when you book online they show-boat by asking questions about your preferences (do you want extra towels, high floor, feather pillows) then didn't acknowledge any of my choices. I asked for a high floor-we were on 9 of 18...glass half full I guess? I asked for extra towels-we didn't even get enough towels let alone extra...I also asked (at check-in) "what was the view" The response "a partial runway view" when in fact we were full on looking at the runway and trust me it was NOISEY-that's why he lied. They should not give the noisey room unless all other rooms are booked and even then it should be at a discount. I rented a Hertz car, through the Marriott LAX website link but then after waiting (for close to a half hour) at the Hertz desk in the rear of the hotel lobby I learned that my car was reserved down the street at another Hertz location so I was not able to get the car I had booked. I waited in another ridiculously long line for Starbucks (gift card in hand) and was told they don't take Starbuck's gift cards...? Why-he couldn't answer...Both mornings our room phone rang at 5am with someone else's wake up call that the hotel staff did not care to clear from the previous guest....My husband pulled the rental car out of the lot but misplaced the ticket. Instead of calling to learn that we checked in one day ago they billed me $143.00 for one night's parking. I went to the front desk and they charged me another $25 for parking and said to show the receipt to the parking attendant. He of course said he couldn't help and that we have to call back to talk to the manager the next day...so one night's parking will either cost me $175 or a lot of time and hassle on the phone trying to straighten out- The whole thing was really a joke because they were trying to come across as so chic, for instance the drinking glass in the room is wrapped in paper that says "quench" and the do not disturb sign for the door says "brainstorming" It was all too "cool" but with zero ammenity or service to back it up. It was a total disappointment. Had they just offered a room in a convenient location without pretending to be able to offer more I would have been prepared, but I just really hated this hotel for misleading us...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Denise B
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfect location to return rental car and take shuttle to airport. Rooms are clean, bed is comfortable, bathroom is a little small. Nice gym onsite including cardio and weights. Very reliable since we have stayed here before. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clairedy6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous. All the staff were so friendly and helpful, and the courtyard area looked just like one in a resort, it was absolutely stunning! Everything was so clean and well taken care of. We had a problem with our room (didn't like the view facing out into the parking lot) and the front desk was so quick with getting us a room that walks right out to the courtyard at no extra cost! The only downside would be the fact that there's no free wi-fi in your room, however there is in the lobby next to Starbucks. We will definitely be staying here during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY ROOM, POOR SERVICE AT THE FRONT DESK, GOOD CONCIERGE THOUGH”
Reviews.Author: VAChuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights enroute to other locations. We have been Marriott Award members since the program began. Our experience at this hotel was one of the worst we have had in our travels. At check in, our reservation for a king size bed was denied. They put us in the basement area with two double beds saying there were no other rooms. The room they gave us was dirty with numerous rug stains (see pictures). The curtain did not block the entire window so light would not have been blocked in the morning. Apart from its condition, the room was small, particularly the bathroom. I complained at the front desk upon seeing the room. The front desk clerk insisted there were no other rooms available. I asked for the manager. I showed him the digital pics I had just taken of the room and this finally persuaded him to look on the screen. Immediately, another room was available. The clerk had not been honest with us. We stay at lots of Marriotts and we have noticed that the quality of the Marriotts we have stayed in has deteriotated. Four of the last five have been unsatisfactory. Once dependably reliable, the chain seems to us to have lost its commitment to its customers for a good, clean room. There were two bright spots. The lady at the Concierge desk was very helpful and efficient. Secondly, the waitresses in the main restaurant were quite helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kpcdk
Reviews.Content: After missing a connecting flight we were put up at this hotel. The staff at the front desk were great and very helpful. Our room was on a higher floor and very nice. The "sports bar restaurant" downstairs was very good with very large portions.

Reviews.Title: “Stop-over relaxation”
Reviews.Author: TutuSwannanoa
Reviews.Content: On several occasions I have been flying long aul between New Zealand and Europe; stopping at LA and staying a night at the Marriott makes a HUGE difference to how I feel lat the end of my journey. Marriott is quiet, well sited near the airport and the decor and fittings are conducive to relaxing well. Staff great. Travelling long haul? Stop for night and get your feet up and Marriott will make it all OK.

Reviews.Title: “It's an OK Hotel, But...”
Reviews.Author: TravelNatL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok. Parking is expensive and not readily available. Very crowded parking lot. It feels like Grand Central Station around there. Decent, big lobby with Starbucks, though. That was nice. Food is just ok. People are were nice and friendly. Gym is ok. BUT... if you need to be near the airport and that convenience is important to you, then go for it. They've stopped putting money in this place and it shows. Our bathroom ceiling was gross, messy-looking and discolored. And the bathrooms seemed super small to me. Again, just an OK place. No more, and no less. Not sure if I'd stay again unless it was critical that I be close to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating staff; needs more breakfast options”
Reviews.Author: Jaime W
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating staff (Without having to do it, they picked me up from the Hertz place as I decided not to get a rental). Some staff much nicer than others like above as well as he suggested cheaper alternative places to eat as well as mentioned the more expensive ones. Breakfast bar was a big plus, but I do wish that they would either open it earlier (this is right next to the airport and we do have flights leaving very early) or allowed you to purchase a few breakfast items the night before. Noise was an issue. However, I mentioned my allergies and the staff immediately put me in a PURE room with a HEPA filter. This was not only very kind of them to hook me up, but it helped block the noise. Also, central AC gave me access to turn up or down the fan. Coffee - I wasn't impressed. I know we have to think about being green, but I need a to go cup with a lid and not just a mug. Then, I found out later that there's a coffee service down stairs after chugging the coffee down in 2 minutes. ;D Also, shame on you LA for pumping all of that "health conscious" information and so far, you don't even have Splenda much less Truvia. I have those in Georgia and we "always get things after California" according to you. Gym - Ditto above! Small gym in a "health conscious" city/state! Food - Again ditto. Provide more health conscious foods like a yogurt fruit smoothie and provide it so that I can purchase it at midnight even if I have to fly out at 4AM! However, the staff was very helpful and polite and provided quick shuttle to/from airport and other destinations. One guy also gave the extra advice on places to eat cheap and places to eat when I had more time and guests. Ask for the PURE room if you have any allergies at all. Also, check out the room view situation as my room was across from a building construction site gone awry.

Reviews.Title: “Busy but accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: MaddamZue
Reviews.Content: All was OK, room was comfy, nothing out of this world, a little pricy but the shuttle services, and complimentary breakfast and internet made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Simplesisthekey
Reviews.Content: On my way to palm springs and flew in from ft lauderdale landed at midnight. Off the plane down to the shuttle and in 5min I was at the check in desk. 5 min later I was lying in my favorite..... The Marriott bed with extra feather pillows. Starbucks in the lobby..... Wish they had a free set up. Either this or make it in the room. Not the same they do it better. Looking out the window I just realized that I booked a car with budget, I thought I would have to back to the airport to pick it up but go figure it it right across the street. Very convenient Nice place good location great bed Can't speak for value I used points

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the LAX Marriott”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: I was here for 2 nights on a business trip and was upgraded to a suite on the 16th floor facing the airport. Windows are double-paned and I didn't here a thing. The food in both restaurants and bars were great! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, Below Average Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Jim J
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really small, really small. You can't have more than one person in the bathroom which is a problem with small children. Staff OK, not really friendly. Parking and food is far more expensive than reasonable when compared to other nearby hotels or other Marriotts. In Torrance, they charge 17 dollars for parking, not 32. The food is not so good, and more expensive than any hotel I've been too, even in expensive Frisco. 15 dollars for a tasteless, cheap burger, 21 dollars for a joke of a breakfast with cold bacon, cold potatoes, cold/cheap sausages, cheap cold-cuts, and poor/rude service. You are better off with day old breakfast from McDonalds. Overall, I call this hotel a joke, at best. A lot of pretentious stuff and falling far short from anything good. It is a motel 6 with a different name. As a matter of fact, stay at motel 6 nearby and you will be better off. I can say worse Marriott ever, and I stay at a lot of them.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at one of our favorite chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: OhioSilverLaker
Reviews.Content: In mid January, I stayed at the LAX Marriott after arriving from a business trip to Taiwan. After a very long flight, I was looking forward to a comfortable, quiet stay. I knew there was a hotel shuttle, but I stood out on the curb for nearly 45 minutes waiting, even though the hotel is only a mile or two away. I probably should have just walked. Once on board, I had to stand because the shuttle was packed with other travelers. Made it to the front desk about 9PM but I, and other travelers, were ignored because a contingent of flight personnel had also just arrived. Turns out, this hotel is the layover headquarters for a large number of flight personnel (flight attendants and pilots) who get their own counter, clerks, and priority. I finally got my room by going down to the ground floor level. This was very strange but I was told this was the only room available. It opened outside onto the exterior pool courtyard, but in January, everything was closed up and this room was cold and unappealing. It also had been used recently as an overflow room associated with a conference on that floor. It was missing toiletries, a pillow, in-room coffe pot, and an alarm clock. When I called the very busy desk, I was told this would be remedied at once, but it never was. Next, I went upstairs hoping to get a glass of wine in a quiet pub atmosphere. The nice looking restaurant still had patrons but I was told that I could not get a glass of wine in there, they were closing soon, but I could go next door to the breakfast restaurant where a a small bar was located, and get one there. Some people were mingling and watching TV in the bright lights of this kitchen-y area, but that was not what I had in mind, so I skipped that. The next morning, all I wanted was a cup of coffee. I made my way back upstairs to the lobby level and was greeted by a mob of ladies and young girls in attendance for some sort of gymnastics or dance conference. Most of the ladies/moms were in line at the Starbucks counter in the hotel. The line wrapped all the way around and down the hallway. Several of us customers went, instead, to the harried hostess at the cafe who got us coffees to go. It was very chaotic, and no seats were available in the cafe for breakfast. Needless to say, I checked out and took off as soon as I could. This experience was so different from my other stays with this fine hotel group that I felt compelled to write this review. I won't be back at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: NoOneWillAnswer
Reviews.Content: Used for layover on international connection. Close to airport, convenient shuttle. We arrived before 10am and were given immediate checkin, very happy about that. Room was clean and quiet, everything worked as it should. Ate twice in the casual restaurant on the main floor, good breakfast & dinner. All the staff we encountered were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarcoOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the LAX Marriott two nights before our cruise and one night post-cruise. All arrangements were made through Princess Cruises. When checking-in we were given a Princess handout with details for the boarding day and our baggage handling. The personnel at the Marriott were superb. All smiling and always helpful. They made our stay a wonderful experience. The rooms are OK but that depends if you are in the older section of the hotel on in the newer tower. We had a room in each, the older section on arrival and the tower on our return post-cruise. The beds are famously comfortable and all amenities are present. The bathtub is rather slippery to take a shower in as there is no rubber mat. There is also a Starbucks in the hotel lobby. There was a hotel tour representative on hand thus we booked a city tour for our free day in Los Angeles. Booking was with VIP Tours and we were entirely satisfied with the results. We used the Latitude 33 restaurant in the hotel which we found very good if somewhat overpriced. The filet mignon is excellent. They also have an extensive breakfast buffet. For the budget conscious people there is a Dennyâ€™s restaurant a few blocks away. Coming out of the front door, turn left on Century Boulevard and walk a few blocks to the Travelodge Hotel. Dennyâ€™s is on their premises.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Efficient”
Reviews.Author: baliben
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the LAX Marriott. Rooms seemed to have been recently refurbished and were very comfortable. I enjoyed the ergonomic desk chair and good work space lighting. Good sound proofing as well. Complimentary airport shuttle was efficient and got me from the hotel's porte cochere to the airport in less than 10 minutes. Check-in staff were extremely friendly and helpful too. Will definitely stay again next time I have an early flight out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Booked Prior to a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: larryjude
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the cruise line uses this hotel prior to boarding the ship. Overall the stay was good. The hotel was clean but did not offer free Wifi and once you were on the system was so slow that it was impossible to get service. It is a nice area to stay in as you can walk safely to other restaurants or do some general sight seeing. Maybe not a 4 out of 5 but definitely a 3.5. The beds were a little uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: fezziki
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott LAX President's Day weekend, first trip to LA. Hotel shuttle was very convenient, staff was very helpful and friendly. Was happy to find trolley stop to Manhattan Beach in front of hotel, ran on time and was only $5 round trip. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable. Was also glad to find Carl Jr's and Denny's within walking distance, because restaurants on premise were pricey. I had the room & breakfast plan, which was worthwhile because the breakfast buffet is very nice, with fresh omelets, mini waffles, hot and cold cereal, breakfast meats, pastries, bagels, and lox (smoked salmon).

Reviews.Title: “Good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2trav
Reviews.Content: I attend the Doctor Who Convention Gallifrey One each Presidents Day weekend. This hotel is perfect for it. I would recomend this hotel because its clean and nicely appointed. I prefer the rooms on the tower to the rooms that extend around the pool. The fitness room is also very nice with lots of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Viajera048
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the LAX Marriott for business and it was as pleasant and enjoyable as the first time. The airport shuttle service runs smoothly and checking in was efficient and prompt. I had a king size room on the 9th floor with a view of the pool, LAX and part of the valley.Beautiful, especially at night. Needless to say, even though I witnessed a few landings, there was never a problem with sound in my room. The staff was accomodating and always willing to go the extra mile with any special requests. My only negative comment is that there are no plastic bags on the trash cans. Being that the room has coffee maker, mini fridge & microwave, it's hard to throw trash in a receptacle that has no plastic liner...Other than that, this is a good, super clean property with great location in Century Boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott in good location”
Reviews.Author: Bigsteelerfan
Reviews.Content: Great proximity to LAX. Clean and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,great staff but very average”
Reviews.Author: boldableh
Reviews.Content: As Lax hotels go and most are the same, pretty average, this one has above average staff, great facilities for dining ect on the ground floor, it is way quieter than the Westin for example but the rooms are tiny and old. They are clean and there is nothing bad with them except for they look very tired and the the whole place needs a revamp. If you are staying overnight it will do but you wouldnt want to stay more than a night. Great staff, excellent service cant be faulted on that front.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Place to stay when flying!”
Reviews.Author: Scarletfever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to a cruise vacation (one night before and 2 nights after). The hotel itself is very nice with 3 different restaurants (not open all the time), a Starbucks in the lobby, the beds were super comfy and shuttle service was 24 hours a day and very quick. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff was amazing!! The best hotel staff as a whole that I have encountered anywhere!! Any time you were in the lobby, you were greeted with smiles and warmth! The desk staff was friendly and efficient. The waiters we experienced were attentive and polite. I would definately stay here again in the same situation! My only problems with this hotel was the cost of the food and the internet service. The restaurants were quite expensive ($4 for a tiny glass of orange juice) and the only free internet was in the lobby. WiFi in your room would cost you $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “well”
Reviews.Author: daboogah
Reviews.Content: the property itself isnt bad. The staff seem good and for the most part, all is fair. I stay here about 9 nights a year so not a heavy player at this property but am an SPG platinum so i have my fair share of stays in a year. When my girlfriend went there for a one night work trip, she woke up with her head bloody and after cleaning the mess, found out that the zipper from the pillow had made a small cut over her left eye. she took pictures of everything, reported it to the lobby who sent up a loss prevention specialist, he took the bloody towel (she used to wipe her face with), took the pillow case and pillow. seemed to start off good with the claims department somewhere in irvine. we can call her M. M was pleasant and since my girlfriend doesnt speak English well, I helped out but due to privacy laws.. you get the picture. so. she's been sending me her correspondence and I been doing some translations. After a few "call me anytime" " we need 30 days to investigate" kind of emails, we called twice from Japan and left msgs. NOTHING. Sent 3 emails. NOTHING. well after the 30 days she asked for. Finally called in a Manager, explained the situation and the emails are now condescending, and during a phone call, M actually said, "lets forget about the past (when we asked her to explain her sudden lack of cooperation) since we are trying to finish this up for you.". Excuse me? Forget about why you dont return calls, return emails? FAST FORWARD> got an email from M saying they wont be held liable but offered a $500 token of good will for my GF's trouble. Uhm.. OK. OTC medicine was about 60 bucks. taxi from marriott to CVS and back at night was 22 bucks. Saw one general family doctor and her out of pocket was 180 not including her time and taxi to get there. Saw a plastic surgeon to ask if the scar was permanent and that was about 290. getting a cut above your eye in a place like the marriott cause of a zipper is not the way anyone would want to spend the night. it can happen at any hotel. But the lack of communication, failure to accept responsibility (maybe they should be inserting the zipper side in when putting on cases?) and then offering something so ridiculous. NOT GOOD. Own Up Marriott. its ok to make mistakes. we are all human. Just make the kind of mistakes and learn from it. Dont pass the buck and say it aint your fault. trust me, no woman wants to arbitrarily create a cut above thier own eye esp if having a bandage on your face is no allowed in her line of work.

Reviews.Title: “Great for layovers”
Reviews.Author: QXflyer
Reviews.Content: Quick and easy shuttle pickup at LAX. Great Marriott beds and pool. Restaurant and Sports Bar offered up anything you are looking for to eat. One of the closest Hotels to LAX, so no stress worrying about being stuck in traffic on the way to the Airport to catch your flight. Would stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Laxw09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LA airport Marriott at the end of a road trip from San Francisco down Highway 1 and ended here. The hotel is extremely clean and modern. Prices are relatively affordable for the area (LA can be expensive). It is a great location to get to various points throughout the city, assuming you have a car which is a necessity in LA. Overall I would recommend this hotel and definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: EagleDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on night on our way home from Mexico and while the property is updated and the rooms clean, there may be better alternatives for the price. We are Marriott Gold members and like the Marriott brand. This hotel is older, although updated you will find the rooms very small and the bathrooms even smaller. The shuttle service is an complete disaster. This hotel is 4 blocks from the terminals but they only run the shuttle every 30 minutes - so we waited while the other hotels passed us by 3-4 times before our shuttle showed up. On our return trip to the airport, they only run shuttles every 20 minutes from 5 am - 7 am - after that they are back to 30 minutes. I think they are missing the point of being at the airport. The conceirge lounge is nice and offers a basic breakfast. Unlike other lounges that you can access 24 hours for water, soft drinks, etc. this hotel has limited hours. So as we arrived at 11 pm there was no option for the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “A little far from centre but great price”
Reviews.Author: katy k
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was very cheap for a 4 star hotel. it was beside a car rental and we hired a car . It took 30 mins to la live and about 45 min to hollywood Blv but 5 min to airport.it was a beautiful hotel with friendly and polite staff and parking was free! we enjoyed staying there and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: sarahaussiegirl
Reviews.Content: LA was a transfer point for us between Sydney and the East Coast, so we were only there for one night. The shuttle service from the airport was invaluable, even in the chaos that is LAX at Christmas time. The driver was helpful and the trip only took ten minutes. We hired the hotel's car to Rodeo Drive for $60 each way (4 people) and then they upgraded us to a limo which made the evening such an amazing experience. The rooms were contemporary and the beds were comfortable. Other extras included the Starbucks, flight schedules and free wifi in the lobby. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed!”
Reviews.Author: ThePainter119
Reviews.Content: I have never been on the first floor of a hotel like this....it was very close to everything. After a long trip from London, the bed was wonderful. I loved the bedding and bath soaps. The only thing was that I could hear planes taking off in the night. When I flew out the next day I than really saw how close we and other hotels really are to the runway. The shuttle at 6 am was very full so go early. Many flight crews stay here and that could be part of the reason.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Marg1970
Reviews.Content: Great location. Convenient shuttle. Awesome service!

Reviews.Title: “Better Places”
Reviews.Author: jsg712
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been updated but no amount of updating the furnishings is going to change the fact that this is an old hotel with small cramped rooms. I had issues with the A/C unit making a high pitched noise that would have dogs howling. I called to change rooms and was told that they were full and that the only option was a double bed room on the first floor. As a Gold Elite Member, I found this to be unacceptable. Maintenance was sent to "fix" the problem with the AC which he couldn't because the AC technician had already gone home for the day. The maintenance tech who was sent to the room agreed that it couldn't be fixed and said he would get me another room. After several phone calls and conversations with me he said all the hotel could offer was the double bed on the first floor which is really the basement. I proceeded to the lobby to checkout and asked to speak with the manager. The manager finally arrived and apologized for the confusion and said that he had found me a king room (which I had reserved a month ago) on the same floor. I went to the new room and turned on the AC only to hear the same high pitched noise. After a long trip from the East Coast I was not ready to go through the same issues with the manager. I turned off the AC and just let the fan run. It eliminated the high pitched noise but wasn't the best option for keeping the room cool. I logged onto the web and made a reservation at the nearby Embassy Suites for the remainder of my nights in LA. There are just better places to stay in the LAX area. Even if there weren't issues with the AC, I wouldn't be a repeat customer at this Marriott. The rooms are cramped and too small and the concierge lounge is not one of the best Marriott has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Bad deal dont book this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan S
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for 4 nights to attend a confenece at the hotel and regretted doing it. They put me in a room right next to the elevator so I heard screaming kids and loud guests all night long, every night, in addition to the sound of the elevators rumbling. However, thats just the beginning. The first morning I had housekeeping barge in on my room at 7 am, Tregardless of the "Do not disturb" sign I had put on the door. The housekeeper proceeded to enter until she had reached my bed to hear me yelling and realized that I was still in there. The manager upon informing him of the issue denied that it happened, and then upon informing him I needed to change hotels, he offered to give a slight discount. The second night I came up to my room to find that the floor smelled strongly of Marijuana smoke and hotel security had to be called. These rooms were listed as non smoking and I am required to pass a monthly drug test as part of my employment with the government, so as such I was very concerned. That following morning there were no issues and upon returning to my room on the third night everything seemed fine, aside from being parked next to the elevators. However, the fourth night I found the smell of marijuana again and had to call hotel security to find the source and vanquish it as well as spend the night in a friends room on another floor due to the smell and smoke present on mine. I managed to go back to my room later on the following day to find the smell only faintly there and spent the last night in my room doing paperwork. But As if the preceeding issues had not been enough, On the morning I was set to check out I had my room entered again by hotel staff at around 8 am while I was still sleeping. This was regardless of the 2 "Do not disturb" signs that I had put on the door. One in the keycard slot and the other on the door handle. The hotel employee apparently opened my door to go inside to place my bill on the desk and I woke up to see him leaving. I would have thought that the staff would have had the courtesy to slip it underneath the door due to the signs but they didnt. Instead I was left wondering if any of my property had been stolen while I was asleep. Luckily nothing was. When I finally went to check out, the manager on duty denied that there were any of the aformentioned issues and claimed I was lying. I requested that she preform a lock interrogation to see who had entered my room and to check the calls placed from my phone top verify my calls for security. She then finally told me that she would have hotel staff check the lock records for my room and that I was to wait for them to get back to her. I spent 45 minutes waiting for the lock check and nothing happened. I then went to go pack up and leave. Upon checking out the manager was unavailable to speak with and I paid full rate for my room minus the 50 dollars they agreed to deduct from the first night at the beginning of the stay. As someone who works full time and had to request leave 6 months in advance to attend the conference. I will not be staying at this hotel again, but rather the LAX Hilton which was 50 dollars cheaper per night, regardless of any added convenience the Marriott offers.

Reviews.Title: “If price is not critical this is your place.”
Reviews.Author: ProMetalSales
Reviews.Content: Like most close proximity airport hotels this one is pricey but worth it. Location is great and I was surprised and pleased at the lack of noise from aircraft. Rooms surround a great pool and courtyard, Starbucks in the lobby and 3 places to eat including a sportsbar and higher end steak house. Our meal and service at the steakhouse were excellent as was the service at all points. Typical Marriott rooms comfy and mine was quiet even on the 3rd floor. I do however resent they charge you for internet when you are already paying a premium for the room! If you need to be near LAX and paying a bit more is worth it, this is your place. One tip, if you need to take their shuttle to the airport plan on up to a half hour wait in the morning because the lines are greater than the capacity of their shuttle van so you wait for the next one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrayHairedGranny53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel to catch an early morning flight. Waited a long time for the shuttle to pick us up from the airport. Once it picked us up it was a short trip to the hotel. This hotel is a crew hotel as flight attendants were also checking in. Arrived late in the evening from a Honolulu flight. Didn't see a restaurant open at the hotel to get food. There were vending machines and the news stand had some packaged food. Slept for a few hours and got up for an early morning flight. Shuttle was prompt in the morning to return to the airport. It did have to stop at the Courtyard too.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: merlot1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip to nearby El Segundo. Check-in was very quick and efficient, the staff were very courteous and every one smiled and greeted me on each trip through the lobby. Obviously well trained. What is really lacking is good value for the price. Turns out that the room rate does not include breakfast, internet service, or parking, all extras which, plus taxes and fees, added a whopping 69% to the initial quote for room rate. Parking is an outrageous $27.50 per day. You can park next door at a public parking structure for less than half that. Also, I was really surprised that used towels were not removed from the bathroom but left hanging in the shower. The rooms were clean and updated, however, no refrig in the room. I thought the bathroom was small for a hotel of this caliber and the door was also a little small for the suitcase. This reflects the age of the building.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay at this airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: badsaltydog
Reviews.Content: Yes, I am in agreement with some other reviews that the rooms are not huge and the shower/tub toilet is a bit tight. This is LA however and real estate per square foot is likely astronomical. More importantly the rooms are really clean as is the bathroom and the bed is very comfortable. There is a beautiful interior pool/hot tub courtyard area that is very nice, not to be missed. The only problem is the Marriott no longer has its own van to pick you up at LAX. Most of the major hotels now have to use a 'city bus' that picks you up, you have to be really careful or you will miss the correct bus. We flew in from Boston to LAX and arrived in terminal 7. This is basically the last stop and by the time the bus arrives it is full. We had to wait almost an hour to finally catch that bus to the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lori1214
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little small. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom is small and hard to move around in. The courtyard/pool area is pretty. Ask for a room facing the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Airport”
Reviews.Author: GlennoPerthOz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night on our way to Australia. Stayed elsewhere on the way over. This was much better. Got a good deal as the mystery deal on a website. Very nicely furnished, comfy bed and quiet. Could see the planes but not hear them. Good bar and restaurant for dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Muy Bueno!”
Reviews.Author: puertadelcielo
Reviews.Content: Limpio, camas comodas, piscina y jacuzzi. Aparte de la piscina y un cafe no hay mas nada para los ninos. Es cerca del aeropuerto. No conviene si solo vas de compras, es muy lejos del centro!! o de los outlets (centro comerciales grandes con venta de ropa d marca)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for stopover”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: Close to lax. Convenient for a stopover. Serverd our needs.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: BVITortola_12
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Very convenient to airport. Good shuttle service. Only problem, when we arrived, Late at night, they had no power. Gave us candles to use, lasted a couple of hours. They did give us a credit for brekfast for the next day. Good customer service

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Location and OK Service”
Reviews.Author: brewster69
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Marriott at LAX before and had a good experience, so when we needed a place to stay before our cruise we book the hotel again. The hotel is comfortable and quiet given it's location to LAX. Front Desk staff was just OK, but not very friendly and had difficulty answering basic questions about the restaurant. The young lady who served us breakfast in the hotel restaurant was excellent. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The food is somewhat pricy, but not excessive for a hotel. The shuttle drive who picked us up in the evening at LAX was polite, but clearly over worked and there was not enough room on the shuttle bus for everyone which made for a short but uncomfortable ride. This was mostly due to some very RUDE American Airlines crews who pushed with way onto the bus after the driver said he would send someone else to get them. As a result the driver had to skip several terminals and leave people behind. I doubt I would choose to fly on American give the way the flight crews behaved towards passengers on that shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service and spotless rooms”
Reviews.Author: lady frobisher
Reviews.Content: This is a huge Marriott property but a bit more luxe than the average airport hotel. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the staff is friendly. There is a Starbucks in the lobby as well as lounge chairs outside, wifi in the lobby-(which is available in the rooms for a fee unless you have "elite" status with Marriott.) Some rooms have balconies but beware the ones over the smoking area below: noise and more air pollution. There are also rooms which open onto the pool area--great if you want to roll out of bed and go for a dip--not so much if you want silence.

Reviews.Title: “The LAX Marriott is a great place for a layover”
Reviews.Author: DaveGski
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to overnight at LAX before flying to New Zealand. The LAX Marriott was a good choice. We found a reasonably priced modern hotel with great service, a friendly staff, and good options for dinning. The hotel has four dinning/coffee establishments including a Starbucks (opens at 0530 AM), Champions Sports Bar, JW's Steakhouse, and Latitude 33 Restaurant. We tried Champions and were pleased with the food and service. The hotel also has a very nice fitness center and a guest laundry. The LAX Marriott was so convenient that we stayed another night upon returning from New Zealand and before flying off to Europe. Pros: - Close to airport and rental cars with a complementary 24-hour airport shuttle (although shuttles are available, one could actually walk to the airport or to the rental car locations). - Do It Yourself Guest Laundry is inexpensive and they offer free detergent. - Nice fitness center. Con: Older hotel, so the rooms and bathrooms are small

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Airport.”
Reviews.Author: sigi3
Reviews.Content: Marriott at Los Angeles airport is our regular stopover when travelling to London from New Zealand. We have stayed at other airport hotels in the area and found that Marriott is consistent for quality of room, good free shuttle service, and choice of restaurants downstairs. Wifi is free in the downstairs area and works well. Its very busy, but the staff are friendly and help graciously. Easy and pleasant stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel airport”
Reviews.Author: Cliff S
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LA after a long flight from the UK. Instead of picking up our hire car the day we arrived, I noticed that this hotel has a hertz desk in the hotel. Allowed us to easily pick up our car the next morning rather than having to do it after a long flight. Hotel was really comfortable and the staff at the check in were very welcoming and friendly. The pool is quite large and interesting, the kids really enjoyed it. All round this hotel is excellent for airport arrivals/departures. HIghly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Francesca-DM
Reviews.Content: A very nice airport hotel. When getting out from any terminal at LAX wait for the shuttle bus in the specific areas. The shuttles look all the same, just wait for the one with the sign "Marriott LAX - Courtyard LAX Century Blvd". It won't take more than 20 minutes. The hotel lobby is bright and wide, and checking in is very quick. Elite guests and airline crews enjoy separate desks. As other travelers said, there are several restaurants and a Starbucks kiosk, which is very convenient for the ones who don't have the breakfast included in the rate. We got a room on the 16th floor, which is the concierge level floor meant for elite travelers. Infact, there was the club level room up there which was closed on Saturday and Friday evening - so what? Despite the age, our room was wide and nice and perfectly decorated with amazing beds as always. The windows are yes thin and yes you can hear huge planes taking off and landing but that did not bother us. What was annoying (and due to the age of the building) was the heating system which was just terrible, old and very noisy. Apart from that, everything else was just perfect. We enjoyed a lovely dinner at Latitude 33 restaurant and the breakfast buffet was just awesome and super yummy. In the end, surely a positive experience and yes, we would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you're coming from Australia”
Reviews.Author: KathrynOB73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our arrival from Australia, in a high floor room. We then hired our Hertz hire car from the agency here and headed off on our holiday. We also stayed here two nights before returning home, again we hired a car at the agency here. Great location (easy to get around if you want to go into hollywood, along to santa monica, Getty Centre etc...), great price, very clean, staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good beds BUT”
Reviews.Author: csteets
Reviews.Content: This is a very dated hotel on the outside but pretty good on the inside. The hotel beds are great but this hotel has one big problem. It does not have sound proof windows. So you hear airplanes taking off. Most hotels this close to the airport have changed out there windows years ago.

Reviews.Title: “A Waystation on the way to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: RonSlee
Reviews.Content: We always stay here and catch an early morning flight out of LAX to Hawaii. The concierge level is very nice and the lounge terrific as usual. The staff from check in to the bell station tothe restuarants are very professional and friendly. Great beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice for overnight accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Marytc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the end of November for the third time. I usually stop in LA for one night on my way to/from New Zealand and have found this an excellent choice for a few reasons. It is close to the airport and just a few minutes shuttle ride away. I am usually tired when I get there so this is a plus. There is a great pool area which is nice for resting up after a long journey and it doesn't feel like you are in the middle of a concrete jungle (which you are). The Manhattan Beach Trolley stop is just a block away and makes it easy to get to the beach, shops, and cafes of this quaint little town. The staff is very friendly. On my latest trip I arrived at 7 am and was given an early check-in which was very important to me. Many hotels will not do this and I consider this a real courtesy and benefit of staying there. The restaurants are pretty good if you don't have time to go elsewhere. Rooms are fine and the beds are very good. If you shop around you will be able to find excellent rates for this hotel. I'll be stopping here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay with absolutely no flaws”
Reviews.Author: Sensenigr
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this property seem to be mixed; however, it is time I add mine. I had an absolutely perfect stay with no problems or concerns. I stayed for 4 nights in December 2011. The Airport Marriott at LAX is a large hotel property on Century Blvd just minutes from LAX, literally between two runways and nearby a bunch of other airport hotels. They do have two parking options, Self at $25.00/night or Valet at $30 or $35. I used self-park. It is convenient with in/out privileges with a swipe of your room key. The parking is very convenient and close to the main entrance. Upon arrival, we were greeted with lots of friendly employees. In fact, I was always greeted with friendly employees walking through the lobby area. The lobby has three restaurants and a Starbucks. Unfortunately, I did not have a chance to use any of the food service, so I cannot comment. We were checked in efficiently at the front desk and given a room on the 9th Floor facing the beautiful pool/courtyard area -- but not with a balcony. The very efficient and fast elevators are always waiting for you and you are not waiting for them. Our room was very clean and of average United States/Marriott standards. We had two double beds and the decor was generally up-to-date and everything was in working order and good condition. The bathroom was small, but fine for us -- although I wish the shower head was a bit higher for tall people like myself. Our room was made up timely every single day. The courtyard/pool area is gorgeous. A massive pool in a tropical setting with lots of seating areas, plants, flowers and even a stream and bridge. It is really a nice area to just chill and relax, even if you are not using the pool or hot tub. Good Service, Good Value, a Decent Room = a good value! By the way, you will hear airport noise between like 6am and midnight, somewhat frequently. If this bothers you, then you should seriously consider staying at a non-airport hotel. We actually enjoy this and it doesn't bother us at all. I would highly recommend a stay with the LAX Airport Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Notourious on no refunds on Natural Disasters”
Reviews.Author: karly C
Reviews.Content: If you planning to book Los Angeles Aiport Marriott call before hand and ask about their policy on refunds on Natural Disasters. Recently I had travelled to Mexico and all flights were grounded due to a hurricane. When arriving home i contact my travel agent and the hotel for a refund and explained the situation. Unsympathetic to the situation the hotel pocket the money .. I will not recommend nor stay at the Marriott...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Shaca18
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about staying here on a stopover but were pleasantly surprised. The service was excellent, the staff very helpful and our room with a balcony overlooking the pool was very comfortable and clean and very reasonably priced. There was no noise at all from the planes and we got a good nights sleep. The shuttle to and from the Airport was very convenient too. This was our second visit to LA which I must say is not our favourite city in the States and we stayed over to do the city tour and rest up before flying to Honolulu after a trip to the Eastern states. We decided to eat in the Hotel and this was a good choice. The food and the drinks during happy hour were very reasonably priced and excellent quality. I would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a clean, comfortable airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: abronxman
Reviews.Content: While its a little dated and in need of modernization, this hotel is a good bet if you're looking for a clean and comfortable hotel at LAX. The rooms are very clean and quiet and, for an airpory hotel, it's fairly upscale. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it for a stay of more than two nights as the furnishing tend to be a little beaten up. For example, the desk in my room was wobbly.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: csharrison68
Reviews.Content: Every where I went in this hotel I was greeted by a wide smile and a friendly hello. My room was comfortable, though the bathrooms are on the smallish size - I'm guessing because it's an older property. My balcony was huge, though, and looked out onto the lovely courtyard, pool and hot tub. The fitness center was clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Flyguy05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when the airline i work for had a delay. Check-in was a breeze and agents were always helpful. Rooms were great, nice comfortable beds good sized TV and plenty of work space for those that have work to do. I'm not real sure how the WIFI cost or even if its free (as i didn't use it). For those that want to order room service, food is so so, you could probably get better food at a different location(I never had to pay for food as the company paid, but just wanted to give my two cents). Parking, I saw is quite expensive for those that want/need to park their cars. So, this hotel is great and i would like to stay here again (if i were to stay at a hotel in the area again)

Reviews.Title: “Good place to pass through”
Reviews.Author: Jean O
Reviews.Content: Being as this hotel is at the LAX airport, there is a constant stream of traffic. Stayed recently due to a convention and this hotel was good for the show. Convenient with a free shuttle from the airport. The rooms were clean, however, there were things that were forgotten or missed. Just minor things. I think housekeeping is so used to people only staying one night at a time here because of its airport proximity that not doing a complete room turn around probably confused them. I did find however, the front desk people very condescending. They could be trained up a bit. The housekeeping, bell, and maintenance staff were extremely helpful and nice. Their front desk could take lesson. Their hotel cafe is very good, reasonable pricing. Their steakhouse was sub par. Very expensive pricing for extremely tough steak, very disappointing. The sports bar was fun, but didn't open till late in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business or layovers, not for vacationers”
Reviews.Author: voyageurm
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable, rooms clean and spacious. Treat and tip the room cleaning staff nicely and they will remember by giving you extra packets of one cup coffee for the room's coffee-maker. View over the pool from my room was fantastic. I can't comment on rates as the room was booked for me by my company. Beware, however, the hotel's restaurants are pricey - even on an expense account - and the only moderately-priced restaurant nearby worth eating at in walking distance is the Greek restaurant Aliki's. Otherwise there is nothing nearby except for a run-down store around the corner where you can get some tobacco and sundry items, a Burger King and the worst Denny's I've ever eaten at. The hotel is out-of-the-way, located near most of the major car rental lots, but if you don't have a car, public transportation will get you places such as Manhattan Beach (25 minutes) and Santa Monica (50 minutes). The staff was helpful with routes and provided timetables, and in general was very professional. WiFi in the main commons area. Close to the airport, the Marriot LAX is a good choice if you're on business, definitely not if you're on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: rodger51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June, and found it a good base to explore Los Angeles by car for a couple of days and nights. The front desk staff were helpful, the room a good size, and though the decor was a little dated, it was clean and comfortable and quiet. It was great to jump in the hire car and be in Manhattan Beach and its restauratns in only five to 10 minutes. It was a suprirse that the Marriott's coffee shop didn't stay open later, but the bar/restaurant did, though that might not be the atmosphere you want. The shuttle buses to the airport worked well. Overrall, a good but not memorable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fixo
Reviews.Content: Im a platinum Marriott member and this is one of the best properties I experienced. Especially happy with the treatment received at check in! Warm welcome and very quick. Can't figure out why Internet is free at budget properties and outrageously expensive at upscale properties.

Reviews.Title: “Filled its purpose”
Reviews.Author: TcuIrish_8080
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel the first weekend of November and just needed a place close to the airport that offered a free shuttle. Hotel is large and modern but be prepared to shell out $25 for parking and $15 for wi-fi. Overall, nothing special but nothing to complain about either. Would stay there again if I needed an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even better stay than the last time”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and it was even better than the last time. Check-in experience at the Elite desk was super fast and friendly. The hotel was really bustling and there were several conferences, weddings and events being held which resulted in somewhat slow luggage assistance. But all the staff seemed friendly, if not a little over-worked. The concierge lounge is closed on weekends, but I was kindly supplied with breakfast vouchers. It was one of the better breakfasts that I had on my long trip. Yum. We had dinner in the Sports Bar â€“ food was okay, but overpriced for what it was and the service was hit or miss. I think I may have been given that same suite as my last stay. This time it was spotless. No one in their right mind could fault a Marriott bed. Great sleep. Thank you so much to the Steven and all of his staff for making my partnerâ€™s birthday extra special. I wish we could have stayed longer! Iâ€™d really like to linger a little at this hotel â€“ solid 4 stars out of 5 and amazing value for money for a full-service Marriott! Looking forward to my next stay....

Reviews.Title: “Good travel stop”
Reviews.Author: BeauHarley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the airport, has timely shuttles. The restaurants are great with good choices for a business meal with clients or a casual meal. The concierge lounge is a good place for a snack. It has a rental car drop off, a Starbucks and the staff are always friendly and well trained to assist you. The business office is efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with most others......”
Reviews.Author: Dorkus
Reviews.Content: This is a solid if unspectacular property. Stayed one night. The room was nice, and noise was not an issue. The fitness center was a bit small, but had a good mix of machines. Didn't use the pool, but the pool area looked good. Had dinner in the sports bar, and while the food was fine, the bar seemed a bit cold and sterile. Again, a good, solid hotel with no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peterandmarie304
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Los Angeles then continued north to do a "Sideways" wine tour. We stayed at this Marriott the day before our departure from LAX to Florida. What a surprise! The room was large with every ammenity you needed including a flat screen TV, cozy seating area, comfortable bed and was CLEAN. We had requested extra pillows and towels which were in our room upon arrival. The lobby had a Starbucks, gift shop, grill and more casual restaurant, Latitudes. We had dinner at Latitudes which was delicious. Extremely convenient to rental car return area. You can drop the car off and walk across the street to the hotel. Plus, the rate was so reasonable. Complimentary airport shuttle service 24 hours a day. The overall quality of this hotel exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value right by airport”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Billy
Reviews.Content: Big hotel very close to LAX. Large room and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in L A (airport area)”
Reviews.Author: Cavatinafan
Reviews.Content: Booked by Travel Agent, not chosen by ourselves, but couldn't have managed any better. Very friendly and helpful Reception staff, ate dinner in 'Sports Bar' - regular type Bar Food, but good choice of Breakfast in restaurant. Room with balcony in lower accommodation blocks surrounding pool,really good size. Didn't have time to use pool, but looked very inviting. Would definitely use this hotel again if in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to take a quick break from travel”
Reviews.Author: tentmaker
Reviews.Content: spent one night here on the way back from HI, staff was extremely friendly and helpful. What a refreshing night in a clean comfortable bed. It was just what the doctor ordered!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: auditing4you
Reviews.Content: I dis like the 3 resturants in the lobby! Starbucks as well! Rooms clean quiet and add 25.00 for parking and 15.00 for internet!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: sun4oz
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for about 7 hours. We wanted to freshen up before our flight home to Australia around midnight. Arrived about 1pm and were given a room on the 1st floor. I thought we aren't going to be here long anyway. As it turned out there was a back door and this opened right onto the pool area. The kids loved it. In fact they thought it was the best pool as it was quite deep. The rooms are a bit small but for what we needed it for it was great. Parking is expensive but if you just drop off your luggage and then return to your car and continue sightseeing you won't be charged. Drop off rental car posts are just around the corner - they even drove us back to the hotel. Will stay here again on my travels next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near LAX value for money”
Reviews.Author: vik871
Reviews.Content: Recent trip to US from Sydney stayed at LAX Marriott for 3 nights. Free shuttle to and from airport. Nice rooms with good views. Modern facilities pool gym etc. Free wifi in foyer area. Sports bar few restaurants. Done universal studios and hollywood LA tours great service pick up from hotel. Service was excellent. The hotel has nice ambience and surrounds. Plus comfy beds. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Nareshkkc
Reviews.Content: If heaven can be imagined then, you got it. Clean, quiet and comfortable rooms equip with everything you would expect from a Marriott hotel. Staff were more than friendly, check in / out very fast and easy. The on-site restaurants were adequate but maybe a bit too pricey for what they offered. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: LiveNSF
Reviews.Content: If you're flying in or out of LAX, I would definitely consider staying here. If you're a Marriott's Elite member, the complimentary Concierge Lounge is wonderful for hearty breakfasts and evening appetizers and sweets. The area had plenty of restaurant and bar options as well.

Reviews.Title: “airport convenience”
Reviews.Author: LynnOliver
Reviews.Content: Was very nice, clean and easy to get to and from airport. Restaurants are expensice and no where else is close. Lots of other places as close and all have shuttles from airport, so check your prices. Everyone there was helpful, and no complaints about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Gavleng
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet and comfortable rooms equip with everything you would expect from a Marriott hotel. Staff were more than friendly, check in / out very fast and easy. The on-site restaurants were adequate but maybe a bit too pricey for what they offered. The location is not bad with easy links to visit the surrounding areas. Great place for a short stopover but would probably stay somewhere more central if staying in LA for longer than a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: RonaldvanderBoom
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was much nicer than I had expected. I booked the hotel in advance because of its location close to LAX. It exceeded my expectations in size and grandeur immediately. From the high level of security at entry, to the luxurious lobby, to plush rooms... My spacious room had a flat screen tv, and a large, comfortable bed. Everything was nice and the staff courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Avearge Hotel...Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: RondaJS
Reviews.Content: I used my free certificate for a two night stay before a trip to Thailand in September 2011. Please note: overnight parking is 32 dollars! The lobby is big and they have a separate check in for Marriott Rewards elite card holders which is manned from 3pm to 10:00 PM only. The hotel is quite dated and so was the room. The electric outlets were very loose and finding a suitable one to charge my 220 volt appliances was not an easy task. Overall there is nothing special about this property expect its location near LAX. I will definitely not stay here during my next trip to LAX and would not recommed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent room and facilities!”
Reviews.Author: lemaCheT
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Marriott after the Radisson sold our pre-paid room and sent us there. Although we were annoyed at being sent somewhere else at 1 in the morning, we were lucky to be received warmly. The staff here are fantastic. Our room was big and very comfortable. The bed was like a giant pillow, we loved it. Very clean and had everything we needed. The pool area is great. It's lovely to sit out there and just relax, even if you aren't going for a swim. The lobby has free wi-fi and several restaurants and cafes if you need them. Very easy to get to other parts of LA from here. We caught a bus to Santa Monica (only took half an hour) and the bus stop for this was directly outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel For an LAX Overnighter”
Reviews.Author: daddy808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel quite a few times in the last 5 years as an overnight hotel on the way back to our home in Hawaii. The rooms are very clean, but could use some updating. Hotel staff are very helpful, and the FedEx office downstairs makes sending home items from shopping sprees a breeze. Love the Starbucks store in the lobby. The only problem is the price of parking. Crazy expensive, especially the valet. If close proximity to LAX is a must, this is a great hotel. We wont go anywhere else near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “On the edge of the airport, good service, great value, tired property”
Reviews.Author: dtanpcs
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently. The price is very reasonable especially on the weekend. It is on the edge of the airport so it is ideal if you have no car and just have a brief lay over at LAX. The parking is a large uncovered lot which is not ideal if you have lots of luggage or it is raining. The lobby looks good and has 3 restaurants. Room service runs till midnight. The food options are reasonable but very plain. The rooms and corridors are tired and old. The doorways are unusually narrow. The bathrooms are very small but have a reasonable amount of counter space. They still have the old narrow Speakman shower heads instead of the much wider and pleasant Kohler rain fall fittings. The beds are very comfortable. The windows do not open. The airport noise is acceptable. The staff and service levels are very good. This is a good airport hotel option for LAX.

Reviews.Title: “The Maids are Noisy and Ignore the "Do Not Disturb" Signs”
Reviews.Author: Global_Thinker
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on two different trips, and both times had problems. The first trip I had the unfortunate experience of being there during a music convention - which they neglected to tell us when we booked. The music convention dominated the pool area all day beginning at 10 am and lasting all day (the entire weekend). Even though we were in our room on the 14th floor we could still hear loud music from the pool. The staff was anything but understanding. This trip, however, wasn't during any conventions. Even though I requested no maid service when I booked the hotel (they even had a note on their computer), I still got messages from housekeeping saying they couldn't clean the room because the "Do Not Disturb" sign was on the door. I asked the front desk to remind housekeeping that my room didn't need serviced. I had to switch floors because the maids on the 10th floor started work very early in the morning and were EXTREMELY loud and shouting to each other down the halls - they were anything but mindful of people trying to sleep. The staff was apologetic and upgraded me to an executive suite on another floor. I didn't want maid service in this room either, but the maids apparently didn't get the message because even though I had the "Do Not Disturb" sign in the key slot (meaning they'd have to remove it to insert their key), they came into my room while I was away. I have a bad back that requires me to arrange pillows in a certain way to ease the pain, and when the maids came in they removed all the pillows and stacked them in a corner (requiring me to place all the pillows all over again) and the maids moved several of my belongings when they came in my room. Come to find out, even after all my requests for "NO HOUSEKEEPING" the hotel had never removed my room number from housekeeping's list of rooms to be cleaned. Another issue is self parking. When you check in, they're supposed to activate your room key for parking. I've discovered most of the employees, however, don't activate the keys properly which causes you to have to buzz the valet to come and let you out of the gate...sometimes they're prompt, sometimes you wait 5 minutes with a cue of cars behind you. I would only suggest this hotel if your flight's been cancelled and you have to stay somewhere overnight. It's at least a safe, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Princessalaska
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and always stay here on our arrival in LA, so many good things to mention, the beds ( possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in ), the great staff, shuttle bus service from the airport ( every 15 mins ). This trip we had quite a few rooms and I managed to loose a denim jacket in one of them or it may have been left in the main area downstairs, I had borrowed it from my youngest daughter without permission !! We returned two weeks later and it was only as I was getting my plane outfit sorted that I realised it was missing!! I went to see the concierge not thinking that I would ever see it again and amazingly he produced it within 10 mins !!!! Unbelievable. The staff are really lovely so welcoming and nothing is too much trouble, we like the balcony rooms, but they are not available beyond the 7th floor. The pool area is really lovely always room and never feels overcrowded. Night time patrols by security ( for those poor brits abroad ) who find themselves up at 2am! Smoking is allowed by the pool in a designated area. The two eating places one a sports bar and one more family based dining with a fairly standard menu good hearty fare with reasonable pricing. Starbucks is onsite and opens at 6am but if you don't fancy that then there is a Denny's just down the road a five minute walk away. All the main car rental places are within easy reach of the hotel so it makes it an ideal start and end destination to the holiday. We go every year and have stayed at other hotels near the airport but we keep returning to this one ( mainly for the beds ) !!!! and the pool and the really lovely welcome and great staff. Nothing is too much trouble and the whole vibe of the hotel is very relaxed. Something that is quite difficult to achieve in such a busy airport location.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed, always satisfied”
Reviews.Author: CPSBangkok
Reviews.Content: Every year I make a point of breaking my long distance travel at the Marriott LAX. It's proximity to the airport, the quality F&B outlets, and the service make this my preferred choice for LAX layovers. And as I normally need to stay on a Friday/Saturday, the weekend rates make the hotel especially good value. Final meals before flying out long haul are always taken at the JW's Steakhouse, which represents good value in a relaxed atmosphere. When killing time in the room there is a huge choice of TV channels, as well as an impressive in-house movie on demand service. Look for daily movie specials as low as $4.99. Rooms are comfortable and a good size - bathrooms are pretty small, but at least that makes for a larger living area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: MukulVerma
Reviews.Content: The team there took good care all around, from the floor manager (took ownership), to the room keeper. All and all very good from the service. The pillow were not good, so hard to get a good night sleep and happy to be back home in my own bed for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Airport”
Reviews.Author: Badger541
Reviews.Content: Good location for LAX which is why we chose it, and very good value for money. Had to eat in the hotel ,which was a little expensive but very nice. Rooms excellent and quiet despite overlooking the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moejoe50
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet room near lax . Staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms nicely decorated. My only complaint is the self parking fee of $27.50 there is a couple of parking places a block away for $11 a day The parking spot is one.

Reviews.Title: “Brick bed”
Reviews.Author: dlabbott
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 6th. floor and our bed was as hard as a brick, just wht we needed before long plane ride!!!!! Champions restaurant had a limited menu consisting of mostly chicken. Have always stayed at this Marriott but will NOT be returning. Needs updating!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Snookeredtraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times over the years and can truly say that I've never been disappointed with the rooms. Always clean, clean, clean. They've changed their decor (linens) and everything is white with a beige trim. The duvet cover is even a crisp white which assures me that they change them. Overall very well kept. On the other hand, parking is very expensive - almost $30.00 a day. Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: 2Cookes
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in conjunction with our cruise to Hawaii. The hotel accomodation was excellent, the front desk staff & concierge were very helpfull. The only downside was a lengthy wait at the airport for the shuttle bus to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to be stranded”
Reviews.Author: Crazyann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Airport Marriott for two nights on my way back to the UK from Kauai as my flights had been cancelled due to hurricane Irene. I just jumped on the first hotel shuttle bus that arrived and was glad that it was to the Marriott. The room was a good size and was immaculate. The best thing about the room was the bed. I have honestly never slept in a bed that was sooooo comfortable. It was so difficult to get out of it, especially after the second night when I had to be up at 5am to catch my flight. It was good having a shop in the hotel as well as Starbucks and a choice of restaurants. There were also a number of tours with pickup from the hotel which made me wish I had been stranded a little longer as there was so much I would have like to have seen. Room service was fast and the food was excellent! The only downside of staying here was that the room price virtually doubled for a Sunday night, making it an expensive stop off.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cozy”
Reviews.Author: ahdoshi
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located very near to the los angeles LAX airport, they have a free shuttle service to and fro to the airport, very friendly staff rooms were a bit small in size but very comfortable and cozy, food will be a problem if you are a pure vegetarian person like me, else an absolute stay recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great place especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: gombo_11
Reviews.Content: great location - free shuttle from airport; walked to ocean beach, walked to town

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Carla J
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in order to spend the day with a friend from Australia who had full day's layover on her way home. The room was very clean, the bed and bedding very comfortable. I choose it because it offered a free shuttle to and from the airport. Nice selection of restaurants in the lobby, as well as Starbucks. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Probably not where you want to stay for an extended visit to LA since you are a bit of a ways from any of the tourist/sightseeing areas. This wasn't an issue for us because we scheduled a private tour which picked us up from the hotel. The only negative aspect was my friend requested her room to be next to mine (I had booked first) but when she checked in, this had not been done and she couldn't even get a room on the same floor as me.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware - extra fees”
Reviews.Author: ewiart
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, very clean, the staff is very nice... The only thing you must know about the hotel, is that nothing is included. When I was booking they said in their website they offer parking, breakfeast and internet on you room. Yes they do but nothing is included on your price. Parking is 25$/night, breakfeast 15$/night and internet 14$/night. It is important to think about the distances in LA, this hotel is not very close to the main attractions, but nothing is close to nothing in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and hotel for transit stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jennine D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot while on route to Canada in July and August this year and found the hotel to be above par in quality and service. The rooms were very nice and the desk staff very helpful and accommodating. Before visiting this hotel we read Trip Advisor's reviews and unless you are a particularly fussy person who is after 5 star plus service then I find it difficult to read some of the hotel criticisms with any confidence. This place was fantastic and served our needs very well. We will absolutely book to stay here again anytime we do the long-haul trip to North America and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is quite nice, but lacks in location.”
Reviews.Author: RADARSHE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location countless times. The front desk staff, room cleaning crew, and restaurant staff are all very nice. Rooms are clean and the A/C and heating works well year around. The restaurant and sports bars are a bit pricey, but again service is great and the food good. The gym is quite nice. If you don't like it, you are too picky. While in the gym, try the excellent fruit and fruit flavored water. Lots of parking, including valet. Location- There is good public bus service to the rest of the city and a very large mall. The business center is more than adequate and the staff helpful. Very nice and relaxing pool. There are numerous restaurants to walk to in about 5-15 minutes, ask at the concierge desk. If you have a car, this might be the right place for you. If you are stuck at the airport or need a stop over hotel while waiting for a flight, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kit001_10
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room, concierge and reception staff were wonderful and very helpful, on bus line to santa monica. Bus stop outside door. We were on a special occasion and they went out of their way to make our stay memorable. If ever fly through LAX again will definately stay here again. Could not fault it

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind the long shuttle bus wait time and poor bell boy service upon arrival, this place would be excellent.”
Reviews.Author: PJONG
Reviews.Content: Arrived at LAX after a long 16 hours flight/transit and had to wait 40 minutes for the shuttle bus to arrive. During the wait we saw Hilton shuttle bus passed us by 3 times. 30 minutes through the wait, we call the hotel but were plainly told there should be one coming. We were told that the shuttle bus usually takes 30 to 45 minutes. When the shuttle did arrived, there were so many hotel guests that wanted to get in and some just couldn't because it was full. Unfortunate for those that couldn't get on, they would have to wait again that 30-45 minutes. Upon arrival on the hotel, there was no bell boy at sight or any on standby to greet us to see if we need any assistance. We had to go for a hunt for one. Most guests just unhappily haul their own luggages. Except for the two services mentioned above, all other services we experienced were excellent. The room was clean even thought it look old. The breakfast was way above excellent. The waitress was extremely helpful and friendly. We were very impressed. The fitness room was well equipped with ample supply of fresh towers. Overall, we love this hotel as a great rest stop that's close to LAX if only we could ignore the lengthy shuttle bus wait time and poor arrival greetings.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot LAX”
Reviews.Author: rjkazoo
