Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel...booked thru priceline and although I'm not sure if we got a killer deal it was a great hotel that was clean with comfy beds, and great location. It appeared to be used as a crew hotel for the airline industry so I'm sure they have to be up to par! The only downside is the parking...they get you for 25.00 daily so if you can help it leave the car at home!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for a one-night lay-over in LA.”
Reviews.Author: thehiep
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this airport hotel on our way back from Southeast Asia, in transit waiting for our next flight back home in Texas. It's a decent and inexpensive lay-over, one notch better than it's sister, The Courtyard Marriott, one block away. We paid $119 for the night, compared to $99 otherwise at The Courtyard. Breakfast was not complimentary. The room is small, as expected, but the reception area is unexpectedly large, as large and good looking as several other 5-star hotels. The staff at the reception desk is professional and courteous, though not as warm or welcoming as they should be. The transfer shuttle to the airport is efficient, on time, and our driver was pretty nice and helpful. Other than that, nothing else is extraordinary, except for the really convenience of the location. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next needed lay-over.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't prepared for how busy this hotel was on a Saturday”
Reviews.Author: mushuBelfast
Reviews.Content: I have used the LAX Marriott a number of times and found it to be the ideal hotel to stay at when arriving at LAX late at night or having to catch an early morning flight. They have one of the best outdoor swimming pools that I have come across and I was quite looking forward to using it. However when I arrived on the Saturday afternoon I was shocked at the size of the crowd of people in the pool area. There seemed to be some very large groups and of course a group of young males who took over the pool and fired a ball about often disturbing others in the pool area. Decided not to bother with the pool. Normally we would eat in the evening at the Sports Bar, however there was a problem here as well; they had a restricted menu, a choice of 4 or 5 items. When I enquired, the reason I was given was that the hotel was holding a Camp Hollywood competition and there were 800 people involved and they would have to eat at short notice that evening. Perhaps that had also something to do about the crowds at the pool? I wish I had been warned about this at check-in or at some stage in advance. However I don't think its an easy area to go out and find a restaurant late in the evening so the choices were restricted.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable, not special”
Reviews.Author: Umfalotta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before a very early flight out of LAX. The hotel served the purpose, but we wouldn't necessarily stay there again. The parking lot and entrance were bustling at night, which made it kind of challenging to unload bags for check-in. Check-in itself was easy and the service at the desk was very good and efficient, as was booking on the phone and all interactions with desk staff. Our main issues with the hotel were that we weren't entirely sure our room was fresh when we checked in late in the evening -- it felt as if someone else may have briefly checked in and out of the room before our arrival, and there were dishes in the hallway outside of our door. Because this is very much an airport hotel and probably has late arrivals/early departures for people going to or from the airport, we heard doorways slamming and people coming and going in the hallway throughout the night. The shuttle to and from LAX didn't run as frequently as we were told it would. And if you're trying to make an early flight, you might want to allow extra time beyond what the hotel suggests because the shuttles were packed the morning we left. When we came outside to catch the shuttle at 5 a.m., there were at least 30 people already waiting, and when a shuttle finally did come, it filled up leaving most of us still in a growing line. We had to wait for another shuttle to come, and people were getting anxious.

Reviews.Title: “Got Everything Right”
Reviews.Author: charli3601
Reviews.Content: Less than 5 minutes shuttle ride from LAX. Busy hotel but prompt check in. i am Marriott platinum and was upgraded to executive suite. Room had extra towels and foam pillows as was requested at the time of reservation. This virtually never happens and I usually have to call housekeeping. Management and staff know what they are doing and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: Souris
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in this hotel where we stayed for an early morning flight out of LAX. The 1970â€™s looking exterior left us with low expectations, but when we entered, this hotel pleasantly surprised us. It is a very nice, high quality Marriott, and much better than the Manhattan Beach Marriott where we usually stay when flying into & out of LAX. Unlike the Manhattan Beach Marriott, this hotel had a lot of staff at your service, and a special area for Elite Member check-in. We used Reward Points, and as Platinum Elite members, we were upgraded to a beautiful King room on the 18th Floor with access to the very nice Concierge Lounge on the 16th. Our very large room seemed newly renovated with clean carpeting and upholstery in red & gold tones. However, the bathroom was very small & one wonders why they didnâ€™t make it about 12â€� larger, which would have still made the room a very large one. The sink area had no door for privacy. Beyond the sink, and with a door, was the toilet and tub/shower combo in an area so tight, one had to maneuver into the room to get the door shut. While the sink area seemed newly renovated, the bathtub/shower was rather dated. Our room (1828) had a view of the LAX runways. At times, we could hear planes taking off, but the noise was not a terrible problem for us. The hotel lobby had two restaurants and a bar as well as a very nice gift shop. We didn't eat in the restaurants here, and while we did consider the bar, the noise-level was so high that we opted for the quiet Concierge Lounge instead. There was a Hertz drop-off location at the hotel, which we found very convenient. The hotel offers free shuttle service to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “This is a swell Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: statue1
Reviews.Content: Great renovation on an older Hotel. The rooms are great, well appointed with HD TV's and all the amenities, the pool area rivals Las Vegas without the Bars. I only stayed 1 nite but I'll go back if I need to catch an early flight and don't want to risk the early freeway crush.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: allok2beok
Reviews.Content: We spent one night there on our arrival for our California/Hawaii trip and two nights on our return. I have stayed there before and thought it was a reasonable hotel for an airport stay but this time I thought it was excellent. We managed to get a very good deal price wise which always helps and the checkin was quick and efficient. The rooms have obviously been renovated and were very clean, the public areas are extremely nice and relaxed and the buffet breakfast about the best I have had in any type of hotel in the past ten years. We are silver members and were upgraded to the Concierge floor so maybe our room was better than other floors. The staff were helpful and very courteous and overall we were really pleased to have picked this hotel for our stopovers. Also extremely convenient for the airport. The only fly in the ointment were some of the staff in the bar/cafe who were certainly not great. Otherwise well done Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: amberandchamois
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a small medical conference in early September 2010. The front desk was efficient and gracious. The room was clean and very well appointed. The bed was very comfortable and had nice linens. The hotel was very quiet considering that it is very close to the airport---I could not hear the planes as they took off or landed. The conference was well-organized and supplied by the hotel staff (at least as it appeared to me). The business center was a big plus for me as I needed to ship some articles. In-room dining was nothing special but it was not bad and arrived within their stated timeframe. Starbucks in lobby was a nice surprise and there was computers and printers in the lobby to print out your boarding passes. Shuttle to the terminals was efficient and on-time. All in all, a very good hotel for those airport-type hotels that otherwise can be very de-personalized and not very efficient. The room rate was reasonable, given the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Viajera048
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the LAX Marriott via their courtesy shuttle and this was my first positive impression related to service. Even though my arrival at the property was much earlier than their check in time, the front desk was courteous enough to assign me a room- what she called a handicapped room - and I was able to rest for a while after a long trip from Florida. The room was impecable and the double beds were made the Marriott way - no bedspreads- but plenty of soft pillows and a down comforter. To me it was a pleasure to have a small fridge, and a coffee maker that was kept well supplied during my 8 day stay. It was a business trip and the service provided during the main meals of the day was exceptional. My favorite spot was the Sports Bar after a long busy day, and the menu was not only affordable but also quite tasty for a bar. I highly recommend the chicken quesadillas!! The location is perfect and within walking distance of public transportation as well as the Manhattan Beach trolly. We took trips to Santa Monica and Manhattan Beach for a fraction of what any taxi would have charged us. The pool area is relaxing and inviting, and the lobby provides airline computer kiosks for advance check in, and boarding passes. Every night was restful thanks to the quality of bedding- and I must mention, the bath and body works products in the bathroom were a pleasant surprise. I can't wait to go back to the LAX Marriott. Housekeeping staff was A+.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Thomas1968_o
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, nice staff, perfect service. A good place to stay when travelling with good shuttle service and perfect and very motivated drivers. If needed we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thegangs
Reviews.Content: Location not good if you have at least two days to spare. We're very happy with all the concierge staff especially Alejandro. He is so helpful and very friendly. He introduced us to Miguel who looked after us unfortunately we were not able to say goodbye when we left. Blanca at the club lounge is very sweet.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was exceptionally helpful from the time we arrived.”
Reviews.Author: MMsoccer
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in early thanks to Alma-the desk clerk. She was mentoring a new employee but it did not slow our registration at all. It made all the difference to get to our room early and start our day. Alma was helpful and gracious a very nice experience. The concierge was knowledgeable and directions great. We got our car right at the hotel. The one let down was the lack of selection in regard to wine by the glass in Champs-mediocre. We did have a nice meal there typical bar food but nicely done. i thought the restaurant JW's was a bit pricey and limited as was Latitudes. However it was in keeping with the area. The beds were very comfortable. The lamps could be turned off/on at the base-great for reading in bed. the soap,shampoo,etc. were lovely. these are small things but I've been traveling so much lately small thins matter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: jcresq
Reviews.Content: I"ve probably stayed here 15 times in the last 25 years. Great facility...beautiful pool and grounds. But on my last trip, the service was lacking. It appears to be much more of layover spot for flight crews than a place for business travelers. Took me hours to get a fax sent...the business center closed at 8 (though the book in the room says it's open until 11), and the lobby was so crowded with flight attendant and pilots checking in, even at the Elite desk, that it wasn't worth the wait. Room service was slow. On the plus side, Marriott really does honor its guarantee that you will find the lowest rates on its site; I found a site that offered rooms there for $105, when the lowest rate on Marriott.com was $219; Marriott gave me the room for 25% off the 105. So, I can't complain about the rate, and would stay there again, just with lower expectations for getting work done.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: taliabunting
Reviews.Content: We had a bit of a mess when our travel agency messed up our flights to our honeymoon. They put us up in this hotel and the Marriott just took care of us. They upgraded us to a better room and fed us breakfast. We loved it. We had a junior suite and it was lovely. The pool was clean and nice. The hotel has three restaurants and a starbucks. The staff are amazing, so helpful. We caught a bus to downtown Santa Monica for the afternoon - it was all very easy. We really enjoyed our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst-ever Check-in Experience”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneYankee
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the LAX Marriott just after 11:00PM on Friday, June 17, we found ourselves at the back of a check-in line of almost thirty people. Initially, there were two Marriott employees at the check-in counter (excluding those handling airline crew members), but one took a phone call, walked away, and wasn't seen again. No dedicated check-in line for Marriott Rewards Elite members was open at the time we arrived at the hotel. Despite having made our reservation directly with the hotel, it was not in order (they had our check in date as the 18th, not the 17th), and it took the check-in clerk more than five minutes to find this for us (I was made to feel that this was my problem, not the hotel's). More than forty minutes after arriving at the LAX Marriott, we were finally in our room, which I believe is an unacceptable and inexcusable amount of time to check in to any hotel (let alone a Marriott, Sheraton, Hilton, etc.). By American standards, the room was small, and the bathroom even moreso. The bed was comfortable (as per expectations). l still have Elite status with Marriott Rewards (only Silver, after many years of achieving either Gold or Platinum status), and have 650 Total Membership Nights credited by Marriott. Despite this, the next time when stopping over at LAX on the way back to Australia, I will choose another airport hotel in which to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel after a long flight.”
Reviews.Author: Jillybobz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it was one of the nearest to the airport. from Leaving our house to getting to the LA hotel was 24.5 hours and all we wanted to do was sleep. Pity that's all we did as the room or suite should I say (we only booked a room through Thomas Cook at Â£58) we could have stayed all fortnight. It was one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in and the freebies in the bathroom were ace. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: travelsmith505
Reviews.Content: We sometimes stay at LAX hotels the night before an early morning departure, which eases the hassle of traffic and parking. Our room at the Marriott was clean, comfortable and quiet. Their parking package includes valet parking, with the option to text your ticket number upon return so that they have your car ready for you once you hop off the airport shuttle. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very small room”
Reviews.Author: Green098
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night in May. We only spent about 10 hours in the room because we left early the next morning. The room was clean but the pillows were a bit uncomfortable. I found the room very small for the price that we had to pay and the AC was sort of in the bathroom which was strange. The room felt very cramped compared to other hotels we stayed on our trip. In terms of noise, we didn't notice any sound and could sleep well through out the night. There is a free shuttle bus but for some reason, we had to wait about 30 mins to catch it from the airport. We kept seeing other hotel shuttle buses drive by several times and even wondered whether we needed to catch a taxi instead. The shuttle bus showed up just when we were about to see how else to get to the hotel. I don't know if it was just that night or the shuttle buses to LAX marriot are just less frequent. I think this hotel ok for a quick stay like ours and if you got a good deal for th enight. But if you have to park your car, please note parking is very expensive. That was the reason why we decided to pick up our hire car the next morning instead of paying the expensive parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott, to thrills, but no bad surprises either.”
Reviews.Author: tooreck
Reviews.Content: If you're used to full-service Marriotts and need an LAX airport stay, this may be a choice for you (but check adjacent Renaissance first!) - all you can expect from the chain, at sometimes high prices (location). Stayed there many times and prices can jump up and down, unless you've got company rate. Overall, very decent choice around LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Don't sleep in a room next to the elevators!!”
Reviews.Author: Coralreeff
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 1 child(2years) got a room (1210) direct next to the elevators!! Result was: al night hard noise from the elevators. It is so loud that we could not sleep (because of early flight we had to stand up at 5 am). It was better if we kept the 130 dollar and slept on the airport.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avocat1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights earlier this year. Great rooms and an even better pool area! The only down side was asking for 2 bubbly glasses to be brought to the room only to be told there would be a service charge of $3.50. I was then told I could go downstairs to the bar and get them myself free of charge (which I did). Whatever happened to hotel service? And when will hotels get over themselves and start offering free wireless internet?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mysteryjam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before catching a flight the next day from LAX. The room was big enough, and clean. The beds very comfy and we had a good night's sleep. Despite the proximity to the airport, there was not much noise. We ate in the bar and also Starbucks in the lobby. There is free wifi in the lobby but not in the room (aaargh!). The airport shuttle was quick and efficient. There is a TV screen outside where you can see the shuttle buses on a map - so you know where they are, and when the next one will arrive!

Reviews.Title: “very thin towels!”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviews06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight in Feb 2011. We booked it through one of the airlines. The room was average, bed was comfortable, but the towels were so thin - not the standard we would have expected from a 4* hotel. We stayed at the Westin LAX (also rated 4*) on a previous occasion, and the room was far more superior than one at Marriott. Quite disappointed at the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepy after long flight”
Reviews.Author: cynwynn
Reviews.Content: We at a long flight and were arriving late to LA. We choose the Marriott based on location. The hotel was super simple to get to. The bed was comfy and the rooms were clean. Very stylish lobby and sitting areas. We had a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: glove3776
Reviews.Content: You will never top the staff at this hotel! I am a conference planner and spend about 30-40 nights a year at the LAX Marriott and still love it. You will never get better service from the banquet staff to the concierges to the bell staff. They treat everyone like VIPs! One thing I also love is the gift shop in the hotel. Although small, it always has the most unique and fun gifts. The biggest complaint I hear is that you cannot really walk anywhere, especially at night. The fairly new Manhattan Beach Shuttle definitely remedies that. For $5, my attendees can go shopping, the movies and have a huge selection of restaurants. I cannot say anything but positive things about this hotel! It's like coming home...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Gushkub
Reviews.Content: Hotel was way below normal Marriott standard of quality. The bathroom sink was clogged, The shower ceiling was molded and dirty, the elevators were not functional, the room heater was not working on a cold night, the breakfast food in the hotel restaurant was way below average. It was definitely over priced for the $219 rate that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient no hassle option”
Reviews.Author: Runninguy1011
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a kind of retro deco feel to it. Some might think it dated but I actually thought it cool. The shuttle from LAX was convenient and from the hotel the car rental places are very close. The room was of a good standard. Our room looked out to the west towards LAX and the airfield activity was fun to watch. There was some aircraft noise in the evening and in the morning but LAX goes quiet overnight. The hotel gym is one of the best around. There was free WiFi in the lobby but not the room. Its a good option for a quick stop but of course its probably not a part of town for hanging around for a longer stay. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great service”
Reviews.Author: jackiesamy
Reviews.Content: I was for 1 night in a business trip in this hotel and the location is excellent, the hotel has a private shuttle in and out to the airport, very helpful the consier and theeverybody in the hotel, the breakfast is excellent, for lunch the prices were a little price and not that good of a food, but it was ok for me. very efficient staff, n general, make you feel a super guest. I am an elite member and they allowed me to saty some extra hours after check out, I thank you for that, since my conencting flight was very late at night, it did really help a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sk9758
Reviews.Content: I used my free certificate for a one night stay before an ultra long haul flight. Its one of the nearest hotels to LAX and a friend of mine dropped me to the hotel in his car. He must have parked his car for barely 30 min and was charged 14 dollars for that time!!!! Overnight valet parking for 24 hours is 32 dollars! I find this a real rip off as its much cheaper to park in Hollywood and Beverly Hills. The lobby is big and they have a separate check in for Marriott Rewards elite card holders which is manned from 3pm onwards only. Being Platinum Elite, I checked in there and was told I had been upgraded to an executive suite. I was also very happy that they accepted my request for a late check out. Being a weekend the concierge lounge was closed but this property at least gave me coupons to have breakfast in the restaurant- something quite inconsistent in other Marriotts â€“ some offer some donâ€™t. I proceeded to my room and here started the trek through a maze of corridors which made me realize the sheer size of this hotel. I thoroughly regretted the upgrade as the suite was in one far end of the maze of corridors. It had a small living room with a large dining table for 8 people taking half the space â€“ making no sense at all. It had a view of the neighboring building. I would have really preferred taking a regular room facing the airport especially since it was for one night. The hotel is quite dated and so was the room. The electric outlets were very loose and finding a suitable one to charge my 220 volt appliances was not an easy task. Breakfast was nothing special â€“ the usual hot breakfast - but the service was excellent. I returned to my room in the afternoon and the key was not working. The check in staff had forgotten to program the key for a late check out. I had to trek all the way back to front desk to get it done. At check out I was utterly shocked to see that they had charged me a dollar each time I had called a toll free 1-800 number for gaining access. In all my 20 years of stays in Marriott hotels â€“ ranging from Residence Inn to JW Marriott Marquis properties, not a single one had ever charged this. The front desk staff however proceeded to remove it only because I was a platinum elite member. Overall there is nothing special about this property expect for the excellent staff behavior and attitude. I definitely would not be staying here during my next transit in LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. TERRIBLE shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: ord737fo
Reviews.Content: I stay here all the time because my company books me there. The hotel is really pretty nice all on all. It is difficult to communicate with alot of the staff because of the language barrier but overall it's clean and comfortable. The shuttle service is a subcontractor called Destination Shuttle Services. They are the weak link. It can take from 25-45 minutes for a 10 minute rude to the airport or back. You can call the hotel all day and they'll just say " 10 more minutes" I would stay here if I hada rental car or alot of spare time Allow an hour to get to the airport if you don't want to be rushed.

Reviews.Title: “best bet for LAX”
Reviews.Author: suami_intan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 4 minutes by car to international terminal at LAX. The hotel is also quite good from the logistical point of view. It has 2 restaurants, 1 sports bar, 1 Starbucks and 1 gift shop with good selection of beverages and snacks. The room is quite nice for an airport hotel, basic but clean. Bathroom is very small but is normal for airport hotel.The hotel is located between two LAX runways, so aircraft noise can bother some people.The view from the room can be spectacular as we can watch many aircraft take off and landing from all over the world. the breakfast selection were very good but were very heavy and not many options for lighter fares. The staff were very professional and prompt. They were always looking for people to assist. If your budget is USD 120-140, then this is your hotel for you in LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great service”
Reviews.Author: LSUFAN67
Reviews.Content: Marriott LAX was great location. Very centrally located. Was there for a conference at the LA Convention Center. Free LAX shuttle. Used local car service as apposed to renting. It was cheaper than rental and parking. Staff was friendly and Comceirage Lounge was well stocked and had a great breakfest for MR customers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: lalotp
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and the 5 star service we received from EVERYONE we encountered in the staff. The hote lis great and it is a GEM near LAX. Rooms are rather simple and no frills, but greart pool and in-property dining/leisure options for teens, adults and young children. The shuttle service staff is also GRRRREAT!

Reviews.Title: “We missed the Courtyard Marriott Long Beach”
Reviews.Author: laura790
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's an airport hotel. But - it's not cheap. The lobby is nice (although single story) - there is also a large shop and three restaurants. The room first. We checked in with a coupon for the night (but under an elite reservation). We were told we were getting concierge accommodations, which silly me, i thought meant nicer than usual. We got to our room. We did have a partial view thanks to the 15th floor, but the room was absolutely claustrophobic. The bathroom literally did not allow more than one person at a time, and the furniture was crowding the room. The refrigerator didn't work. I called and maintenance was a no-show. The bed was much less comfortable than the one at the Marriott Courtyard Long Beach - didn't realize how good we had it. On the plus side - free work out, which isn't so common these days. Another down side - they charged for internet access. Glad I have my Droid hot spot. Finally, the breakfast restaurant had one woman on the critical path for the whole place. While empty tables abounded, people were stacked to the entrance waiting on tables. Once we got seated, the buffet food was decent and our server was good. If you do stay here and want to drop off a rental car first, know that the rental car street is right next to the Marriott. We wished we would have dropped off our rental car and then had the shuttle drop us on the corner (saw someone do that too late) - the parking was expensive and we paid extra for more rental car time than we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophia4
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a night before our trip out of LA. Very nice hotel, reasonably priced. Great for our purpose. We found it on Tripadvisor and were quite happy with the choice, reviews were accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport layover option â€“ Canâ€™t beat a Marriott bed”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at this property for 1 night â€“ checked in around 11:00 pm and checked out the following morning around 9:30 am. The front desk staff were friendly and fast, and they informed me that only one restaurant was open that Sunday night and would close at midnight. Luckily, I had already eaten. My one-bedroom suite seemed a bit dark and claustrophobic. It needed a light dusting in my opinion. The bathroom seemed really small and awkward, but the shower pressure was good and it had hot water. Iâ€™ve always been a fan of the â€œOrange Ginger Aromatherapy Bath & Body worksâ€� products. While not the trendiest room I have ever stayed in, I slept well in the king-sized bed. The two flat-screen TVs had lots of channels and I did not hear any plane noise. I explored the pool area and it really was rather pretty. I would have stayed longer, if the winter sun had reached the sun deck. I went for a walk around the conference room area and bumped into several friendly staff members. The conference space seemed a little dark and depressing. I didnâ€™t have time to try out the gym. I enjoyed the high-quality breakfast in the concierge lounge â€“ a nice spread of breads impressed me, and the room was quite large. There were also two computers in the room, attached to printers. You could also ask for the WiFi code. This was one of the better conceriege lounges Iâ€™ve tried. If you turn left outside the hotel, there are a couple of fast-food restaurants within a 10-minute walk. Not much else except other airport hotels. There was a bus-stop close by. The free shuttle bus runs every half-hour and also stops at the Renaissance hotel. Journey was very quick, but security at LAX was very, very slow, so give yourself plenty of time. This is a nice airport property and offered excellent value for money. A solid 3 Â½ out of 5 stars. I would stay here again if I had an early morning flight out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Do not except much. Good for one night only”
Reviews.Author: saopaulo36
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay near the airport because of your flight connections, ok fine you can stay at the Marriot. But don't expect much. The hotel is good for this single purpose and for one night only! Staff, which staff??? Rooms are small and dark. The hotel is not very clean even though the room was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Westin”
Reviews.Author: MacVenture
Reviews.Content: I've got the top tier status with Marriott and Westin. Having recently stayed at the Westin at LAX I thought I'd give the Marriott a try. While I was underwhelmed with rooms at both properties I was struck by a few things at the Marriott that give it an edge over the Westin: -The staff really is on the ball at the Marriott. They acknowledged my status and gave me a top floor and access to the lounge on 16 - I can remember the Westin guy almost asleep at check in. -Hallway carpet is 70's Vegas, but the room was slightly nicer and less worn than the Westin. -Westin lounge was tired and lame - Marriott had a nice spread of food and beverage options.

Reviews.Title: “Well run”
Reviews.Author: josch1122
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large and caters mostly to people flying out of LAX. Saw many airline crews checking in and out. Ate at two of the restaurants in the lobby, both were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo!”
Reviews.Author: StewardessFl
Reviews.Content: Airport shuttle takes minutes, runs every half hour. Hertz counter right in hotel. $35 Vallet parking very timely. All staff, no matter WHO you interacted with, were superior. Starbucks right in lobby. Salon great. Gift store had all we needed overnight wise. Busy place, bustling lobby. Free late checkout till 2pm! Do what others wrote. Plan 3 hours from hotel to plane gate. It's a very crowded slow go.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable hotel -- at best”
Reviews.Author: suzieandkhan311
Reviews.Content: When we booked they asked me what floor we wanted to be on and our proximity to the elevator. I said, "near the top floor and close to the elevator" So, of course, they put us on the ground floor (which is actually a floor below lobby level) and as far as possible from the elevators. The rooms were small and our only view was of the wheels of the buses in the parking lot. The staff was ok. The price was reasonable. Overall, I would only stay there if you had a short overnight layover at LAX

Reviews.Title: “Good airport-hotel for stopovers”
Reviews.Author: cacktusjack
Reviews.Content: One night prior to our flight to Hawaii we stayed at the Marriott Los Angeles Airport. Itâ€™s quite a large airport-hotel and they offer shuttle-service to the terminal. Check-In was impersonal but we were lucky there were no large queues at the moment. The rooms are quite small and the bathroomâ€™s ceiling is extremely low but for one night we found it OK. The bed was one highlight: comfortable and loaded with lots of differen pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Room quality is not as per Marriott standards.”
Reviews.Author: maheshljain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in my Christmas trip to LA and had a lot of expectation since it was a 5 start hotel near LAX airport but was very much disappointed with the room quality. It was not at all as per Marriott standards. There were below problems I faced: - Cold air was leaking from patio door. Whole night we had a problem. - They had CRT Television in room with no HD. we were expecting that it will atleast have HDTV Plasma TV. - Even the basic internet is charged and not free - They just kept 1 soap in bathroom with no additional Body wash. - The room are smaller compare to any other motel or five start hotel room - They charge high parking fees of $23 per day per car. - They didn't have any child play area Location of this hotel is good. It is near to Airport, Hollywood and Universal Studio.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna1834
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night at this airport hotel. shuttle took a long time for pickup at LAX- we waited over 40 mins. the hotel is huge, nice and clean rooms with small bathroom. good enough for an overnight stay. free wifi in the hotel lobby. takes 5 mins by shuttle to the airport. we paid US$90 a night (booked at wotif.com), so pretty good value at that price.

Reviews.Title: “great, but lukewarm shower...”
Reviews.Author: Foxpup82
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the LAX Mariott. I come through LA once a year on my way from Australia to NY, and like to try out different hotels each time. The staff was fantastic - very attentive, this is one place you'll never hear the words,"That's not my department." This goes forveveryone Imet on staff, from the custodian to the Valera to the desk staff. The room was really attractive, and clean as could be. I did pay $12.75 for wordless Internet, but the connection speed was fast, so I didn't mind too much. They also have WiFi for free in th hotel lobby area. The bed was wonderfully comfortable, and there was a separate rollout desk so you position it anyway you wanted, which was nice since I like to watch TV while I work on my laptop. everything was great till I used the shower- the water only got barely lukewarm. I jumped in the moment it started getting a little warm ( after the long haul flight, you are desperate for a hot shower)., but it never got even close to comfortable. it was the fastest shower of my life! upon checkout, I mentioned this problem to the clerk, who said that next time I stayed, theybwould make sure I got a room with a working hot shower. Does this mean I unwittingly was booked into a "lukewarm shower" room? I was surprised that they weren't more concerned; I will be writing the management a letter, although it's too late for me, perhaps they can fix this problem. I would still recommend the hotel despite the shower problem, as everything else was A+. Just make sure to run the water and test it before getting in!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for parking package”
Reviews.Author: foxmooder
Reviews.Content: Got the park and fly special, which is one night stay plus 7 nights valet parking while we flew for vacation. Customer service was excellent! Room was small but nice. Shuttle service was prompt, did not wait for long. Will stay again if we fly from lax. Could hear airplane noise though but it did not bother us. Would give 5 star if room was bigger. Maybe free breakfast would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott - Nice Staff - Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ViaggioGirl
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is pretty typical but the rooms are smaller than most Marriotts, as are the bathrooms. It's a very large, busy hotel but the staff at the front desk were very nice and welcoming. I expected a long wait but they had my keys and points staement ready upon my arrival. The concierge lounge is very big with a great breakfast selection. Meeting facilities are in the basement and are not exactly fresh feeling. There is pretty much no cell reception in the meeting facilities which makes it hard to do business. Hotel is very convenient to the airport with a free shuttle and a very nice and helpful driver.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the last minute”
Reviews.Author: ablove
Reviews.Content: We were re-routed through LAX on our trip home from Puerto Vallarta and had to spend the night. We picked the Marriott as we always have a good experience at all of its brands. This stay was no exception. The complimentary airport shuttle was extremely convenient; the front desk staff was pleasant and helpful; the room was very clean with a balcony overlooking the lovely pool and courtyard; and the food at one of the hotel's restaurants was very good, albeit somewhat expensive. The restaurant was called Latitude 33 and we ate dinner and breakfast there. In fact, our dinner was actually one of our favorites on our whole trip, including where we ate in the Puerto Vallarta area. So for some good food and a good night's rest conveniently located by LAX, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: fitness4life
Reviews.Content: I'm on a professional swing dance team and we stay at this hotel every year for the Camp Hollywood dance competitions. I have been 2 years in a row and really enjoy the hotel. There's a Starbucks inside, and a couple restaurants (expensive though). Not much within walking distance, but if you have a car, you can drive to other places to eat that are close by. Also, if you want a refrigerator in your room, you may have to put in a special request. I had one in my room the first year, but not the 2nd. Overall, I enjoy staying here. The rooms are very clean and it's easy access to freeways and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: PersVancouver
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, Great pool area and very friendly and helpful staff. I got ripped off by a Santa Monica Cab company and the hotel paid the difference. They went above and beyond their role. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for stopover/transit in LAX”
Reviews.Author: liss0502
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night (and day) at the Marriott LAX, after our plane from LA to Sydney was cancelled (room paid for by the airline). Despite this being an unscheduled stay, the hotel and it's staff made it as pleasant as they possibly could! Upon check-in at 1:30am, reception staff were sympathetic and cheerful (despite dealing with about 50 grumpy passengers from the cancelled flight), and went over and above to ensure we all had everything we needed (toothpaste, toothbrush, deodorant, etc - as our bags could not be retrieved from the airline). Breakfast was decent. Room was clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. Our rescheduled flight was not until 10pm the following evening, so the gorgeous pool area in the hotel made the time-wasting during the day much more tolerable! Less than 5 mins to international terminal (drive). Excellent sleep quality for an airport hotel. Recommended hotel for anyone needing to stay a night at LAX (while transiting, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Two things not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: OOBonomist
Reviews.Content: It is fine except that the air-conditioning never really got cool enough. I think it's one of those systems where if the outside ambient termperatutre goes below a certain point, the compressor turns off. Also, the pool -- besides being one of those wacky shapes that makes it impossible to swim laps unless one of your arms is shorter than the other -- had more chlorine than any pool I've been in since the 1980s. Even more than the Washington DC drinking water. A word to travelers who are taking cabs to their destination the next morning (as opposed to the two other options LA offers -- renting a car or walking). Don't hang at the main entrance if there is a line, which moves slowly. Simply walk down the driveway to where the cabs are waiting. Faster, and you save the obligatory doorman tip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Travelbeat
Reviews.Content: Within a very few minutes of the airport (LAX) this is the busiest hotel I have every stayed at but they pull it off without a hitch. They have three good restaurants (sports bar, steakhouse, and QSR) and room service. I have a room facing the airport and I hear no planes so it is quiet. The sports bar is buzzing each night with lots of people, both hotel guests and non-guests. Starbucks opens at 5 AM which is good for us east coasters who wake up at 4 AM :( It also has a nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Airport layover”
Reviews.Author: sasquatch27
Reviews.Content: Great spot for a layover, big room with wonderful bed with an exceptional view of the runway. Airport shuttle was prompt and effective and check in and out flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: row481
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lovely warm feel about it. The lobby area is comfortable and inviting. Sometimes I find front desk staff very formal but not here. They were friendly and fun but importantly efficient and super helpful. The rooms are small but the beds are sooo comfortable. The bell staff were also very friendly and helpful. I suppose I don't expect much from an airport hotel so I was really surprised about how good it was. Location is pretty good really. We jumped on the bus just outside the hotel and went to Santa Monica for the day. It was $1 each- so cheap. Bus trip was fun watching all the different people get on an off.

Reviews.Title: “The Best LAX Airport”
Reviews.Author: GoTBGo
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at this hotel when I have early morning departure from LAX. Nice, upscale property with a very high level of customer service. The rooms are basic Marriot. Nothing out of the ordinairy. The bathrooms tend to be quite small however. The concierege lounge is not one of best. Seems to have limitied availability of snacks. The staff has always been very accomodating and helpful. Good shuttle service to airport. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: JMW405
Reviews.Content: Clean facility and friendly staff. However king size bed is really is small queen size. Also no free in-room internet. For free internet, we had to bring our computer down to lobby. Parking is expensive and should be free for hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel, full services”
Reviews.Author: Tripwilmington
Reviews.Content: Staff here very cooperative and responded to our request for a quiet room. There are conventions at this hotel. If you have an inside room and people are noisy at the pool you will hear it.

Reviews.Title: “route66 days 15,16,17”
Reviews.Author: john-suffolk2
Reviews.Content: typical marriot, clean tidy, good staff and expensive to eat and drink. bathroom was the smallest we had on our entire trip, along with the room, fine for one night or to access the airport but lacking in style and ambeance to finish our tour. pool was a nice surprise lovely and warm although we did not see the pool boy so had to go in to order drinks pity marriot charge for internet access, all the budget hotels give it free now, i ended up in starbucks to update our blogg nice hotel, about 30 mins from the action of downtowmn but nothing to shout about unless you are a plane spotter

Reviews.Title: “Excellent short term stopover”
Reviews.Author: SusieV33
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with 12 year old twin boys en route from London to NZ (one night stop over). Good points: > Pool-warm and large -very clean > Service > Lovely sheets > Only had to pay US $75 for late check out at 1800 hrs > Starbucks on site Bad points: None really-and believe me I am fussy! Restaurant meals seemed expensive I guess-but I imagine fairly standard pricing for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Kaya11
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. What great value! I was in LA for a few days and had an early morning departure so decided to stay in a hotel close to the airport. This hotel is large, providing several dining options. The pool and lounging area are wonderful. The rooms are a good size, perhaps just a tad outdated but certainly pleasant, and the bed was by far the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. I got a package that included valet parking so I didn't have to worry about that cost, which some of the other reviewers have pointed out, can be expensive. Breakfast was also expensive but there are so many other options in the area you can always go someplace else. The health club has a variety of machines and is clean. The cardio machines have personal TV monitors and complimentary earphones are provided. It is an airport hotel but I hardly noticed any noise from planes. The real jewel in this hotel though is the service. Everyone I came in contact with, the clerk at check-in, the parking attendants, the staff in the restaurants, housekeeping, were all magnificent. Even the people dusting and sweeping late at night took the time to smile and say hello. After ordering breakfast in the restaurant the first morning, the server remembered how I took my coffee and automatically brought it that way the other two days. I called the "at your service" number to have an iron brought to my room (the one that was there was malfunctioning). I had a new iron in under 5 minutes and there was also a follow-up call to make sure I'd received it. I can't say enough about this place. It is not a luxury hotel but it is definitely worth the money and the great service I experienced all around elevated the level of the stay tremendously. Whoever is in charge of customer service at this hotel should be commended. Job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Two stays and have booked two more stays already!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwipj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed overnight at the Airport Marriott on both our US inward trip from New Zealand and prior to our return. Both stays were excellent. The rooms are a little old fashioned but very clean. The restaurants were good value for money and the service from all the staff we dealt with was top class. Some noise from the pool the first night, but that's about the only negative I can think of. The free shuttle worked a treat with an extremely helpful driver. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, not just an "airport" hotel”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I had a 6:45am flight out of LAX and I live over an hour from the airport so decided to take advatnage of an excellent weekend special and spend a Saturday night at the hotel and afford myself a little extra sleep in the morning. Check-in at the elite desk was seemless, my gold status was recognized instantly and I was given a room on the 16th floor directly overlooking LAX. As an airplane enthusiast, it was pretty nice getting to do some airplane spotting before going to sleep. Shuttle service in the morning was excellent - the shuttle I made it on filled up quickly and the hotel had a back-up right behind for those that did not make it on the first. I didn't have a chance to do more than sleep, but the pool looked quite large and resort-like, not a typical airport hotel pool setup. The fitness center also looked well-equipped. I have no hesitation recommending this particular Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel if you arrive late in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: globalplayer2010
Reviews.Content: We had a late arrival. We got the a nice room, which was quiet and perfect for a good night sleep. The fitness center is quite big and free to use. Staff was friendly. The hotel has a Starbucks Coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating to the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Ace_Coco
Reviews.Content: Spent nearly a week at this location with 4 of my colleagues.. It's great as a business traveler, 24 hour gym, which is completely empty after 7pm (the rush is around 5am), free wifi in the lobby (not in the rooms), with lots of tables with outlets! (key, so many places don't provide outlets, so it's impossible to do a lot of work), starbucks in the lobby, 3 food options. The rooms are a tad small, but I had plenty of room to work at the desk, get around the bed etc. The exterior is from the 60/70's, but inside, you'll have a very standard Marriott affair. Staff were very accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced with no support for kids with allergies”
Reviews.Author: Conrad_NZ
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Marriot LA Airport to stay on the way to London from New Zealand to break up our trip. We had rung ahead from New Zealand and been assured that their restaurant could prepare allergy safe meals and/or allow us to supply our own meals for our peanut allergic 3/12 year old daughter. Once in the restaurant - we were informed that they could not even heat up the canned meal we had bought - let alone prepare an allergy safe meal. Even front desk were unable to do a single thing. I have no idea what other families with kids with allergies do here? I guess your kids have to eat cold canned food. A simple heat in the microwave is we wanted. It seems this is litigious USA gone mad and after a 12 hour flight from NZ, 2 hours through customs (with no line for families), our 2 toddlers were already in meltdown and this restaurant experience is a final nail in the coffin. Ironically, I had been telling my wife that from prior travel experiences in the US, that I had experienced some of the best customer service of anywhere in the world. This has been some of the worst. Add in, price gouging charges for everything else (no free basic TV), portable cot not put up and with no mattress and bedding and I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyway. My only small compliment would be that most of the staff are very nice - but obviously have to adhere to some ridiculous policies and very poor customer service systems to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stayover Destination”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChristy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Jan. 2006 when I was leaving the country and January 2007 when I was returning. My family and friend and I all loved this property. It offers free shuttle service to the airport. They were able to accommodate an early check-in the particular times I went. The pool area in the courtyard is really great. The hot tub is huge! The fitness center is also large and serves water with fruit in it... my mom thought that was fantastic! The rooms are cozy and the beds are extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My Gosh! - I WANT this bed!”
Reviews.Author: cbeckj24
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hotel to attend a seminar. The rooms blocked out for the seminar were $99, but I went to the website and got a $77 advance payment bargain. The lobby is elegant and my room on the 15th floor was small, but delicious. A huge king sized bed, beautiful marble bath, LCD TV, nice desk area, a lovely pool and clean and complete fitness center. The best part was the bed. Soft and firm, comfortable down comforter, great pillows. I wanted to take it home with me. I slept well and woke up refreshed. Only negative was the food. Expensive and over cooked. I finally walked to Carl's Jr for a salad. The quality was the same, but the price was much better. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the airport and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: plarner
Reviews.Content: Last day of our honeymoon and they upgraded us and left us a bottle of wine and fruit in the room, with a card, when we got back from Dinner. Great service to the airport, if only the airport could match it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms--TINY TINY”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: It is obvious this hotel is a relic of the 60's with fresh paint and new linens. While it is very convenient and quite clean, i found the rooms, expecially the bath room to be extraordinarly small. The Courtyard practically across the street is a far, far, far better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for one night in LA”
Reviews.Author: aeclif
Reviews.Content: Used the hotel for one night after flying in from the UK, got a good deal from the Marriott website which included breakfast for two adults and two kids. Easy access to the hotel via the hotel hopper bus, check in was efficent and friendly. Room is typical Marriott style and all areas we veiwed seemed clean and well maintained.Dispite being so close to the airport we didn't hear enough noise to disturb our sleep. Had lunch at the hotel restraunt, food was good but on the expensive side for burger and chips, glad we had the breakfast deal as that was also expensive.If I was passing through LA again I would stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for an overnight stay before a flight. There are a number of restaurants available in the hotel. Close to the hotel is a convenient trolley service to get you to the beach in 20 min or so if interested. The shuttle service from the airport is very convenient and all runs like clockwork. Well done LA for a great travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “LAX Marriott - very friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: arwen973
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in Los Angeles for 5 days to attend a convention in the Hotel. I found it to be very clean and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable and quiet and I had a nice view over the pool area. The restuarants were also very friendly, with a wide range of tastes catered for. I would recommend the Breakfast Buffet in the Latitude 33 restuarant, very filling and staff were great. The Starbucks is also handy for a quick snack. I didn't have to travel far, but the shuttle bus to and from the airport is very regular and only takes minutes to get to the hotel. The hotel staff were very accomodating, even to the die hard fan at a convention (yes we know we can be weird).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: sandy123432438
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are very spacious and the pool is beautiful! It is great when you have an early flight because the airport is so close. And the people that work there are very nice! I definately reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LAX AIRPORT MARRIOTT”
Reviews.Author: OCALAFLORIDATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Decent place to stay close to the airport. Stayed here for a couple days before heading to San Diego. Located just a few blocks from Fox Rent A Car and some of the other rental car agencies. If you are going to rent a car to travel to some other place in Southern California and just are utilizing the LAX Marriott to lay your head while in LA, rent your car when you check out. The parking charges are a bit on the expensive side and it's kind of silly to rent a car to just sit in the parking lot for a couple days as was our case. The rooms were just ok. Very well kept but the bathrooms again are the smallest... I don't know whether Marriott hired a midget (no offense to midgets reading this) but they were incredibly cramped. The room service was just ok, the hotel restaurant was decent with courteous and attentive wait staff. Front desk check in was smooth and efficient if you are a Marriott Rewards member they have everything all ready for you when you check in, just present your credit card and proof of any eligible rates and your on your way to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel and a nice visit.”
Reviews.Author: Lisadarlene
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in LA for a 2 day seminar on July 8 and 9th. We were impressed by the size of the hotel and the drive in to the parking area. This place is HUGE. The rooms were a decent size with a nice color scheme and a good view. The front staff was very helpful as well. What I loved about the hotel is their large, often candle lit lower lounge area. This is where you could get free wireless....other wise it is $13.95 a night to have it in your room which I do believe is a little extravagent. Luckily we did not have to park at this hotel as I have heard it costs about $25 a night. There is a business center which is convenient, however the charges are INSANELY overpriced...I believe it was $24.95 an hour....rip off! If you want to go out and about, I suggest you rent a car or know someone in LA to show you around. This hotel is only near other hotels, but very few restaurants and things "to do" are around... The pool in this hotel is FABULOUS...it is heated and outdoor which are two perks. It is built like those you see in Mexican resorts, with a gazebo and lagoon. It is nice and shallow for the kids and then gets deep for the good swimmers. The ballrooms where our seminar was held was incredibly huge...and the food service was great. Overall this is an excellent hotel for the atmosphere, ambience and price value (we found it on hotels.ca for $100 a night!). Just be prepared to have to take the bus around town if you want to go anywhere...,I suggest this place as more of a stay for those on business or seminars that are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel. Not Much To Do Off Property.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTGS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here five nights for a business conference over 4th of July weekend. The hotel is impressive, with large lobby areas, and comfortable chairs. There is a restuarant, sports bar, steak house, and a coffee/snack kiosk in the lobby. The food quality is not the greatest, below what would be expected at the hotel of this size, and is also extremely expensive. Some food had to be sent back to the kitchen during our stay, and orders were routinely not taken correctly. The staff however, is friendly and helpful, but seem unable to get it together. (Chef Ramsey...they need you). There aren't many places off property to eat except for other hotels unless you you want a drive a few miles or more. The rooms were as expected. Clean, and in good condition, with nice amenities. The meeting rooms were well arranged, easy to find, with nearby bathrooms. Exceptionally large pool with a lot of deck seating and landscaping. Airplane noise isn't really bothersome considering this and all other hotels along Century Blvd sit between the north and south runways. (Planes don't land over the hotel after 10PM anyway, except in bad weather). Parking is $26 a day with NO in and out , or $35 for the valet where you can come and go. No free wi-fi either. All in all, not a bad stay, but don't look for anything to do near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenience and Marriott quality!”
Reviews.Author: JeffTravelinMan
Reviews.Content: I stay at the LAX Marriott every year in February while attending a Doctor Who convention there and I always enjoy it! The rooms are great-very comfortable and pretty spacious. You have your choice of three restaurants here, which is nice, though it's worth noting that the food in Latitude 33 is very similar (sometimes exactly the same) as the food served in the sports bar. There's also a more upscale steakhouse, which I've only eaten in once and wasn't overly impressed with. There's a great, comfortable lobby and I believe it has free wifi, though the same cannot be said of the rooms (internet access will run you about $12/day in your room). Aside from that, there are some nice amentities, like the big outdoor pool and hot tub-very nice! It's an airport hotel, so it's very convenient if you're flying into/out of LAX, especially with the hotel shuttle that runs regularly. There aren't many things to walk to, but you do have a few choices for restaurants nearby. You can also hop on the shuttle that picks up about two blocks from the hotel and hitch a ride to Santa Monica and a few other nearby destinations (tickets are about $3 are are available from the concierge). I know that this one hotel that I'll continue to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Average - I was expecting better”
Reviews.Author: StewieGriffin
Reviews.Content: After going to a conference in the LA area I was looking forward to a bit of R+R before heading back home. The hotel, the room, the service, everything... was nice, but nothing special. I guess I just had high hopes because it was a Marriot. And there is absolutely nothing of interest in the surrounding area, just hotels and car rental lots.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good facilities,”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight prior to early morning departure from LAX. Comments: 1. Overall a good property, albeit one that is aging just a bit, that delivers what you would expect from Marriott . . . clean, comfortable, efficient. 2. The room had soap bars, but no shampoo, conditioner, or any other customary bathroom amenities. Obviously a mistake. Yeah, I could have called to send some up, but I was willing to settle for washing my hair with soap rather than deal with it. 3. The fitness center is excellent . . . lots of equipment (probably about 10 treadmills, a half dozen elliptical machines, wide assortment of weights). Towels and cold water were available; equipment was equipped with individual TVs. A complaint about the fitness center is that it was kind of warm. 4. The outdoor pool is impressive, and water was bathwater warm despite it being a rather cool day. 5. The television set was an old-fashioned tube, with limited channel selection. 6. Good in-room climate control with quiet operation. 7. A large airport hotel like this should make it very easy to find out about its complimentary shuttle service to the airport -- for example, lobby signage, a prominent notice in the room, etc. -- turns out I had to call to ask, and the word was the shuttle ran about once every 25 minutes and not on a schedule. That tends to work against a primary objective of staying at an airport hotel: minimizing time spent getting to the airport. My recommendation -- if you can get past the ethics of it and your luggage is not too cumbersome -- is walk across the street to the nearby Budget Rent-a-Car and ride their shuttle (which is nearly continuous) to the LAX terminals. 8. The room was very quiet . . . no problems with airplane noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: I have Marriott silver elite status. The welcome email I received from the guest ambassador sounded promising. Unfortunately this was the most disappointing Marriott experience Iâ€™ve ever had. We arrived on a midnight flight; youâ€™d expect an airport hotel to accommodate all times of arrival. When we arrived however all the restaurants had closed and room service had seized for the night. We had not yet eaten, due to the travel time and not having received food on the plane. The front desk lady was entirely unhelpful. When asked about food, she told us to walk to the Hilton. Next time, weâ€™ll just stay at the Hilton. Very disappointing that an airport hotel would not consider late arrivals, and that a Marriott would not provide decent services. Our luggage had not arrived with us. When asking for assistance to sort out the delivery of our luggage, the lady at the reception gave us an annoyed: "What? You want me to call?" Her entire attitude said: donâ€™t bother me. Even if there was nothing she could do for us, we expect people to at least be polite. The rooms were standard Marriott quality, meaning clean and comfortable. The service levels at this hotel are however sub standard and Marriott should not allow this hotel to tarnish its reputation. So my question to Marriott would be: Next time, should we choose Hilton instead? We went to the Courtyard in Sherman Oaks the next day, which was wonderful: much more modern, and with phenomenal, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic for stopover at LAX”
Reviews.Author: EmbeeWellington
Reviews.Content: after a 14 hour flight the Marriot was a haven before another 12 hour flight. Large beds, lots of pillows, sunny rooms, nice bathroom. Everything I wanted in a stopover hotel. Staff were very helpful and couldn't be faulted. Breakfast was typical american fare, but there aren't many options around LAX, so it did the job. After checkout, was able to hang around on the couches in reception for a few hours before my flight. No problem for the staff, never hassled, and very comfortable. Shuttle to the airport is part of the package. I would recommend this for a stopover after a long haul flight.

Reviews.Title: “standard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: weileongtan
Reviews.Content: basically everything you'd expect in a marriott, and that's it. based on what I read of the other reviews, I suspect there's quite some variance in the rooms w.r.t. how much aircraft noise you will get - I myself was woken up before dawn by a plane landing in my room (facing pool). Like all "full service" Marriotts the little add-ons can really add up (internet access, food etc.). I picked this marriott because of the convenience of having the Hertz counter in-hotel (I'd booked and would pick up the morning after my evening arrival at LAX) and I'd be prepared to do the same again in similar circumstances (i.e. had to leave early in the morning and have no time to take the shuttle back to LAX to switch to the Hertz shuttle).

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on recommendations from another online travel board. For the price I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was good. The bed was big, the pillows nice and fluffy and for being over an airport corridor it was quite.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, rude staff, location is no better than many others in the area”
Reviews.Author: Traveler773311
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in this hotel because previous reviews and the hotel website said the hotel had been recently updated. WRONG. The rooms is this hotel are tiny and outdated. The staff is rude. There are many hotels in the area that are just as closer or closer to the airport and car rental returns.

Reviews.Title: “If you have an early morning flight out of LAX than consider staying here”
Reviews.Author: phiflyers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and literally was only able to get 5 hours of sleep so I definitely was not able to enjoy this hotel as fully as I would have liked to, but want to still give my opinion about my overall experience. My first observation about my room here was that it was very small and not meant for 2 people. The balcony was very large and they could have easily bumped the room out to decrease the size of the balcony. Like other Marriott's, this hotel was no exception in that they charged a pretty hefty price for internet access. The bed was pretty comfortable, but if you are a light sleeper than be sure to turn the fan all the way down on the A/C unit otherwise it will keep you up. Luckily the A/C was still able to keep the room pretty cool on the lowest fan setting. If you are taking the complimentary shuttle bus to the airport first thing in the morning like we did than be sure to get outside early because it fills up very quick. The first bus filled up and I had to wait for a 2nd bus to arrive. I was glad that I was not in a crunch for time because that would have caused some problems. Overall, if you have an early morning flight out of LAX that you need to catch and want to maximize your hours of sleep than you should consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Ricker26
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel since it was located close near LAX airport. Check-in was uneventful and quick. Had a king sized bedroom on the 16th floor facing the airport. For a relatively expensive hotel this room was small and no small fridge or microwave. The coffee maker was located behind the TV. The Internet was $12.95 extra so did not purchase it. There are 2 restaurants ($$$$) and a Starbucks. The location makes this an OK place to stay if you are using LAX.

Reviews.Title: “good value if you book on the right website”
Reviews.Author: maryado
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel close to LAX. A free shuttle bus took us to the hotel. We stayed here two nights and used the bus across the road to get to santa monica for only 75c each way. It is not as fancy as other Marriott HOtels and the front desk staff appear to dislike their jobs. We changed rooms as the first room was located with the view of the carpark.We asked to move to a room facing the pool , which was more pleasant. There is a good bar which we ate at.A $15 beer and sandwich special for dinner. The Starbucks on site makes awful coffee so aviod that. Overal I would probably stay here again for a short visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “great as usual”
Reviews.Author: jockgrieve
Reviews.Content: great check in, after 17 hours of flying it took less than 2 minutes from when i got off the free shuttle until i was in my room. all staff from the front desk to the guys moving laundry were very friendly and helpful. room and hotel clean, modern, and has great facilities. 24hr gym is very well equipped and pool area great for a bit of relaxing. Good dining options from nice bar meals to fine dining, and the small convienience store in the lobby was reasonably priced and well stocked with every thing you could want, or might have forgotten. Will definately be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestSideWabbit
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property at least 3 times and while the rooms are rather dated and the bathrooms are fairly small, overall the rooms are a reasonable price at convention rates. The pool area is nice and has ground floor access for special needs visitors. The really bad news is that the restaurants have odd hours, the service and selection at the Champions sports bar are dreadful and the steak restaurant is incredibly overpriced. But here's the good news: the LAX Four Points Sheraton is located just north of the Marriott and they have T.H. Brewster's, an EXCEPTIONAL beer bar that's open all day long and has food service. So, we like to check into our cheap lodgings, then go for a short stroll next door to enjoy fantastic beer and good food which costs just as much as we'd pay for a crappy burger and a Corona (exotic import? NOT!) at the sports bar. The Sheraton's beer bar staff are very helpful with the wide selection of imported beer offerings and very attentive, in contrast with the lackadaisical service at Champions. Then we stroll back to the hotel, visit with our friends at the convention, attend some parties and genuinely enjoy ourselves. Also, at this hotel, I once found an opening in the acoustic ceiling tile over the shower (?) about the size of a peephole. With my husband's help, I plugged it with some toilet paper, but it certainly made me feel insecure on that stay! And why is it that Marriott properties never seem to have proper ventilation in the bathroom?

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: Alxon
Reviews.Content: An ideal spot if you need to spend a night in the LAX neighborhood in between two flights. Useful free shuttle service from and to LAX, efficient checkin, spacious rooms with all the usual Marriott properties comfort. Very good sound-proof, you do not hear any noise altough there are planes taking off and landing constantly less than 1 mile away

Reviews.Title: “not again - This time i mean it!”
Reviews.Author: Richie165
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in until I checked out, I recieved nothing but poor service in this hotel. Bathroom was barely clean when I checked in, staff not helpful at all. I did stay there a couple of months ago, and vowed never to return.. This time I mean it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Be Cozy Inside, If You Have Money”
Reviews.Author: matildaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Marriott for a three day convention. My room was very clean, and very sunny, and quiet, and was a wonderful nest to make as a second home for a few days. The bed was delightful, at least for my 60 year old arthritic body. The pool and surrounding garden sitting area were very friendly and I went out there each morning to lay on a lounge with my face to the sun, old lizard that I am... LOL The service was great, could print out my departing boarding pass, there were lots of nicely planted areas where one could sit outside and enjoy fresh air, even though it rained and was quite windy for a few days, while I was there. My only complaint that there was no place in the whole hotel convention complex where one could get something to eat or drink at anytime. Room Service was wonderful, and I used it several times, yet it closed down at 1 a.m., the "snacks" in the Gift Shop were pathetic, and the Restaurants had limited hours and were quite expensive. What about guests who come in at all hours, and haven't been able to plan their days and meals yet? Other than this, the LAX Marriott was a really safe, personable and friendly place to stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Alberta52
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice before (pre-cruise) and enjoyed both stays. The rooms are big enough for us, although the bathrooms are very small. Beds are comfortable. The pool area is lovely. We've always had a room overlooking the pool. The restaurants are much too expensive for our tastes but we only stay one night and can find alternatives in the area. There is a Starbucks in the front lobby. The business centre is one you must pay for. This stay, we had a shuttle bus driver from the airport who had no idea of how to transport people safely. He picked up way too many passengers who ended up standing in the aisles along with luggage that fell onto people. Passengers on the bus finally told him they refused to allow him to pick anyone else up. When he was confronted with how unsafe the situation was, he could care less. After the harrowing shuttle bus ride, we arrived at the hotel and were met with hundred of screaming adolescents and young adults who were there for an Anamae convention (likely didn't spell that correctly). They were dressed in very odd outfits and obviously were all deaf as they screamed at one another constantly. They monopolized the elevators, the lobby and the pool area. We could not get a room by the pool, which we have always had in the past, as we were warned we wouldn't get any rest. Instead, we were put on the 14th floor overlooking a parking area. For this we paid about $160.00/night! We advised the front desk manager of our concerns. He was polite but basically said the convention is at the hotel every year and that he realized the people were disruptive. It is a shame that a hotel that obviously caters to the passenger passing through or departing/arriving from the airport would allow such disruption. Based on this experience, I'm not sure whether we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One night before flying on”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller143
Reviews.Content: One night after flying in from Heathrow on route to Hawaii. The shuttle bus did take about 20 minutes to turn up, but the driver was very helpful and lifted bags onto the bus etc. Hotel check-in took some time. Room was absolutely fine. Shuttle runs back to LAX every 30 minutes but not at set times so you may have to wait if you missed one. All in all served its purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel in preparation for the pain the behind of negotiating LAX.”
Reviews.Author: EAZELIFF
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before i flew to Kona and will return there next week, having stayed in this hotel about 15 years ago - I did not recognize the lobby. While the rooms are a tad small, they are very attractive and comfortable. Elaborate and attractive outdoor pool. The best part was the excellent dinner I had in JW's Steakhouse, although pretty pricy. ( I mentioned to the gracious waiter that what I consider awful music did not do justice to the food and he shut it off, thereby increasing his tip! ) Overall, I like this hotel, but I have to agree with the previous reviewer that the security procedures at LAX are awful, waiting in a pokey line on a bridge over the access roads. Yes, we realize this security is necessary, unfortunately, but this was a hassle. ( I know, consider the damn alternative. ) Recently I flew to Japan from Portland, Oregon, which was a pleasure by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU GOTTA BE AT LAX, THIS IS PRETTY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: Marriott LAX - 01.19.10 This is a typical large Marriott hotel with all the services you expect. It is very close to the airport terminals, but current arrangements with airport shuttles mean it may take longer to reach the hotel door than you would like. This, plus new LAX security policy, which apparently prohibits walking to and from the area, means that even though you are literally next to the airport, you should plan on more time to get to your room or meeting than you would have in the past. Otherwise, we experienced no problems with this property.
