As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms are alarmingly small for such a hotel, reminding one of some of the old New York City hotels that were converted from really old properties but kept the small room sizes. Given prices near the airport, it might pay to shop around for a hotel with more living space if you are going to spend more than a night there. Within a quarter mile of the terminals, there are lots of top hotels to choose from. If you are not a frequent visitor to LAX, you should also prepare yourself for the airportâ€™s abysmal conditions and expect it to take you maybe twice as long to negotiate outbound departures. Security procedures are closer to those in third world airports and the domestic and international terminal areas are well behind those in some other major USA airports and disorganized, despite the waves of TSA (read as â€œThousands Standing Aroundâ€�), personnel shuttling your checked baggage from one place to another. The absurdity of the three stage international departure exercise challenges both logic and patience as you must first check in with the airline, then physically carry your checked baggage to the TSA X-Ray point which is always backed up and understaffed, then go and get in line a third time for the usual mindless check of your carry-on and person. This routine may also include undue harassment from private security personnel at various locations. Plan at least three hours for portal to portal, hotel front door to airline gate, to be safe. Still, the hotel is convenient if you must be in or go through LAX and sometimes you have little choice. If you arrive there from overseas, prepare yourself for long waits, first at immigration and then at customs. Returning from Japan, we spent two hours after we got our luggage getting through US government check points. Private security personnel were the rudest encountered in many years anywhere, so again, prepare yourself for â€œThe LAX Treatment.â€� As other reviews show, there is no convenient place to eat except at other nearby hotels, so plan accordingly. Food and beverage inside the hotel was acceptable, but nothing outstanding or memorable. Because of hotel chain loyalty, I would go back there again, assuming I got a competitive rate, but my future planning will try to avoid LAX altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, but time zone issues”
Reviews.Author: jetalcott
Reviews.Content: The Marriott LAX has most things you want in an airport hotel; comfortable and quiet room, friendly efficient service, good restaurant and computers for checkin as well as a shuttle to and from the airport. We had one complaint. We arrived at the hotel in the evening from Sydney. Suffering from the dreaded time zone shift, we found ourselves hungry at about 2:00 AM. We only discovered then that room service was not 24 hours. The restaurants were closed. The room didn't even have a mini-bar with outrageously priced snacks. Of course we survived the night. And we stayed in the hotel on our way home to Sydney two week later (with a snack safely tucked away in our suitcase). :-)

Reviews.Title: “Los Angeles Airport Marriott”
Reviews.Author: alan0606
Reviews.Content: Great airport hotel........We stayed there for one night in Nov 09 before getting on cruise ship the next day. Yes you hear the odd plane going over but hey what do you expect the hotel is at the airport... Reception staff were excellent and the conseriage was top notch also.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwflying
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice, updated rooms for an older building. It is often very busy. Allow plenty of time when going to/from your room in the elevators. It seems that there is often only one elevator working. The Los Angeles Airport Marriott has a great pool area and outside deck. The reception desk has great customer service. Allow plenty of time when using the hotel airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrruby
Reviews.Content: Suite was oddly laid out (the lav with the tub was off the living room, the bedroom lav was a shower). That said, the suite was perfect for entertaining. Great bed. Very clean. Top-notch staff. Hotel shuttle from the airport was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to/from LAX”
Reviews.Author: Willtradesnow4sand
Reviews.Content: Shuttle: This hotel is part of the cooperative with other LAX hotels with a single provider that provides 24 hr loop service. Arriving at LAX, you simply collect your luggage and go outside. Watch for the shuttle bus indicating Marriott LAX, and get on. The ride to the hotel just takes a few minutes, and they they go on to one other hotel, then back to LAX. I tipped the driver $1 per bag IF he handled it. Shuttle runs every 20-25 minutes. Check-in: I was prepaid through AARP so check-in took about 3 minutes and we were headed up to our room. Very efficient and pleasant staff. Room: Not very big, but hey, this is a stop-over, not exactly intended to be a week-long pad. The room was clean, no complaints. Lots of pillows. Nearby airliners departing at 5 am may wake you. Check-out: We had no incidental charges, so checkout consisted of handing the desk clerk the key cards and then heading out. Dining: Uh-oh. The costs for dining are so high they're laughable. If you are returning to LAX the next morning, we recommend that you get your breakfast at the Burger King kiosk near your departure gate. You'll save HALF! I did not see any outside restaurants near the hotel, but if there were, they would no doubt be cheaper. This was the most expensive hotel breakfast menu I have encountered. Evening sandwich in the sports bar was good, but again, way too expensive. All said, this hotel worked just fine for the purpose intended - an overnight layover flying to/from Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive room; delicious room service”
Reviews.Author: culturaltravel
Reviews.Content: My stay here was the 4th in 5 months and not quite as perfect as in the past but still a pleasure. The staff (aside from the Starbucks' manager!) was very courteous, the shuttle was very helpful, the room was very comfortable and attractive (note that some rooms and bathrooms are much larger than others; the largest bathroom I ever got was when I got a queen-bed room that seemed designed for the physically challenged). Best of all, the room service was amazing -- I ordered their salmon with a warm salad and a San Pellegrino and it was absolutely delicious and delivered very professionally, putting me as a solo traveler at my ease. The negative bits: The balcony needed cleaning; if you stood right next to the sink you could smell mildew; at first I heard loud children next door, but then the noise died down and it became a quiet hotel as it was in the past for me.

Reviews.Title: “good marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esteven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a long journey from Brussels over Philadelphia to LA in horrible US airways planes, so I was hoping this hotel would be just perfect. I was not disappointed, expect for the fact that the room was not 100% clean. The beds are absolutely comfortable, good size (although rather small bathroom). Breakfast was nice and the hotel staff are really helpfull and friendly. They have all necessary ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “This a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: rhanna68
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and the bed is comfortable. I suggest you take a dip in the pool and don't miss a night in champions sports bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not 4 star and valet service was very slow”
Reviews.Author: mommy808
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel about 4-5 times a year and am always happy with the rooms and amenities, however I don't think they should be rated a 4 star hotel, i would say more like a 3 star, just based on the amenities offered and services. However, again the service is always great, housekeeping always great as well as the bellhop service. The only huge gripes I have about this hotel is the ridiculous parking rates, both self and valet and the valet service. The price to park is just out of this world..I understand valet is a premium service but I've paid less at 5 star hotels here in Hawaii where we live and the self parking rates are ridiculous too. Based on that my husband and I decided to just valet for a few dollars more and the expected convenience of not having to lug our two small children through the parking lot every time we came and went. The first night we waited about 10-15 minutes for our car which btw we could see parked..the next few days it was a little better with wait times in the 10 minute range..still for about $32/day valet fee, i'd expect better service. It seemed like they were short staffed with only 1 or 2 people getting the cars...very frustrating!! To me , this is the only downfall to this property but it's pretty major..when you're on vacation you want the convenience of fast service..we would end up sending my husband downstairs 5-10 minutes earlier just to give the valet our parking ticket to get the car, then I'd come downstairs w/ my two kids..if you plan on not getting a car (which would be pretty dificult for this hotel, because nothing major is within walking distance) or you don't mind crappy valet service and overpriced parking rates than this place won't be an issue for you. I just hope they fix this flaw to an otherwise great place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel099
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there 2 nights for a conferernce on Sept. 11, 2009; which just happened to be our 21st wedding anniversary. We had a very nice large room on the 14th floor; with (according to my husband) a marvelous view of the LAX runways and operations. The room was extremely clean, the bed was just the way we like it (firm), and the sound proofing was incredible (NO NOISE). We dined in the JW Grill and had great food and superb service (by Agustin). We had so much food left over, that they kindly sent up a small refrigator. After returning to our room we were surprised by the gift of a bottle of champagne, along with a card signed by the entire staff (like they were our best friends). We asked for a 2:00 PM checkout, which was promptly, and pleasantly granted. Overall -- just a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “How to ruin a night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: msspiderman
Reviews.Content: Stopped over from Hawaii back to Europe for a night so you don't expect much anyway and just want to catch some sleep. Shuttle Bus from LAX is having 20-25min intervals which can be a long time if you're tired. Check in was fast, however, we requested a late check-out at 3p.m. next day and were charged $75 (until 2p.m. it would have been free!). As we arrived late in the evening only the Champions Bar was open for food and drinks and it served its purpose. For breakfast there is a Starbucks in the lobby. Our room was small, especially the bathroom. We had a view at the pool where music was playing early in the morning. But the worst was the Airconditioning! First: it was very, very loud. Second: you couldn't turn it off!!! No way to switch it off, so every 40 minutes we woke up because of the rattling sound of the A/C. Increasing the temperature at the thermal switch didn't help because it was starting to heat then immediately... Price was ok, however, next time we will choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the first night in LA”
Reviews.Author: GabiandToby
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect. Close to the airport and all rental car companies. We arrived in the evening and just wanted to sleep, so the place was great. The room was very clean and quiet. I think the parking fee is too high (they have a hughe parking lot). The Starbucks in the hotel lobby was great for breakfast. Would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely great stop over at the airport”
Reviews.Author: francisBelgium
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you hope for at an airport :great comfortable and noise free rooms and superb beds and a a great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Little Jenny
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here and I was very impressed with the hotel - it was very clean and the staff were very helpful. My husband and son ate in the restaurant for dinner and loved the food and we all had a great breakfast there in the morning. The pool looked great but sadly we didn't get a chance to try it out. We had no problems with aircraft noise here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Palm_Cove_Princess
Reviews.Content: Oh dear.....very noisy (think jets of all types taking off and landing morning, noon and night) what about double glazing......very small rooms.....limited dining options.......to top it all off after enduring a 5 night stay (fortunately I was working all day & busy most evenings) second last day was a cold shower......final day finale - NO SHOWER.....and all I got from the receptionist was a "sorry M'am"......just lovely at 6am when I have a plane to catch......I hope that I NEVER have to stay here again..... One good thing here is the Ocean Trolley bus that goes to Manhattan Beach and the El Segundo Plaza. You need to pre-pay the $3.00 round trip ticket from the concierge (which they neglected to tell me....luckily the bus driver let me on anyway)

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for LAX & nearby”
Reviews.Author: sasima
Reviews.Content: A sort of ugly beauty outside, but well done & renovated inside. Has a nice feel to it. It gets a lot of business. We got to enjoy some of its standout amenities, such asâ€¦ THE POOL: Hands down the best choice if you want a big pool. The entire inner courtyard of the hotel is the pool area. Besides the heated free-form pool, thereâ€™s a large Jacuzzi (comfortably fits 8 adults), and lots of places to sit/chill/relax. Literally an oasis. The pool is 1ft on the shallow end & 8ft on the deep end. If you just want to lay down partially submerged while getting some sun, the shallow end is perfect for it. There are a lot of water toys provided by the hotel for the children. THE GYM: A pleasant surprise. I expected the typical hotel setup, which means less than desirable. Iâ€™m a hardcore gym person. I have to say it is well done â€“ not big, but just well done. - at least 7 treadmills (all have view of the courtyard) - several elliptical cardio machines - 12 weight machines - 3 benches & nice rack of free weights LOUNGING AREAS: I really liked that there are comfy chairs @ the porte cochere, many chairs/sofas/etc in multitude of configurations & types in the spacious lobby, and all over the pool area. THE ROOM: We had a pool access room. Itâ€™s really terrific. The sliding glass door opens out into the pool courtyard. One morning we ordered room service breakfast & had them set it up for us outside in the courtyard (each room comes with outdoors table & chairs). Best things about the room: - spacious - mattress. It really is comfortable (you can buy it too). - pillows (all different kinds, I always make do, but this time I found the perfect one) - big desk for working Not great things: - shower/toilet room is tiny - no mini-bar /fridge - plane noise (we only noticed it a few times â€“ depends on your noise sensitivity) Some reviewers complained about A/C noise & problems. Our was perfect. BEACH SHUTTLE The hotel offers $3 rt shuttle to nearby beaches, such as Manhattan & Hermosa. It runs every 30 minutes. I would have made use of this, but didnâ€™t find out about it til check-out time. The shuttle info is not posted on the hotel web site nor anywhere obvious (maybe I just failed to see it earlier).

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE service, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: prjoe05
Reviews.Content: OK, I know that airport hotels are supposed to be very friendly to business travelers, which are the most important client group to the airline industry. I would suppose that would even be more so in the particular case that an airport hotel were to be holding a business conference. Well, this hotel failed miserably in accomplishing its goals. The cleaning people hold all the elevators while buffering a single elevator floor and it does not matter to them the inconvenience they are creating to the clients in making them wait until the buffering is finished (after waiting more than ten minutes for one of the five other elevators to arrive, I called the supervisor and went to the front desk to complain and neither of them showed the slightest interest in reprimanding the employee... rather, I seemed to be bothering them). There are bell boys that make fun of and/or utter insults in Spanish to unknowing guests behind their back (I am Puerto Rican, by the way) and there is never managerial personnel around (convenient?). To be fair, the architectural design of the hotel is smart, as it has buildings for the lobby, restaurants and conference rooms separate from the sleeping quarters. It is also close to main roads and highways and the conference facilities are ok. All in all, it would be a nice hotel if not for the rude and incompetent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd had time to stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: Hootsmon
Reviews.Content: Spent 1st July here after two long flights from Glasgow to LAX. Courtesy shuttles from LAX worked well. We'd been up 24 hrs by the time we arrived so I was pleased at how easy check in was at 7pm (Pacific time), no queues. Both rooms we had were lovely, clean and modern, and doors out to the pool area and a small patio area with a table and chairs. We loved the look and feel of this place and were only sorry that we had to catch another flight to Vegas by 11 next morning. I'd definitely recommend this place as a stayover and I will try to book it next trip.

Reviews.Title: “bumped from manhattan marriot to lax marriott with prepaid reservation”
Reviews.Author: sadie95406
Reviews.Content: Tired and ready for a room at Manhattan Beach Marriott they transfered me to LAX Marriott due to overbooking (elite member prepaid). Arrived at LAX Marriott. Valet didn't even approach me. Lobby Elite member help desk made me wait then pointed me straight to the anyone line. Took forever to confirm that my stay was to be complimentary due to the overbooking at the Manhattan Marriott. Offered me condolences and mini size water to match the micro sized room. No refridgerator, itsy bitsy bathroom, ice machine across hall, planes taking off every few minutes. I called the front desk to ask if they had bigger rooms I was left on hold for over 10 minutes. I finally hung up and went downstairs. When I complained that this was not comparable to what I had booked through "Marriott Rewards as an Elite Member" they questioned my Elite status (been member over 10 years). I showed them my well worn card. Told me it wasn't their fault. Told me all the rooms were all the same size - which wasn't true. Front desk put up with my angry description of my experience so far, but did nothing to compensate me. No offer of a better room, no comp drink, NOTHING but a blank stare and fake geniality. As though I didn't matter whatsoever. Waited a solid 15 minutes, thirsty & tired in restaurant while staff in nearly deserted restaurant argued over who's turn it was as though it was an inconvienience to serve me. Soup tasted like Progresso out of a can for $10. What a joke. When I stated that I have used Marriott because I expected consistency in service, quality of rooms, and responsive staff they stared at me as though I was speaking another language. I will never ever trust Marriott again & I like to travel to new places therefore I need a reliable hotel chain. Westin has really comfy beds. Hmmmm.

Reviews.Title: “Staff great, building not.”
Reviews.Author: herunstoofast
Reviews.Content: First stay at the LA Airport Marriott. More to say than I have time to write, but in a nutshell: 1. Overall, staff and service are excellent. Van at the front desk is a model example of not only making you feel welcome, but getting the job done so that you are really and truly more comfortable. If you happen to be a member of the Concierge Club on the 16th floor or can get it added as a perk, the service there is also extremely friendly and they serve a good complimentary breakfast (in room breakfast is way overpriced), afternoon hors d'ouvres, late night deserts and have free computer access (the FedEx center downstairs charges .40 cents a minute! What?!). Vuksan in their JW Steakhouse is a fabulous server.Food was quite good, although I only ordered appetizers because the mains are so pricey. 2. Building itself is the biggest problem. It seems that they have been working on renovations, but the age of the facility keeps creating problems. Here's one: the ventilation system. I checked in, and immediately out, of three different rooms because the A/C made the same horrible whistling sound. According to the maintenance, this happens when small pieces of insulation in the ducts stick out and catch the airflow, and there is nothing that can be done... Absolutely crazy making noise is you are sensitive! The roll away bed I ordered seemed to also be from 1950, and it is painful to sleep on -- not just soft like most roll aways, but more like a box spring. You can feel the coils everywhere! The workout room is fine, with numerous treadmills w/ built in TV's and weight machines. Service: A Facilities: B Building itself: C-

Reviews.Title: “There must be better choices at LAX”
Reviews.Author: shrop
Reviews.Content: Although it's an airport hotel expectations are higher when it's a Marriott, but they really shouldn't be at the Marriott LAX. Courtesy shuttle was fine, arriving at the hotel it's nothing to look at from the outside, the lobby isn't very inviting too, it has all the restaurants leading off it and all looks a little dismal and dated. Check in was OK and whilst I had requested a high floor was only given floor 8. The rooms are typical Marriott that have been refurbished and have good beds and nice bed linen, however, rooms are small with really tiny bathrooms. We ate in the high end restaurant on the evening, nothing good about this at all and very pricey, OK it's an airport and it's also LA but it really should be better, my guess is the sports bar is a better choice and better value! The pool area is nicely done and if you have time it looks really good but that seems about the best part along with the fitness room which was also good but there really must be better hotels in the area and the Renaissance certainally looked it, this will be the for me the next time we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A great airport hotel. Our top choice!”
Reviews.Author: juliryan
Reviews.Content: Almost everything went our way when we stayed at the Los Angeles Airport Marriott. The courtesy shuttle pulled up to the stop at our terminal just as we were walking out. A couple minutes later we pulled into the hotel. From the outside, the hotel doesnâ€™t look like much. The entry into the lobby, however, is very nice. The bellhop brought our bags to the bell captain. We were arriving at midnight, but this capable airport hotel is accustomed to late arrivals and ours posed no problem to the reservation desk (we had rung ahead to confirm, of course). We were given a room with a king sized bed on the eighth floor, away from the elevator. The bell captain brought our bags to our room. The rooms are not big, but they are nicely furnished. Not too dated. The fixtures and furniture arenâ€™t too cheap. Our room was almost spotless. It had been cleaned to a very high standard. Except, the windows did need a clean, but I wasnâ€™t too concerned. The soundproofing is adequate. I heard very little jet noise, and we were practically on the tarmac, the hotel is so close to LAX. I heard a few doors closing in the hallway in the morning, but otherwise it was quiet enough. There isnâ€™t a mini bar in the room, but ice and vending machines are nearby. The downstairs bar was closed on our arrival, but I suppose we could have ordered drinks from room service. The bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately we did not receive the feather free linens that we had requested. Nice LCD television. No problems accessing the internet ($12.95 for 24 hours, includes local calls and domestic long distance). We appreciated the safe. Enough room for our many bags. The bathroom is small, but again it has nice fixtures. Good tub and ample pressure from the shower head. Plenty of hot water. Complimentary USA Today in the morning. Complimentary tea and coffee is available in the room. We did not order breakfast from room service. We liked the Starbucks in the lobby. We got a couple lattes and breakfast rolls. I wish Starbucks had had croissants! Unfortunately, during our stay, only the hotel restaurant was open (not the sports bar, which we thought had the most appealing menu, or the steak restaurant). The child was not inclined to sit down for a meal at the restaurant, so we had to skip it. One of the best things about this hotel is the outdoor pool area. The heated pool is huge, with a large area that is only two feet deep. The child loved it. The pool is on the ground level, and is surrounded on all four sides by the hotel. Very sheltered. There is a hot tub/jacuzzi as well. Lots of lounge chairs and nice outdoor landscaping make it the perfect place to get some sun. There are amenities for smokers in this area, and this space is large enough that you probably wouldnâ€™t even notice them lighting up. No food is allowed by the pool. The gym looked well equipped, but I didn't have a chance to use it. Lots of meeting room space at the hotel. A convenience shop is also at the hotel. There is a business centre and a place to print out boarding passes. We ordered room service for lunch. We got a hamburger and fish tacos. They tried to accommodate the childâ€™s food allergies, but I recommend that if you need a special order, you be very specific and quiz them on all ingredients to assure that everything is okay. Still, very good service and we were quite happy with our meal. We ordered a wake-up call so we could have an afternoon nap, and it worked. The clock in the room worked as well, although the last guest had set it 30 minutes fast. Another tea and coffee from the Starbucks. Nice one. We requested and were granted a very late checkout of 5:00 p.m. We used the express check out service. There was supposed to be an additional charge, but it did not appear on our final bill, despite discussions with At Your Service and the reservation desk. I guess the charge was waived. Um, good? This hotel is a busy airport hotel. Lots of business travellers, airline crews and layover folks like us. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. Again, the hotel has an inviting lobby, and a lot of guests were hanging out there, during the morning and in the afternoon. On checking out, the bellman arrived promptly to assist us with our bags. We had to wait about ten minutes for the complimentary shuttle, which runs about every 25 minutes but is not on a schedule. No problems being dropped off at our terminal, although if you are flying Qantas like we were, be sure to double-check your terminal, as Qantas has desks in TWO international terminals. Happy to recommend the LAX Marriott. Donâ€™t confuse it with the Marriott Courtyard, which is nearby. If you donâ€™t expect too much, the LAX Marriott is a great airport hotel. If we have another LA layover, the LAX Marriott will be our top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Changed rooms 3 times in 10 hrs!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelemployee58
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to this Marriott for a convention. Being an asociate of the Marriot, and knowing how our hotel is, I was looking forward to the trip. We arrived at 11pm, I jumped in the shower, in the middle of washing my hair the water turned ice cold. I called the front desk, told the receptionist and she said, "And what exactly would you like me to do about this?" I was transferred five times before being offer a 2nd level room. Due to being very noise sensitive I had originally requested an upper lever room (we started on the 7th floor) but it was 1am, and I wanted to take a hot shower and get to bed. Got to bed at 3am, and was awoken at 9am by screaming and loud music coming from the pool. Called the front desk again, got the run around, was told they were to occupancy, on and on. I was finally transferred to "The Friendly Manager" (??), that is what they called her, who apologized and transferred us to the 14th floor. So there was our third room, and we left for the day. Next morning we left early, my daughter returned to the room at 8:15, was washing up and a knock on the door from housekeeping, wanting to clean our room. We had been out of the room for over 12 hours. She called me, I went to the front desk, was met by a "deer in the headlights stare" and the she pointed to the houseman! He tracked down the head of housekeeping, who asked if I wanted the room cleaned right then. I was going up to shower and go to bed, it was 10:30 by that time, so I told her what items we needed. I got up to the room, housekeeping had gotten there before their very slow elevators got me up, some of the items were left on one of the beds, but they had forgotten half of them! The last day of our conference was Sunday, so we had checked out that morning. The conference ran late and ended at 11:00. Rather than stay the night there again, I decided to head north and find a Courtyard. We found and older Courtyard in Oxnard and it was wonderful! As a side note, on my first phone call to the front desk, she asked if I was an associate. I said yes, she asked if I worked at a Courtyard, yes, she had the nerve to tell me that "they were a full service Marriott" so things were a little different. I got the strong feeling she was looking down her nose at me, due to the fact I worked at a Courtyard rather than a "full service"! I asked if she were treating me this was due to the fact I was an associate, she said she treated everyone the same. I told her I felt bad for her guests if they were all being treated as we were, and I would never dream of treating a guest to our hotel in the manner in which I was being treated. The ONLY people who were nice was the maintainance gentleman who came up to check the shower, and the bell man, Jerry, who moved our bags for us. If you don't care if you are treated like a number, pay $14/day for internet, $20+/night for parking, and just rudeness, try the LAX Marriott. I work at the Courtyard Marriott in San Luis Obispo. I could not wait to get back to work where the entire staff is friendly and would bend over backwards to accomodate a guest. This is not because we are told to, but because we want to. The employees at the LAX Marriott, could use a weekend stay at our hotel to learn some service skills and a better attitude. As an associate I get a huge discount so this shouldn't matter to me, right? Well, if I could do it over again, I would have stayed at a different hotel and paid full price if it would have made the stay even a little nicer. I could not imagine paying full price then paying all the junk fees, for what? A "full service" hotel. The only "full service" they provide, is valet parking and bell men. Save yourself and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: nappieb
Reviews.Content: For an "airport" hotel, this one's pretty good! The set-up and rooms are a little dated, but service and overall organization are well above par for the genre'. I enjoyed the in-house restaurant is good (there are two [a commendation in itself for an aiport hotel!].. I ate at the upscale one...) the bar is good too... despite the "sports-bar" ambiance. The shuttle is a "shared" one with other airpot hotels, but works very well and seems to be reliable. Rooms clean and secure. Wake-up call on time, alarm clock worked. A good choice and excellent value in an airport hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: depttop
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this property for two nights during my recent trip to the West Coast. I stayed in other airport hotels before for short stays, stop over, etc., and this is by far the best airport hotel I stayed in. This is partly because I had little expectation for an airport hotel any more. I studied tripadvisor reviews and other discount hotel sites (hotwire, priceline)to get a good hotel of good value, and learned that Marriott and Courtyard was the only two hotel that were not listed in hotwire and priceline (I may be wrong), which made me decide to stay in this property. I was worried that Marriot hotels tend to be frilly and decorated with flower-oriented motifs (no offense to those who like them!), all of which makes me dizzy and tired. However, this hotel was not entirely but almost free of those decorating features. The bathroom was well updated and had separate two sinks, which was convenient. The business center was very well-equipped and convenient, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from lobby staff”
Reviews.Author: aferraro
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Marriott LAX, my first was 2 years ago, and I wrote a review back then. Caught the blue bus from the airport to the hotel which runs every 15-30 minutes. Very friendly service at check in, and they add extra staff if the line gets long, and offer those waiting free bottles of water. The elevator speed has improved significantly since my last stay here, with minimal waiting. The rooms are adequate, although there is no longer a refrigerator in the rooms, instead you get an ice bucket. I didn't go searching for ice. The starbucks downstairs remains in operation, and the food and service at the Latitude 33 restaurant is still consistently good. Top marks for the lobby staff. It was a very short walk to catch the Santa Monica Bus 3 which takes you through Marina Del Rey to Santa Monica and beyond. Check out is midday.

Reviews.Title: “Itâ€™s A Very Good Choice for A Transit Hotel at LAX!”
Reviews.Author: KSergey
Reviews.Content: At LAX, Iâ€™ve stayed many times at different hotels such as the Westin, Hilton, and Sheraton. This time I stayed for overnight at the Marriott on my route to Hawaii, and that was a very good choice. I liked this hotel even more in comparison to previously mentioned ones though in general all of them are at the same level of service, comfort and airport proximity. My renovated and newly refurbished bedroom was a small one but very clean and nice; in the bathroom, the tub with shower and toilette was conveniently separated from the marble sink area. After a long haul 12-hour flight, the Marriottâ€™s traditionally super-comfy king bed immediately made me its happy prisoner, although it was only afternoon in LAâ€¦ The magical bed released me next morning only, and I visited the restaurant for breakfast. The buffet costs US$ 20-25 and itâ€™s quite good: bacon, sausages, potato, rice, eggs, dairy products, cold meat, cheese, cereals, vegetables, fruits, fresh juices, bakery, etc. When I went to the hotelâ€™s courtyard, which impressed me a lot. It has a big lagoon shaped heated pool in the center; all the sun-lounges got soft mats and towels. Around the pool, there is a â€œtropical gardenâ€� with artificial creeks and bridges across them, and nicely decorated relax areas with armchairs and small tables. Rather cute. My next flight was at 6 PM, so I called to the Front Desk, appealed for a late check-out and got it with no problem at all â€“ nice touch. Before departure, I spent some time at Starbucks cafÃ© in the hotelâ€™s lobby â€“ nice coffee as usual as well as snacks, especially chocolate chops. Well, you wonâ€™t be disappointed for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: seattleite61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night a few weeks ago. We arrived after midnight and had no problems checking in. The room was clean and well furnished. The only complaint I have was that the cleaning crew came barging in a little before 8:00 am. We forgot to put the 'Do Not Disturb" sign ut but figured gousekeeping would get notification once we actually checked out. We only paid $105 total for the night, so we both thought the hotel was nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Economy effecting this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan8
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum member with Marriott, I guess I have become spoiled. This used to be my favorite Hotel to stay at near LAX, but I think I am moving on. Like most companies, Marriott has been hit hard. Earnings way off for the 4th quarter and it is showing up at the Hotels. The Concerige lounge has become a joke! Evening social has turned into cheeses and bread, with some small warm dish. Gone are the fresh and grilled vegetables and the fresh cut fruit. I was told they now have whole fruit instead. Breakfast wasn't much better. I also agree there is a hot water problem in the shower. This is the second time I have experienced this. Bathrooms are excurating small. Parking is $21 a night self park and internet is $12.95, which includes long distance within the Country. I used to love this Hotel, but I think I am heading back to the LAX Hilton. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott LAX and enjoyed our luxurious overnight accomodation. Our room was impeccable! The airport shuttle that took forever was quickly forgotten as we were checked-in by a very pleasant and friendly young man. He offered us complimentary water bottles and sent us to our room at the 17th floor. Little did we know that we were upgraded to a suite. What a wonderful surprise. The room, the bed, the robe and the bathroom was truly fantastic. Even our check-out the next morning was quick and easy too! The only downside to this stay was the dirty windows. As we viewed the city lights, I couldn't see past the dirt and grime. Other than that, I would recommend this airport hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't go back...”
Reviews.Author: gameoflife
Reviews.Content: The shuttle was pretty bad the driver refused to help with the bags stating it wasnâ€™t his job. We arrived at the hotel and the check in line was 45 minutes. We arrived at our non-smoking room â€œwith a viewâ€� the view happened to be the building next door and the room had clearly been smoked in for an extended period of time â€“ the smell was covered with a febreeze like product making it worse. We tried for a new room but were told we were out of luck as there was conference booked so we were out of luck. We had rented a car which was delivered to the hotel (enterprise car rental, wonderful service) and parked behind the hotel. I think it was $10US for the day with in and out privledges. Parking staff were great. Room service took 90 minutes for 1 salad, 2 burgers, fries and 3 sodas. The food was warm, the fries soggy. The room service attendant was super nice though and came back about an hour later to collect our plates and give us some more towels that we had requested. Two of us were traveling and one flight out was at 9pm at night, due to the mix up with the smoking room management they gave us a free late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but a big hassle!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTravelBug71
Reviews.Content: Parking is a rip off at this hotel!!! We were told at the front desk to check with valet parking for parking when we checked in. We were to told the valet parking was only $3 dollars more per day for valet, and there was not self parking. We stayed 2 nites - imagine how upset we were to find out that the hotel takes airport parking - so of course the only other option is valet when it is $28.60 per day!!! (Which is not $3 per day more than self parking). To top the whole experience off they made us pay for the parking at the valet booth and then they kindly charged it again to our credit card with the front desk. They have a very conveinent system for phoning to get the charges reversed - only bounced around for about 2 hours and about 5 different phone numbers to get a refund for $28.60...makes me wonder how many peaple give up trying. Never did get to speak with hotel manager of the hotel. Bottom line parking is a rip off and would not recommend this hotel at all, and watch the charges on your bill!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for stopover”
Reviews.Author: GlobetoddlerRTW
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with our 2 year old daughter on our way to London. We had booked this hotel before we left for our RTW trip so got a really good deal on the room rate. Close to LAX and free shuttle. Friendly staff. Fantastic beds but small bath room. Room opened to patio with the swimming pool. Too cold to swim in December but must be great in summer. We only tried the sports bar restaurant which served fast food type meals. Ok but nothing special. There is also Starbucks near the lobby. In front of hotel is bus stop to Manhatten Beach and shopping centres. Only available for hotel guests and at $4 return excellent and cheap activity.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to lay over”
Reviews.Author: johnjudge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two times in one week on the either end of a trip to Hawaii. It was close to LAX, cheap, reasonable rooms and easy for our purposes. The hotel is vast, you can end up hundreds of feet from an elevator, the porters were either overwhelmed or bored and not interested in helping... until we loaded our luggage and pushed it to the checkin counter... then they wanted to take it to our rooms for the tip. Nice. Oh, there are two decent restaurants and a sports bar. The decent restaurants close at 10pm (even on friday night we found out)... and yes at 10:01 they told us we were out of luck. After a long day and it being Halloween to boot we wanted a decent meal, but we were not up to leaving the hotel. The sports bar fed us... but it was filling with drunken, boisterous, loud people... to be fair they belong in a sports bar and it was not a pleasant meal or even really a good one. Hard to believe that a huge hotel next to a vast airport can't attract enough people to keep the other restaurants open past 10pm... especially on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: waki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgraceful. Two elevators working out of a bank of six. According to some airline crews I spoke to, this has been a problem for two years. Waits of 20 minutes to get a ride. Front desk made huge errors in my bill, double charging me for several items. Rooms & hallway not particularly clean. NEVER AGAIN A MARRIOTT property

Reviews.Title: “Okay, would try another property for next LAX overnight”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: The property was okay. There will, of course, be some noise next the airport, but I found this property to carry more airport and internal hotel noise than other places I've stayed at near LAX. The food was average, and overall I'd consider this an average property.

Reviews.Title: “A big let down!”
Reviews.Author: darrylpmatthews
Reviews.Content: Good location, which was just around the corner from the car rental depots of Dollar/Alamo/National. Check-in was very slow, this hotel is VERY busy with air crew and what seemed to be conventions. Chck-in agent was very un-responsive and not very friendly at all. Room was fantastic, newly refurbished, very pleasant and good size. Our room was at the end of a corridor, which we found out the next morning was very close to housekeeping rooms (whwre their supplies are kept.) We found this out as at 630am about 15 of them descended to this area and were laughing and screaming at each other, waking both of us up. We asked them to be a little quieter and they ignored us. I went to reception to complain and the clerk couldn't have cared less. This did sour our stay. BUT the hotel is nice and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: cupcakesb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here one time per year for many years as we attend the jazz festival every summer. This is what I have found the last several years. People from the surrounding communities in Los Angeles are coming in to the pool area and bringing their friends and family with them. They told me this :O) This year I noticed they increased the security, rooftop, etc. There is a family who almost camps there under the gazebo for the four days we are there. They bring in sleeping bags, coolers, etc. and are not guests of the hotel. They have big parties with outside people coming in. This year several of us talked to the manager, and she said she could do nothing. I guess my only complaint would be to somehow secure the pool area to make it available only to guests. The rooms are very clean, and the beds comfty. The food not so good in the cafes.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the City of Angels”
Reviews.Author: tvproducercbs
Reviews.Content: It is rare to find the quality of service that we experienced at this property!!! We were celebrating my daughters 20th B'Day and had been screwed over by the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego with only hours of our arrival. I had to quickly find a quality suite and change all of our plans and reservations. I had stayed at the Airport Marriott when stranded by the airlines and they upgraded my party to a luxury suite to calm our frazzled nerves. So who better to turn to, when you are stressed, and have only hours to make a memorable weekend happen. I called the LA Airport Marriott directly and poured my heart out to the Ft Desk Mgr Daniel. He assured me everything would be fine and he would make it happen. I had NO IDEA he would be more than true to his word. The staff at this property upgraded our reservation with our Marriott Platinum Card to the Berkley Suite. This room is plush, CLEAN, and wonderful for any special occasion. The staff greeted our party with smiles and warm personalities. Daniel made sure this would be special for my daughter by having the entire staff sign a Birthday Card and sending a tray of treats to the room. He made what was a horrible day turn into what my daughter says is the Best BDay yet. The pool, food and amenities are over the top. CLEAN,CLEAN,CLEAN...being an investigative producer, this is a biggie for me. Some hotels give the appearance of clean but when you look past the top layer it is NOT. This property has gained a lifetime of loyalty from me and anyone else I come in contact with. The location is not a place where you would walk down the street at night but for business or pleasure you are only minutes away from everything. We chose the Santa Monica Promenade (3rd St) (that took us 2 days) and Hermosa Beach. We were so relaxed and rejuvenated at this property we booked a 3rd night after we had already checked out. We went back for more. The top notch staff booked us right back into the Berkley Suite for a 3rd night. Now that is 1st Class Service. It is goodbye to my other frequent card holder hotels as the Marriott has my loyalty for life. It is RARE to find a GEM of a hotel with a staff to match. May I also add the price was 1/2 of what I was going to pay for the hotel in San Diego. The price has me sold too!!! It pays to be a Marriott Rewards Member!! Thank you Daniel and his wonderful staff at the LA Airport Marriott. Mrs. C Cole-Velasquez tvproducercbs@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Good interim place to stay during international travel”
Reviews.Author: baatraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay overnight to break up an international flight. We stayed here going to New Zealand and then when we returned from New Zealand. I recommend even-numbered rooms, with a view of the pool. The restaurant is excellent for breakfast! There is a Starbucks in the hotel. This is also a good place to rent a car from Hertz which is directly in the hotel. The hotel shuttle was pretty timely, but do allow at least 20 or 30 minutes for it to arrive at both the hotel and airport. The shuttle was very convenient and the drivers liked helping you with your bags. The pool was nice to sit around during the day. The rooms are clean. You still have to pay for internet access, even if you are a Marriott Rewards customer...unacceptable! Overall, it was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott - EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: bigmumma60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott on Sept 19th for 4 nights at the start of our trip to USA.The hotel was clean, the room we had was excellent, clean, very comfortable beds and lots of pillows. We had a room overlooking 2 of the runways and there was no noise from outside. We never encountered any problems with the lifts, the staff were all very nice and helpful and our room was made up everyday perfectly. My 2 kids loved the pool, it was very very nice and not crowded at all, as I guess a lot of people are just stopping over for a night. The lobby was always busy, but we were all checked in within around 5 minutes. The concerge was very helpful giving us information and maps on how to get around. We caught a bus to La Brae Tarpits,we had to change buses but found it very easy. the tarpits were quite interesting and from there we caught another bus just up the road to Farmers Markets and The Grove Shopping Centre. On the way back we had to change buses again and whilst waiting for the bus, we spotted the Hollywood sign in the distance. The next day we caught the bus to Santa Monica which was not far. The next day we had arranged a tour with Starline Tours and were picked up from the hotel and had the full day at Universal Studios. There are not much food options around the hotel, one night we ate at the hotel resturant and the meal was very good.There is a liquor shop which sells anything else you might need just down the road and a Burger King. There was a Denny's a couple of blocks away, but the concerge suggested we not walk there once it was dark, which was very nice of her. The shuttle bus was prompt and the driver very friendly. I found no faults with this hotel and would definetly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: haakonks
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here after arriving Los Angeles. The hotel is ok, and the staff in the lobby were nice. Had a standard room with a queen bed. The room was good, perhaps a bit small. Both the room and the bathroom was clean. Had breakfast in the hotels restaurant, it was a bit expensive. The buffÃ©t selection was good, however both the glasses and one of the plates was not properly cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel, but needs housekeeping improvement”
Reviews.Author: syd1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, but the only problem that I had was that the housekeepers never place bags in the trashcans. I had to ask for bags on two separate occasions. The front desk was courteous enough to give me some bags. another day I had to call housekeeping to bring some bags to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: ichaves25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights on September 26th. After getting to the airport we call the hotel and they told where the shuttle will pick us up. The shuttle driver was a very nice guy who help us with our luggage. We got to the hotel and a nice bellman greeted us. The check in was smooth and Pepe (bellman) took us to our room. He was very nice, he tols about the hotel services and in general he made our arrival experience an A+. We requested a fridge in the room and it got quickly... free of charge. The safe wasnÂ´t working but after a call a Loss Prevention officer helped us out. The hotel has complimentary shuttle to the airport which is great... we took a ride to the airport, and then a ride to the metro station,,, which tooks us to downtown, Walk of Fame and we even got to Santa Monica not spending more than $5 each. The hotel have a self service laundry which is great!!!! Try to use it early on because there are only 2 washers and 2 driers.. The only bad thing is that the pool in not heated... and the water was freezing.... Overall we did like this hotel... having a Starbucks and a Champions inside is a plus. We are Marriott International employees and the rate we got was a real bargain...!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely marriot”
Reviews.Author: kingyEngland
Reviews.Content: have just returned from a three and half week stay in america and stayed in the marriot for 3 days. we found the rooms a very good quality,very comfortable and a good size. iron and board in the room with coffee maker as well.Also a hair dryer for the girls you will find one in most good hotels in america so girls dont wastespace putting one in your suitcase. the parking charges are expensive $22 a day so if u want to save some money go use the carpark just down the road for half the price. the hotel has a restaurant but didnt use it so cant give it a review. there is a sportsbar which does food which is ok if u dont want to go out. the hotel is 5 mins from the airport but was not disturbed by any aircraft noise. the hotel is really well situated. aprox 40 mins to hollywood, rodeo drive,beverly hills,universal studios and about half hour to santa monica and venice beach .if i was returning to los angeles i would definantly use this hotel again or if no rooms available would use the raddison down the road as have stayed there as well.i believe the best way to compare this hotels room to that of one in the uk is to compare it to a very good premier lodge

Reviews.Title: “Busy”
Reviews.Author: Pat1111
Reviews.Content: Good place. Busy. Stayed here due to traffic and an early flight in the morning. $239 for a Wednesday night. You can arrange to drop your Hertz rental car here at night and take the shuttle to the airport in the morning which is convenient and actually shorter / quicker than returning the car in the morning to the Hertz location.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon from hell”
Reviews.Author: floody1973
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We decided to have a base hotel due the size of L.A. No problems on check in, courtesy service, went to our room, nice size, the safe didn't work but the hotel said we could use the front desk safe so not a problem, Awoke in the morning, out all day, returned to the hotel, the room wasn;t cleaned, dirty towels etc, spoke to the front desk who after an hour sent a maid to the room. the following day, left the hotel, upon return, same thing, rooms still not cleaned and this was 9 the evening, spoke to the manager who apologised and gave us a credit on our bill of $100, that was fine, following day, returned to our room and thier was aletter thier saying that a $250 fine was on our bill because they had to deep clean the room as they thought we had smoked in our room, I was furious, spoke to the manager again who removed the fine and sent a bottle of wine to our room, beleive it or not, thier is more, then I got a fraud alert on my credit card as the marriot decided to take $800 from my card so I could pay for any extras, spoke to the front desk manager who was rude but told her that I was the customer and to put the money back and I would give them $200 as my bill was$171, I have never stayed at such a awful hotel, avoid it like the plague. the service is poor, the staff can't be bothered at all.

Reviews.Title: “front service people need to be trained”
Reviews.Author: club22
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriotts Gold Rewards member and you'd expect a little extra service. I came in at 230pm and went to the Elite line, I was told no room was ready (we had 2 rooms reserved) if we wanted 2 rooms together. Since my parents were tired I said thats ok and without batting an eyelash she said there are just no rooms. Interestingly enough the line for regular rooms were getting checked in by this nicer lady. I left and lined up with the regular line and got to check in 2 rooms beside each other. I think its the manner of how she said it and if you work in the front desk you should provide good customer service. Customers walk in after a long day, tired and the last thing you need is someone being rude to you. There are a lot of other hotels nearby people could choose and they should be taught that they should treat their guests with respect if they want their business. So whats the use of the Marriotts Gold card?

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: TinkerbellGermany
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for one night after a very long flight, but we really liked this place! We arrived late at night at L. A. Airport and took the shuttle service to the hotel. People at check-in were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the beds very comfortable. We didn't hear any noise from outside the hotel and most other guests tried to be quiet as well.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many different LAX airport hotels, and this is probably my favorite. You're not going to be wowed by any means, but it's everything you expect from a Marriott. LOCATION- Straight down the road from LAX maybe a half mile. Catching the shuttle can be a daunting process (as it would be for any airport hotel here). The arrivals roadway is very, very busy and there are thousands of cars and vans all whizzing by. It comes by on a random schedule and serves both the Marriott and Renaissance. PROPERTY- This is a Marriott relic that has been redone many times over. But I like this "old style". There is a beautifully landscaped courtyard pool area surrounded by a 5-story tower. There is also a tall18 story tower as well. I prefer to stay in one of the lower floors by the pool. If you request an even numbered room (ending in 00,02,04,06, etc) you will have a nice balcony overlooking the courtyard and pool. 1st floor even-numbered rooms actually have a patio that walks straight out to the pool. Can you tell I have stayed here many times??? I think this pool area is a small respite in the busy LAX area. ROOMS- For the most part, small. I've had some rooms that were bigger than others, although it's kind of random. The rooms are standard updated Marriott - very nice. Fabulous bedding and small but luxurious bathrooms. No surprises here but you'll be very comfortable. FOOD- I have been in the lobby bar. They have great food and a nice selection of drinks, but it's very, very expensive. It's hard to do better than this if you need an LAX hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: SFOF/A
Reviews.Content: I traveled from Jordan to London to LA. Before I continued on my journey, I was in need of a comfortable bed a hot shower and decent room service. I found all of that and more at the LAX Marriott. There are hotel shuttle buses that circle the airport. They will pick you up at specific boarding locations outside your terminal building. Each bus goes to a couple of hotels that are near each other. The wait isn't very long, about 10 minutes. There was one person ahead of me at the check in line. I was greated with a smile by the staff member behind the counter. He was quick and efficient in giving me my room key. This hotel is huge and very busy, however, I didn't hear a single sound from anywhere in my remodeled, extremely comfortable room. I ordered room service and was told it would be 45 minutes, it was at my door in 20! The food was quite good. The small bathroom was spotless with bath and body works aromatherapy shampoo, conditioner and cream. The room was nicely decorated and very clean. My king sized bed was so comfortable, I felt as if I was sleeping on a cloud. There were 5 pillows on the bed, various sizes, take your pick.... There was a desk, comfortable chair, large TV with digital cable, a large, illuminated, bedside clock (easy to see without your glasses....LOL...) as well as good lights for reading. I slept like a baby and was ready to get up and face the next day's travel refreshed and well rested. Thank you Marriott LAX.....

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfsup2
Reviews.Content: nice hotel at Lax Airport room were nice and pool area nice. Also has a Starbucks so handy for coffee .It also has a sports bar were you can get all americian food and relax. We also used the trolley that is free to go to Manhatton Beach were we wondered around for a few hours and had dinner .Then got the trolley back to our hotel. The rooms have everything you need and found the staff very friendly and helpful .Ihave stayed about 6 times at Lax hotels and must admit I really liked this one as found it so professional and good.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: cybertraveler14
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be very friendly and efficient. The rooms were indeed small (especially the bathrooms), but in good shape and most importantly relatively quiet and clean. As long as you can get a good Internet rate and avoid the costly incidentals, it is worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor counter service”
Reviews.Author: OctoberSun
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a few nights as we were attending a conference there. Our major grouse was that the counter staff were rather rude and not friendly at all. We called to say that we had only parked the car one night but found on our bill that they had charged us for 3 (its 20 USD per night by the way). And when we extended our room from the check-out time of 12 noon to 6pm, they charged us USD 75 but didn't even bother to give us fresh towels or make the beds. When we asked them what time the shuttle for the airport was leaving they pretty much told us that it wasn't their responsibility to know. The rooms themselves were fine, we had one on the 5th floor and it was newly renovated although the building itself is old. One thing we did notice was the this Marriott is much stingier than other Marriotts. They didn't provide us with any amenities (shower gels came in tiny bottles) and the toilets were very small indeed. If you're heavier than 150 pounds, you might have issues brushing your teeth at the sink because its practically on top of the toilet seat.

Reviews.Title: “You would really need a car...”
Reviews.Author: KIDSMOM95
Reviews.Content: I was bumped off my flight and Air Canada put me up at this hotel. There is an aiport shuttle, which does the rounds of a few hotels and eventualy I got dropped off at my location. It appeared that this is primarily a business traveller's hotel, and there were quite a few "business travellers" checking in at the same time I was, with my puny little airline voucher. Call me paranoid, but there was a big difference in the level of service and courtesy displayed to them versus me. So, if youa re a business traveller (or perhaps anyone who pays a higher rate?) you will be treated very well. In my case, the desk clerk went off somewhere in the back and forgot all about me, after 10 minutes I asked another girl to check on her and she finally came back. However, the room was very nice. The beds are great, loads of pillows, down duvet, the works! The balcony overlooked a very nice outdoor pool area, but it was too chilly to try out. I grabbed a late dinner from the sports bar and it was the usual fare, nachos, potato skins and such, but it was tasty and plentiful. I did attempt to go for a walk in the area and other than more airport hotels, there is not much to see. Be careful not to wander off the main drag, as the area can get a little "iffy".

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a quick stop”
Reviews.Author: ceedaworld
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay for international guests. The shuttle is a bit slow from the airport but once there the service begins. The check in is super fast and they also have check out kiosks so you don't have to wait in line. Also airline web check in kiosks. The rooms are clean and the bed is super comfortable. The guests are varied. From prom people to tatooed ones to old geezers. Noise level is ok. You are next to an airport. Rooms were quiet enough to get a good sleep. All in all it was nice for a quick stop over on internatinal trips. Wish the van came quicker for the drop off. And let's have no tipping for the bag guy. The give you the look if you don't tip.

Reviews.Title: “Best value if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: domida
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night only, comming directly from the airport with the hotel shuttle. The check-in was fast and the staff friendly. We got a room on the groundfloor with direct access to the pool area. That was excellent, because we could relax after a long flight. Remarkable are the beds, it's like heaven! The car rental companies are just around the corner, so we got our car in the afternoon. The hotel has a guided parking, but due to a conference in the hotel, space was rare. They take 19 $ for self-park with in and out feature. in about 20 minutes (what is excellent for LA), you reach St. Monica and Hollywood as well. When we come back, we'll stay there for some more nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: suru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights while attending a dance convention. We arrived on a Friday night and check in took all of 5 minutes. I was traveling with a friend and her kids and we asked if we could be on a high floor and close to each other. The very nice front desk clerk gave us adjoining rooms on the 8th floor overlooking the beautiful pool area. It was perfect. The room is very small, especially the bathroom. We joked that you could sit on the toilet and brush your teeth in the sink. Although the rooms were small, they were furnished nicely and were very clean. The beds were comfy with lots of pillows. We ate at the two restuarants (not the steak house) and both were very good. The service and the food was fine. It was very convenient to have restaurants at the hotel. The prices were also reasonable. Try the champ fries in the sports bar, they were really good. I have a feeling the hotel was packed because there were at least 600 dancers and their families there for the convention. It did seem a little crowded and the elevators took forever because there were so many people using them. However, the service from everyone was friendly and efficient. The fitness center is a little hard to find but it is big and well equipped with weight and cardio machines. The treadmills have flatscreen tvs attached to them. I had never seen that before. The pool area is very nice and tropical and the pool is huge. It has a 9 foot deep end. I didn't go in, but the kids had a great time. One thing you might want to be aware of is the parking is $19.00 per day, so be prepared. Valet is a bit more. I would definately recommend this Marriott. Oh, and one of the things I love about Marriott hotels is that they are all non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for an overnight near LAX”
Reviews.Author: brooksz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before an early morning flight. The staff is very accommodating and check-in/out is a breeze. The rooms themselves are pretty small although they have been updated with Marriott's revive bedding. The room had a really nice plasma TV which pleased my husband immensely (Final 4 was on). The room appeared clean and tidy. The bathrooms are REALLY small -- you can barely close the door and unless you hop into the tub first. The amenities are standard Marriott ginger scented products -- not my taste but you find them everywhere. The concierge lounge has a good selection of treats and a computer with printer. The staff working at the lounge can help you with all types of things -- just ask. The airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes but is shared with the Renaissance hotel. If you are in a hurry, miss the shuttle by 5 minutes or have lots of luggage spend $10 including tip and take a taxi. It was so much easier! Overall a nice hotel for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: attractiveprof
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the first floor. Not recommended, cars are parked outside your window. No amount of pillows can hide the fact that this is basically a cheap and small motel room... But...nice decor throughout the hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. Very pleasant pool and an outstanding workout facility.

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: mpl1853
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for a meeting. Rooms are on the small side, including the bathrooms. Bed was comfortable. Decor is nice, pretty new, though my carpet did have a large stain just inside the door. Wallpaper, drapes and bedding were in good condition. Has an in room safe, but no frig or microwave. Plenty of hangers in the closet, something I've found to be pretty rare. Hotel offers the "Wired for Business" program-for about $13 per day, you get wired or wireless internet access, all local and long distance (in US) calls. Meeting rooms are pretty standard meeting rooms, though the carpet was busy enough to give you a headache. Hotel staff were very helpful and seemed to be cross trained. When my group wanted to order a pizza for delivery to our meeting room, the concierge was not at the desk and someone from the registration desk provided all the info needed and was very helpful. I ate in Latitude 33. Breakfast buffet was fresh with a good variety. Lunch service was a bit slow, even after explaining that we needed to be back to the meeting rooms at a certain time. Room service was good-food was hot and arrived in about 25 minutes. When I checked in I was given a room on the lobby floor(2nd), near the elevator bank. When I went back to the desk to request a different room, they gave me one on a higher floor, as far as possible from the elevator. Which in this large square building, meant a long, long walk every time I left my room. But it was quiet, even facing the street. I'd recommend that you request a room on the 3rd floor or higher and a room that is not on the opposite side of the building from the main elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: onedude
Reviews.Content: Got this on priceline for USD76 before tax. I find the Marriott LAX to be very convenient and comfortable - from the free shuttle, to the upgraded rooms, to the sports bar in the lobby where you can have a hot dog and a beer for under $15. Check-in was quick and efficient, there was no flight noise, and it was convenient to get my Hertz rental from the booth in the lobby the next morning. I would recommend this property and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LindatNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Marriott hotels are pretty much the same all over and this one is no exception. Two points to note: the second restaurant (smaller, more expensive) has WAY better food than the larger one. Don't get me started on American food... but pay the extra and get proper food. Second point: the internet access (if you haven't brought your own laptop) is expensive at .40c per minute which soon adds up, and the room is poky. But the hotel is convenient to the airport, pretty much soundproof, very busy, and has a good shuttle system.

Reviews.Title: “Raw chicken it could have walked”
Reviews.Author: yellowrocks
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel as part of a conference. Conference food very bad, raw chicken, raw steak! The latter I could cope with but not raw chicken on the bone! Hotel Pub food not much better! How can they ruin a hamburger! and it took 35 minutes to arrive. Draft beer in the hotel pub very expensive at $7-00 each, but I am told California is expensive! Rooms nice, but bathroom tiny! At an average rate of around $250 plus lots of taxes I would stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent Service”
Reviews.Author: springbanktraveller
Reviews.Content: Our Travel agent was able to obtain a room for a reasonable price, well under $100/night. We had expected to have had paid a much higher price at a Marriott so were pleasantly surprised. The aircrew on the same shuttle bus from the airport had their own check-in counter so we were not inconvenienced at all. We had an excellent and fast check-in. Although the hotel was fairly old, the room was standard, king bed and clean with good towels and accessories. We had a large balcony overlooking the swimming pool which appeared rather too cool to swim but a family was and often used the warm spa. The pool area is spacious and on a hot day it would be busy. The restaurant staff were courteous and provided excellent service. The meal was very good and our server often asked how it was and whether we were ready for our next course. The prices were acceptable much the same at the same quality restaurants in Calgary like Earls, Joey Tomatoes etc. The prices in the Steakhouse were much higher and was not as busy; Starbucks also provided coffee service and muffins and the bar in the Lobby also provided food. The breakfast buffet was well stocked, multiple choice, the waitress gave us a sample of a fruit smoothy; she also was excellent and very friendly. Check-out was equally efficient and the shuttle buses to and from the airport were timely. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent with Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: Bellarina126
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Marriott LAX around 9pm for a good night's rest before heading to the airport at 4:30 the next morning. The best part of my stay was definitely the service. Everyone I encountered was very friendly. I stayed on the 8th floor, and I didn't hear any air traffic noise, which is one of my big concerns with airport hotels. The parking is very pricey at $19 a day, so I just parked in my normal airport parking lot for less, took the shuttle to the airport, and then grabbed the Marriott shuttle. The Marriott shuttle runs frequently, and the shuttle drivers were friendly as well. I thought the room was quite small, but it was more than adequate as a place to sleep. The beds are comfortable enough; everything seems recently renovated. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, as well as a sports bar and a gift shop, though I can't comment on the quality or prices of any of them. Internet is a steep $12.95/day, which I still find ridiculous, but what can you do? Overall, I'd recommend this airport hotel based on its proximity to the airport and the absence of air traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: NAG&KAB
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and have never been disappointed. I agree with other reviews that the decor of the hotel is a little dated, but its clean and the rooms very comfortable & spacious. We had a problem where the safe was jammed shut with all our valuables in it. The hotel staff broke it open eventually, were very apologetic and gave us free breakfast & dinner. This attitude made it easy to forget the minor inconvenience. One of the only negatives is that I wouldnt rate the dinners at the Latitude restaurant downstairs that highly at all, but their breakfasts are fantastic and something to look forward to in the mornings. Overall, this is a very good hotel and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: LaPortuguesa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is above average given its location near the airport. I've often found that hotels near the airport are often dungy and un-kept - that was not the case with the Marriott at LAX. That being said, the service was quite poor: - We called the morning of our arrival to ask if our room could be available for early check-in. We were assured that it would be no problem. Upon arrival 3 hours later, we were surprised to find that our room was not available, and we had to be down-graded to a lesser room in order to check-in early. The front desk person was so rude that I almost asked to speak with the manager, until I realized that the rude person WAS the front desk manager! - I didn't have access to a car in LA (I know, I'm crazy) so I needed to know how to reach my office via public transportation. I asked twice, and twice I was promised a call back in my room once they found someone who could answer my question (no one knew their way around LA, and no one had a bus map?!) - Overall, we felt that they are used to people staying either for conferences (which means they didn't have a choice where to stay) or only for one night (if their flight was cancelled). So they don't care to ensure repeat customers since most of their business is one-time only. Some positives: - Wonderful pool area, very clean (and I'm picky!) and not that busy (it's mostly business travelers who are in a conference all day long) - this was the hotel's biggest plus as far as we were concerned - Starbucks in lobby (very convenient) - Very comfy beds

Reviews.Title: “OK Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: capturedplanet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one Friday night on business. Arrived at 10 pm and hotel reception was packed with flight crews and people who missed flights. The front desk processed the line very fast. The room was a typical Marriott - clean and comfortable. Dinner at Champions Sports Bar was typical pub fare. Service was excellent. Free airport shuttle to forever to get to the hotel from the airport due to the number of stops it had to make.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Dated”
Reviews.Author: shnibby
Reviews.Content: At $160.00/night, you'd think this "five star" hotel would be giving free foot massages the minute you check in. Well, what can I say? Aside from being only two blocks from LAX, it's an overpriced dinosaur sticking up in the California skyline... this hotel is so old, I'm half expecting to see Jayne Mansfield pull up to the front door in a 1961 Edsel. The good: friendly staff. The bad: OVERFRIKINPRICED!!! You know, that you have to pay $13 bucks a day just to check your email bugs me. That you have to pay $30 bucks a day to park a car (park at one of the MANY nearby airport parking lots, WAYYYYY cheaper) is laughable. The sports bar called "Champions" should be called "Shack du $8 Coors and Baskets of Grease we call food". It should be standard inexpensive pub fare, but no.... it doesn't matter what you eat in there, you can expect a minimum of a $20.00 charge/person/meal/perhaps. The Steakhouse smells great, too bad you can't afford to change your mind if you decide to fork out $38 bucks for an $8 dollar strip loin. Breakfast in Latitude 33 is $12.95 or GASP $16.95 for the buffet... all designed to upsell your order. The rooms: fairly moderinish, although the colours are basically brown and rust. Small TV's with the most BASIC of cable available. Bathroom is nicely appointed but the tub might as well be a galvanized steel basin, it's that small! Maids come in around 10:00 am and while they don't steal anything, they don't exactly clean the place up other than make the bed, dump the trash cans and vacuum. I still have newspapers in my room where I left them three days ago and this is day five of my one week business trip. The windows are FILTHY times infinity. It's like someone splashed a bucket of swamp water on them and left the dirt to cake on for a week. NO excuse for that whatsoever. All told, the LAX Airport Marriott is a drab old building with a throw together facelift, insulting prices, crummy maid service and overpriced everything. Glad my company paid for this trip. If I am in LA again, I am staying at the Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GAP15
