Reviews.Content: The hotel meets the normal Marriott quality standards. In comparison with other airport hotels, I would rate it above average in terms of cleanness of the rooms and silence. One advice: if you ask the Courtyard shuttle driver nicely (there is a seperate shuttle service for the Courtyard and the Marriott hotel), he might also drive you to the Marriott. This worked perfectly for us as we could directly catch the Courtyard shuttle when we left the terminal

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: slugga13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for one night on stopover in La on December 7th. Shuttle bus pick up/drop off from Lax. Check in was easy and check out was the same. Room was clean and roomy with all amenities such as shampoo etc. Bus to Santa Monica leaves from outside Hotel was convenient and clean, all in all would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the very good, and the not so good”
Reviews.Author: rufferta
Reviews.Content: This will be the fifth year my husband and I have stayed at this hotel over the Thanksgiving weekend while we attend a small convention. I always enoy our stay, but this year the hotel seemed improved. The good: Our room had new carpeting and was bright and clean. While not huge, it was pleasant and quiet and had the standard amenities (Before you complain that there is no coffeemaker, look in the closet). The very good: The exercise room now has at least eight treadmills, and each has an individual television monitor. They provide earbuds so you don't have to listen to your neighbor's program. There were also a variety of other exercise machines, and a separate alcove with weights. There were lots of clean towels, cold water, and apples. Definitely above average! The not so good: It took us several hours to drive there, and when we arrived we were directed to underground parking. My husband drove around and around, looking for a space for his small truck, until he finally gave up and drove out again. When we told the attendant we couldn't find a place to park the attendant said "There are spaces there -- people are going in and not coming out." and directed us to the above-ground area, where the only place we could find had a tree branch obscuring it. Fortunately we're not car proud, so we just moved the branch aside and then let it rest against the truck. I guess if we had continued circling the underground garage we would have found a space eventually. Also there would have been space if there hadn't been at least two cars taking up two spaces apiece, and one truck that was taking up two and a half spaces. Also, some of the underground space was being used to store what looked like building supplies. I asked one of the hotel staff and he confirmed that the parking lot operation is contracted out. A web search showed that you can pay to park here even if you are not a hotel guest. I like Marriott. The hotel staff do their best to be cheerful, courteous, and efficient and they put up with a lot. I wish the Marriott also ran the parking lot. Regarding nearby restaurants -- We stayed at the Four Points Sheraton next door a few months ago and they have a nice restaurant with a good beer selection. The Radisson at the corner of Century and Sepulveda has a coffee shop/bakery with a less expensive breakfast buffet. There is a concentration of small restaurants and shops near the intersection of Manchester and Sepulveda, less than an hours' walk. -

Reviews.Title: “Good, quiet affordable hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: PatrickTravels
Reviews.Content: I needed a one night stay near the airport because of a flight the next morning. Too often I have stayed at Motel 6 because it's cheap (approx $65) but then I read on TA forums about bidding on Priceline. I bid $70 for a three star hotel near LAX and got this great deal at the Marriott. The cost was more than $70 because of taxes and $19 for parking (with in/out priv.) but even so the cost was worth it for a great room that was very convenient. It was a wonderful and quiet room even if the bathroom was small. For a room of this level I would have expected to pay almost $200. I was very happy andwill never stay at Motel 6 LAX again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX with adequate services.”
Reviews.Author: IdaMaeSlade
Reviews.Content: It is a convenient and easy overnight stay to/from LAX. Our flight arrived close to 6AM and the courtesy shuttle, which runs every 20 mins., had us to the hotel in minutes. The driver was friendly and helpful, as were the reception staff members, who allowed us into our room so early in the day, mainly because it was Thanksgiving and they are never full on the holiday. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and two restaurants, neither of which we used. There is also fresh drinking water available in the lobby, which is a nice treat. Plus a chance to shop in the lobby store which carries a bit of everything from aspirin to wine. Our room was neat and clean, the beds were comfortable, and there is a flat screen TV, a desk and a comfortable lounge chair with ottoman. We slept for a few hours, then went out. When we returned later in the evening, we simply crashed and slept well. Most guests probably are on layovers from long flights which makes this location perfectly suitable. We did hear voices through the walls, but that is to be expected in any hotel anymore. It was not an overall problem and did not keep us from getting much-needed rest. We ordered room service breakfast which was adequate but not great. Eggs were overcooked, toast was dry, that sort of thing, but we didn't expect Four Seasons quality and service. We got what we paid for on a discounted room rate and thought it just fine for our needs. Check out is at 1PM and the shuttle driver again was quite courteous and friendly. Each and every staff member we encountered was professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “MARRIOTT LAX = BAD”
Reviews.Author: Brklynrider
Reviews.Content: First I am Marriott Gold Member so I am familiar with a lot of Marriotts. While prices have been going up at all Marriott properties this one seemed expensive at $279/night for the airport location. It was overpriced. This hotel needs a makeover. I was there for two nights for a nearby convention and I dreaded the hotel after I checked in. The rooms were so small. I had to stand in the shower to close the bathroom door. I am a big guy 6'2" and 210 pounds, but not that big!? I should be able to shut the door of my hotel bathroom! The restaurant and room service got my meals wrong on 3 separate occasions. The one time and this is funny, I was with a business partner and we ordered the same meal - tuna nicoise salad. Hers came out with olives, tomato, onion, etc. My salad just had the tuna? Even the waitress was baffled she asked if I ordered a different salad. Um, no - we got the same thing. We never got bread or drink refills. My breakfast room service came without utensils the one morning - little things like that which make you roll your eyes and want to scream. The hotel property itself looks like Mike Brady designed it. It is right out of the 60's. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which was always crowded. My final bill had several incorrect items on it such as a valet parking charge!? and $1.00/per call service charge for 1-800 numbers. The Manager refused to take those 800 phone calls off my bill insisting that Marriott charges for 800 calls. They don't. Marriot.com refunded my money. Just goes to show you this hotel is a bit too big for its own good. They seemed overcrowded. But hey, they got my $279 night. There are a bunch of hotels there and several people told me the Westin is cheaper, nicer and nearby and the Renaissance (another Marriott property) is much nicer with bigger rooms and cheaper as well. So LAX Marriott first and last time for me.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds after long haul from London”
Reviews.Author: awen18
Reviews.Content: After long haul the beds very comfy rooms spacious and toiletrries special. The breakfast was a buffet with plenty of fresh fruit yoghurts home made granola(lovely) and lots of pastries + cooked breakfast if you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the gym, the corridors will kill you!”
Reviews.Author: irishgypseyrover
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on way from London. Arrived at LAX at 7pm and after 2 hours to get through immigration I was glad the wait for the free shuttle to the hotel was not too long - about 10 minutes. Apparently one comes every 20 minutes. The driver was very courteous. Took longer getting around terminals than drive from airport to hotel. Check in very quick although lady at reception seemed to want to be anywhere else but working that night. Try a 12 hour flight from London! No assistance offered to bring cases to my room and the walk along the corridors seemed endless. The complex is two interconnected tower blocks and I found the walk exhausting, especially after a long flight and I am in my 30's. Very easy to get lost in the maze of bends. When I finally found my room it was clean and very comfortable, especially the bed. Bathroom on small side but all amenities and very clean. Unfortunately no bathrobe to change into and no mini bar/fridge for a cold drink. Do not recommend the buffet breakfast - very limited and the scrambled eggs tasted processed and dry. The waitress however was very friendly and helpful. Major suggestion: Do not make long distance calls from the hotel. - the rates are outrageous. The Starbucks in the lobby is a great bonus. The pool and garden area is like something out of the 60's - not very attractive and beware falling branches from the palm trees in high winds.

Reviews.Title: “As long as you don't have a car or need internet access...”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: The property itself is clean, well-presented and well-maintained. However, for an airport hotel, and a property which does a great deal of it's business with flight crews, it certainly does not go out of it's way to ensure that the crews are indulged. We are Marriott Rewards customers (albeit the basic level), and were assigned a room on the ground floor - with a very narrow door, making it hard to push our luggage through. This was almost laughable since the rooms on the opposite side of the hall had standard sized doors. As other reviewers have noted, internet access is charged at $12.95 plus tax per day ... and parking is $19! So, a relatively inexpensive room rate is pushed up substantially by the add-ons. So, if you have no car, and no need to use the internet - then this hotel is a relative bargain; if you need those accoutrement then the price rises rapidly - and I would recommend the Doubletree down off of Sepulveda. The other matter I took issue with during my stay was the large gathering that was held the morning of our departure. Since we were on the ground floor, and since there was an entry/exit at the end of our hall, it became very noisy in the morning as the group filed in, and furthermore, many members of that group were smokers so the hall was quite malodorous by the time we departed. Apparently, no effort was made to prevent the attendees from smoking in the lodging hallways. On the bright side, corporate policy allows for a 3 PM departure upon request - although that is done via the internet before one's arrival. In summary, I would like to compliment the staff - to a person, they were pleasant and affable. To the management - rather than nickel-and-diming your flight crews, why not bundle everything so they will want to visit your property when traveling on leisure? In all honesty, I probably would not return. More because I was disenchanted with the ground level room and the noise than for any other reason. Otherwise, it has the feel of a mid-level airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Check the charges”
Reviews.Author: tennison02
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in August for a few nights. I booked the room well in advance through LastMInuteTravel.com. Checked in ok and confirmed that nothing was owing when I checked out. Later they charged my credit card for the full cost of the stay. This was just the start of the problem. The Marriott organisation turned out to be one of the most difficult bureacracies I have ever encountered. They finally refunded the charges but failed to provide any explanation of what went wrong or why it was so difficult to resolve. The hotel itself was fine and I encountered no other problems during my stay but I would never deal with Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel, almost close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Caraib321
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for people who like to walk. You really get a workout when you try to find your room. Perhaps youâ€™ll walk up and down and around several corners of the very attractive long hallways with nice carpet to get to your room. The hotel is shaped like a square with a center courtyard that includes the large swimming pool and hot tub. Request a room with a balcony on the lower floors facing the pool. Higher floors facing the pool do not have a balcony. The rooms are small, but nice and include usual Marriott standards such as great bedding, work desks and lighting. The room had a nice TV, but the remote needed batteries. Marriott still pushes that awful scented ginger smelling lotion and bathroom products. Some hotels will give guys a non-scented or the low-keyed almond scented product from the front desk. The property is close to the freeway. During rush hour forget trying to get anywhere fast. Mapquest told me it would take 21 minutes to get downtown. It took an hour ten minutes. The hotel has one of the best work-out facilities, including dozens of treadmills, stair masters, bikes, free weights and other good equipment. Treadmills have TV. New earplugs are provided. Of three nice restaurants, I decided to go to JWâ€™s Steakhouse for an appetizer and soup, which was excellent. Due to an early flight, I had to order room service for a basic breakfast of scrambled eggs, wheat toast, crisp bacon, OJ and â€œmissing coffee.â€� Room service delivered two OJâ€™s and no coffee by mistake. But, when I called the front desk, they gave me a $7 credit on my bill and told me to order a coffee from the lobby Starbucks. This was a great offer, but I had to pass because the airport shuttle had arrived and I didnâ€™t want to wait another fifteen or twenty minutes for the next bus. The food in the concierge lounge looked great, but I was only able to grab a banana since the lounge didnâ€™t open till 6:30 am. I needed to be at LAX by 7am. If youâ€™re taking the free shuttle to LAX, give yourself a 30 minute window to arrive at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Distaster Area at Hotel Cockamamee”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachTexasT
Reviews.Content: Forget This Hotel! If you are there for an extended stay and put the'DO NOT SIGN' out, do not expect the housekeeping staff to respect it ! When you complain about the lack of protocol expect a call and a visit from Michael Vick' s cousin, who is head of Hotel Security! Do not order a hot dog unless you like MAYO, they will not give it to you, at first! They are not all brainless just some of the staff! Be very patient the elevators are very slow! One could get lost in the hotel, if you did not have a map!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...but very noisy air condition!”
Reviews.Author: Ulrike73
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was the only one of the LAX airport hotels which had a Hertz desk and a Starbucks in the lobby - and this was very convenient. The room was recently renovated, nicely furnished, had a comfy bed, no noise from outside...so everything seemed to be really nice.... BUT: The air condition was very noisy and inconveniently located at the wall right beside the bed so that you had a cold breeze on your face while lying in bed....and due to that circumstance I could hardly sleep during the night. I had to choose between the noisy air condition and a room too warm for sleeping... It was a pity because otherwise the hotel would have been nice and having the Hertz desk in the looby was so convenient, but because of the above mentioned reasons I would book the Hilton next time - it is the only other hotel with a Hertz desk!

Reviews.Title: “beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: desertfogz
Reviews.Content: Well, reviews of airport hotels were spotty - even the well-known brands. We weren't expecting a lot, just hoping for clean, safe and relatively comfortable. We were thrilled when we got there! The rooms are well-above expectation - super comfy mattresses with featherbeds and down comforters, luxury sheets, LOTS of pillows, clean attractive bathroom with "rainfall" type shower head and the shower curtain bar that curves out making the shower feel bigger. Fluffy towels - lots of them. Good choice of restaurants - sports bar, mid-range fusion, fancy steak place...plus a Starbucks. Pool was HUGE - almost like a resort pool and there was a hot tub. Didn't check out the workout facility. Staff were friendly and efficient, shuttle service to airport was free, easy, frequent, and professional. The entire hotel was clean and thoughtfully/tastefully decorated. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job!”
Reviews.Author: debhill
Reviews.Content: After getting off the plane from Ireland the shittle to the hotel was the only thing we wanted to see!! Great service! Room had everything we needed and the hotel was on a bus rouote that droppped us straight to Santa Monica in about 35 mins. Consierge wasn't very helpful, didnt know the area very well, but thats only minor compared to the great hotel. Receptionist also stole Channel sunglasses!! So make sure u dont leave anything on the desk and turn your back for a sec!! They'll swear they didnt see them!! Overall was very pleased with the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Airport Shuttle - BE ALERT”
Reviews.Author: Nicelio
Reviews.Content: August 07, 2007 The airport shuttle is not run by the hotel. They now have a private company providing that services. The shuttle is "supposes" to run every 15 minutes. We were at the front of the Hotel at 03:50. The shuttle got there at 04:25 and then we had to wait for everybody to get in. If you are in a hurry to get to the airport, ..keep this in mind....other than that, the hotel is a good airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicksaab
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in October 2006 on a stopover from Sydney. I was able to check in on arrival at 10.30am. I had a room in the executive level with access to the concierge lounge. Check-in was efficient and friendly. The room was nice and spacious and the bed was comfortable. The view from my room overloooked the runways at LAX, but there was no problem with aircraft noise that you somtimes find at airport hotels. I found that my in room safe was not working and notified reception. The safe was fixed within 30 minutes, quite efficient. There are a few restaurants on site including a Starbucks. I had dinner in the Sports bar, the food and drink were excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful with the notable exception of the waitress in the executive lounge at breakfast who I found to be rather rude and surly. This hotel is a typical airport hotel with suttle bus to the airport terminals. Overall I liked this hotel and enjoyed my stay. Would recommend it for business and leisure travellers on a stopover or with an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice for the LAX Area”
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the LAX Marriott following two, disappointing evenings at the Manhattan Beach Marriott. The LAX Marriott's location was actually better for us in terms of what we needed to do in Los Angeles (i.e. closer to West LA), and we thought it might be fun to try a different Marriott property in the same city. The rooms at the LAX Marriott are on the small side, but they were recently (and completely) updated. They are fresh, bright, and lovely. For two people, it's plenty of room. (It would start to feel tight with a 3rd adult or two children.) Bathrooms have also been completely updated, but - as a previous reviewer noted, they are small. *Very* small. The hotel has recently remodeled it's work-out/fitness room. When I went, it was busy...but no waiting for equipment. It was nice to be in a hotel gym that was not completely empty. The hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby, as well as three restaurants: a high-end steak house; a mid-level restaurant; and a sports bar. We dined in all three, and we found the food to be good (not excellent...but good) in all of them. The LAX Marriott is a busy hotel, but the staff seems to do an excellent job of keeping the line moving at the front desk, as well as the traffic moving in the driveway. In the end, we departed the LAX Marriott much more satisfied than we were when we left the Manhattan Beach Marriott. If an LAX-area hotel will meet your needs for your next LA visit, then my wife and I would recommend this hotel to you. (Other good LAX-area options are the Courtyard by Marriott, as well as the Westin.)

Reviews.Title: “Best bed I had ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: Pixiedumpling
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel in Febuary 2007 for 2 nights. The hotel itself looks very grand inside and our room was of adequate size for the two of us. The shower wasn't as expected for a Marriott but it did the job after a long trip from the UK but the bed had to be the BEST bed I had ever slept in! Verrry cosy! The staff were always helpful to answer any questions / give you directions. My only little moan would be waiting for the Hertz office to open inside the hotel. We waited for 45 mins after opening time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Property”
Reviews.Author: DougDilvo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my family on a overnight layover. The stay didn't start off well as the shuttle did not pick up from the international terminal very often. We waited 30 minutes for the first shuttle to come through. Once we got the hotel everything went well. Quick check in and flawless. We were assigned a room on the 7th floor that faced the Embassy Suites. The room was just renovated and smelled new. new carpet, new paint, new everything. We found the new stuff great, but the room was very undersized for the four of us. (two double beds and a porta-crib). It was very quiet and were not disturbed at all. You have to look a bit for things in the room. coffee maker is in the closet on tray (easy to move) and the ice bucket is under the TV in side cabinet. They have three reseraunts on site. JW steak house a sports bar and another nice place (can't remember the name) we ate at the sports bar. Service was fast, food was "just ok". Bellmen were great helping with bags up and down from the room and the return trip to the airport on the shuttle was fine. All in all a nice place, but the room was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “good option”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride
Reviews.Content: Had to find something near the airport and this one fit the bill. The lobby was no what we are used to in a Marriot..It was small and a Starbucks dominated it.I dont drink coffee so it was not a plus for me.The room was Ok.The nicest thing was the pool courtyard.We went in the spa but some jets were not working,the most annoying thing was there was no WIFI in the lobby eventhough the starbucks was there,The money some of these hotels charge they should provide service in the lobby if no where else..I will go to a hotel with access given a choice especially at the airport

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay for the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: Six_PackSFEastBay_CA
Reviews.Content: Great stay for a family on the move for the right price. We had a pleasant stay for 3 nights. Convenient central location, updated decor, comfy beds, great dining choices, Starbucks in Lobby, and big pool. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good. Clean & safe. Expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: rajeet82
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. LAX area has lots of options. Rooms were pretty nice & clean. It is not fabulous or 5 star but the lobby is pretty impressive. Beds are comfy and we didn't hear any unwanted noises. We had 2 rooms. 1 of them had a good view of the LAX runway. Only caveat is: Parking is expensive. I did Valet for $23/night. (ouch!!). Self wasn't very cheap either. We reached around 3 am. I called in ~ 10 pm to check into my room over the phone and have the keys ready when I reached. Staff was very curteous. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “no 24 hour room service”
Reviews.Author: cherylp13
Reviews.Content: the transfer from lax and check in at hotel was a breeze but don't expect to get anything to eat after midnight at the hotel. I cannot believe a hotel the size of the marriott and situated so close to lax does not offer 24 hour room service. They don't even have a snack vending machine only a drink one. We were directed to the nearest 24 hour 'restaurant' 1 block down the road ( a denny's hamburger that was drive thru only). So if arriving late make sure you grab something to eat at the airport before doing the hotel transfer.

Reviews.Title: “There's a Starbucks but Customer Serivce is Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Josie11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient - a real plus - and also appeared relatively clean. After multiple trips staying at the Hilton down the street with business colleagues I decided to stay at the Marriott - mainly as there's a Starbucks in the lobby and I'm an addict. While the hotel is not terrible - I did have to change rooms as the toilet in the first room was not working (not a great way to start the morning). In addition, in the first room the coffee maker and data port were not working - lastly - the room overlooked the pool area on the second floor and I was treated to shrill screams throughout the night until - still on EST time- I basically passed out. However- I still wouldn't have bothered to write a review - but when at 5:30 in the morning I went to front desk to swtich rooms I did not recieve any sort of apology - later when I brought this to the front desk manager's attention he appeared aggravated rather than apologetic. Not sure I'll book a team in here again. The Starbucks is a big draw but I do like the toilet to work.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...airport views”
Reviews.Author: gaupai
Reviews.Content: stayed at the mariott lax with my wife must say i loved the hotel and the renovated pool and gym we had a room with stunning views of lax and planes landing and taking off close to us but without any noise the other option is to have rooms with a pool view the first four storeys even have a balcony to relax on three in house restaurants,starbucks and couple of good restaurants in walking distance,plush bedding,friendly staff great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie_Sue
Reviews.Content: After spending hours reviewing other opinions on LAX Airport hotels I chose the Marriott & wasn't disappointed! The free shuttle took about 5 minutes to get there, the hotel was spacious, friendly and very clean. There's a Starbucks in the huge foyer, a massive restaurant and sports bar there too.. Big pool area (although warning, as it's in the centre of the hotel, it is quite shaded when sun isn't directly overhead). The hotel (like most in the area) looks older from the outside than it does inside. I had a kingsize bed - huge.. sooo comfortable. Room service was quick, food was good. Checkout was 1pm - very convenient if you are using the hotel as a quick stop before going to another hotel. Also had a Hertz downstairs - so we could hire a car onsite.. we also chose to return it to the hotel & used the hotel shuttle to the airport ( just convenient because we knew where to go etc.).. I picked up my mother the next morning off an early flight, went back to the hotel - where we had bfast, which you can choose a la carte, or buffet.. Good quality food, proper freshly squeezed juice, very attentive waiters. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: damrph
Reviews.Content: A pretty nice place. The room was a bit small but clean and comfortable and quiet. Originally we were only going to stay for 1 night but ended up staying all 3 nights of our stay there. A Burger King within walking distance was only restruant besides hotel restruants. Concierge was helpful. LA Star Tours pick up right at hotel so you dont need to drive downtown. City Bus stop right at hotel. Took it downtown for $1.75 each direct to Union Station one day. From there went to Santa Monica on another bus then back to hotel from Santa Monica. Hour long trip each way but sure saved a lot of money and hassel parking and driving. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: FLDoyle
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect staying at an airport located hotel, but we needed to be near the airport in LAX and I like Marriott so we booked it for two nights. I have to say, I didn't hear any airplane noise, the hotel was spotless, the staff were wonderful, especially since we just showed up with no reservation when a flight had canceled and the restaurants were good. I would stay there again if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: pawriter
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at this LA Marriott and enjoyed it very much - my sister was on a business trip (I went along for the free trip!) and often stays at Marriotts, but it was my first experience in one, since I prefer small inns and historic accomodations when I travel. Our room was large and beautifully decorated, and the beds were probably the most comfortable in which I've ever slept. Directly outside our door was the entrance to a small courtyard area, and since I smoke, I spent a good deal of time there - although were were so close to the airport that the planes flew over this courtyard at a terrifyingly low altitude, we never heard a sound inside the room. At least once a day, we ordered room service just to enjoy the hotel's caesar salads - seriously, they are THAT good. We did try 2 of the hotel's restaurants, though. On the afternoon of our arrival, we had absolutely delicious, reasonably priced burgers in Champion's Sports Bar. Another day, we had dinner at JW Steakhouse. This was extremely disappointing - every menu item is a la carte, and I ended up paying nearly $50 for rack of lamb, mashed potatoes and asparagus (I know LA restaurants are much pricier than those here in Pennsylvania, but considering my meal at Spago was a fraction of the price of this hotel restaurant...) The lamb was terrible, horribly overspiced to the point of being bitter and inedible, and well-done, though I'd ordered it medium rare. I wouldn't recommed this restaurant to anyone. The only other complaint I have about our stay is really minor, and speaks more of my own laziness than any shortcoming of the hotel - this place is massive, and our room was one flight down from the lobby and about as far away from it as we could get. The walk felt about as long as a marathon, especially since my sister was pregnant at the time and I ended up struggling with all the luggage, the laptop, the files,...! All iin all, I highly recommend the LA Airport Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Super Service&Comfortable Beds!”
Reviews.Author: jollyjetlaggers
Reviews.Content: For all you jetlaggers flying abroad to visit lovely, sunny los angeles and you need to recover from being squished in your plane's seat for over 14 hours, this Marriott hotel is ideal for resting your pretty head for a good night's sleep. Everything you need is at your finger tips and the full breakfast included is a real treat to look forward to when you awake. We also enjoyed the service provided at the Hertz car rental desk at the hotel and we wish to thank Tikco for her wonderful service there. It is a much better way to hire a car than to go back to crazy LAX to stand in queue and hope you get a decent car. Overall, a wonderful overnight stay and we do recommend to all and will return the next time we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Colleen_travelqu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight on our way to Mexico. We had just stayed at some Marriott hotels in December, and because I am a Marriott Reward member, we had been welcomed warmly at those hotels, plus there was even a letter from one of the managers in one of the hotels welcoming us. Not here. This is obviously a business hotel that just rolls them through. There was a big line for check in at 8PM at night - lots of airline crews, etc. No special welcome - just sign your name and get a key. Room was ok - a little on the small side. Clean and bed was comfortable. Bathroom was "compact". People at the informal restaurant were very nice and food was OK. On the way back up to the room we noticed some "interesting" people in the lobby, including one guy that was passed out on one of the lobby couches. We didn't try breakfast in the morning - just headed straight for the airport. I think I would be very tempted to try a different hotel next time I am in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Fond memories”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidVoyager
Reviews.Content: We just over-nighted here en route between London and Auckland (both outbound and on the way back) and were just looking for a quiet bed not too far from the airport. My overwhelming memory was just how friendly everyone was. We picked up the free hotel shuttle and had a great check-in experience, smiling staff, free gifts (I have a Marriott platinum card), bags that just diasappeared and arrived as you did - Everything was as smooth and happy as could be. The room was probably pretty ordinary and relatively small but it felt great - big pillows, the baby travelcot already in place and those runway views made it feel like a real comfy nest for weary travellers. The resturants were fine, quick and easy - just the thing for tired those in need of a quick bite. Our 5 month old baby awoke around 5.30am so I took her downstairs for some air - and the girls in the Starbucks shop in the lounge doted on her for two hours while they fed me non-stop coffee. Breakfast was great, a big spread of American favourites and the concierge staff were overly helpful in advising us how to get into town and do a little shopping. The return stay was just as good too. We had three great weeks in New Zealand but strangely enough it was the warmth shown by everyone at the LA Airport Marriott that I remember most! Well done to everyone concerned. It just goes to show that good service can hide a multitude of faults in hotels, but bad service magnfies the smallest problems.

Reviews.Title: “Four days of?????”
Reviews.Author: MichiganRacer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because of conference at same. Room was small but very clean and comfortable. Bed and bedding were very comfortable. Room was not noisy during four day stay. Restaurants were very expensive. The economy motel/hotel several streets over offered free wireless internet service. This place charged ten dollars a day for high speed internet in your room. Staff did not know where various conference rooms were. They had no map to show location of conference rooms. Glad when time came to return home.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Pacwell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Marriott as we werepassing through the airport. The hotel looks okay, but it is not what you come to expect form a Marriott. But considering the price we got, we had no complaints. When we checked into our room, we discovered that we had been given a room with two double beds instead of a Queen. When we returned to change our room, we were told there were no more rooms with King or Queen. Considering it was 1AM, we simply took the room. The staff was not helpfful or accomodating whatsoever. They did not offer any solution or compromise for the problem. Once in the room, we had no problems. The beds were nice and the bathroom was pretty clean. Overall this was an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Refurbished Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GordonToulson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott LAX for one night on 9th January 2007 after a long eleven and a half hour flight from London UK. I had read the adverse reports and wondered if I had chosen well. I used the free shuttle from LAX and was well received by the check in desk staff. I found my own way to the room (as I prefer) and was greeted by a beautifully refurbished room with oceans of pillows and a cosy decor. It was spotless. I agree with earlier posts that the bathroom was small, but it was clean and the hot bath soothed me after the long haul flight. I dined in the Latitude 33 restaurant and it was a pleasure. The service was excellent as was the food. After a good night's rest I was speedily shuttled to LAX for my flight to Hawaii the next morning. Maybe I was lucky but I thought it was truly excellent and would definitely stay there again. I had paid Â£38 (about $73) for the room only online and was well pleased with the package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience; Wonderful Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frqflier
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this review ain't going to get me too many "was this review helpful" clicks because I'm going to briefly reiterate what others have said. It's obviously a perfect location if your travel involves arriving at or from LAX. I make it a habit to stay at airport hotels when I'm flying east and have an early morning flight. Quite convenient ditching the rental car the night before and then hopping on the hotel shuttle bus. From check-in to check-out this hotel was a delight. I was a solo dad traveling with a tired, cranky 4-year-old and they got us in and out perfectly. The pool at this hotel is great and for those of you who specifically seek out airport hotels to watch planes this place is amazing if you ask for an airport runway view and there are many. As for those of you don't don't like airport hotels because of the noise this place should not be an issue. I didn't notice any plane sound. Rooms were newly renovated, there's a Starbucks in the lobby, parking is a ripoff (but that's the case at all LAX hotels...) and the restaurant was decent for breakfast. I've stayed at the Embassy Suites across the street, that's a good bet too if you specifically need a suite hotel. The LAX Marriott is one of my personal favorites because of the runway views but that's just me

Reviews.Title: “very happy at marriott”
Reviews.Author: missy20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, we were hoping to do a day trip to tijuana. the tour got cancelled, but we took the bus that stops outside the hotel down to santa monica. it only costs 75 cents, and we had a great day shopping, and sightseeing! the rooms were nice, and clean. beds were very soft and comfortable. we ate at the champions bar, the food was good and was a good price. we also ate at the latitude 33, it wasnt to bad either. the free transport bus from the airpot was quick and easy. theres also a hertz hire car office there as well. we already had a car prebooked at the hertz at the airport, but the people at the hotel hertz office were very helpful in organising a car for us at the hotel. this was very helpful!! our room had a little balcony with 2 chairs and a table. it over looked the pool area. we could see the planes landing at the airporrt. with the door open to the balcony we could hear the planes, but with it shut, we couldnt realy hear them. we would definatly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Caseydunbar
Reviews.Content: As Australians visiting the US for the first time for some years and needing to spend a night near LAX on both our outward and return journeys we spent a lot of time reading the reviews of various hotels located near the airport. This hotel had rated highly among other reviewers so we booked it. We were not disappointed in any aspect of our experience at this hotel. We were able to get very good but different internet prices for both nights spent in the hotel. It is very convenient to the airport with a regular shuttle bus and the service was top class. The room was comforable and clean with no noise. The bathroom was small but no smaller than others we have come to expect in US hotels. Staff were pleasant and accommodating. The restaurant downstairs was reasonably priced and the food good. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Melnq8
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a night here after a grueling 15.5 hour flight from Singapore. Booked online several weeks in advance and received their weekend rate of $139+. This was my second stay at this hotel and my first stay in one of the newly remodeled rooms. It was comfortable, but a bit on the small size, particularly the bathroom. Loved the comfortable bed, which was much appreciated after such a long flight. I actually preferred the room I had on my first visit to this one though - much larger and quieter - I think it was in a different wing of the hotel. Selected this hotel after a bad experience at another LAX hotel where I didn't feel particularly safe. Not a problem here though. Tried to have dinner at Champions, but after selecting a table, I was told that section of the restaurant had been reserved for a group. There were no other tables available and the place was awfully loud, so decided to try the steakhouse instead. Service there was pretty bad, but the food was okay. Having a Starbucks in the lobby is a nice perk. I'd definitely stay here again after a long international flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for layover”
Reviews.Author: gallaron
Reviews.Content: My stay here wasn't by choice but due to a late connection I needed to overnight at the airport. the travellers aid desk at Internation Arrivals managed to get a very good rate for here which after missing my flight home was nice. The hotel is well served by a shuttle running every 15 mins. The room I got was slightly small but very comfortable. I had some food in the Champions sports bar which was fine and there is one or 2 other food choices there as well as a Starbucks in the lobby. The outdoor pool is nice and helped wake me up the next morning. With a few hours to kill I took the trolley shuttle which goes from the airport district to Manhattan Beach which was nice. If you're ever stuck at LAX would very much recommend this hotel though I'm not sure apart from conventions in the immediate area if it would be a good base for LA in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great Remondel”
Reviews.Author: Ireteri
Reviews.Content: This hotel had nice touches that most don't have. In the beautiful lobby are bowls of apples and bowls of ear plugs!! Possibly needed because of the airport being near, but I didn't need them for airplane noise. Maybe others used them for noise period. Also in the lobby were two containers of fuit infused water. One container had strawberries, oranges and pineapples. The other had lemons, limes, and oranges. YUM! The concierge was very helpful explaining how the free trolly to Manhattan beach works, "Go out the door and it's the 5th palm tree on the left!" She also arranged a tour of LA by night withing 15 minutes of the tour leaving for two of us. Great Job! My room was recently remodeled and had nice contemporary Mediteranian flair. The carpet was burgandy with gold swirls. The walls were painted a warn brownish yellow and a warm red. The bathroom sink was granite. The bed was a feather bed with a down comfortor and pillows. They sure were comfy. At the foot of the bed was a nice chenile bed scarf. I didn't have a problem with noise. I had a newspaper out side my door each week-day. My room had a balcony overlooking the freeform pool. The pool area had nice gathering areas with soft outdoor couches and chairs. Food at the hotel is pricy. Desserts are wonderful. A baked potato was $6. Take the trolly to Manhattan beach and go to Rock and Fish down by the pier. It is pricy but the food is very good and is enough to share.We had a celebrity sighting there. My only complaint is that the training rooms were set at 55 degrees and I had to take my bed scarf down with me to keep warm.

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal Service everywhere except restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Amero10
Reviews.Content: We are regular travelers - we average stays at hotels once per month. In 20 years of traveling, this was the worst hotel service we have ever had. It was a comedy of errors that should have embarassed the hotel manager. The fact that he was not embarassed nor apologetic seemed to be an indicator that poor service was the norm. The challenges started with parking. The hotel is undergoing work on the lobby entrance. We had to park in the surface lot about 1/4 mile away and haul our luggage over the parking lot, dodging cars that were parking. It was difficult to find the escalator (it was unmarked), no help was offered anywhere. When we checked in, we found out that the double bed promised on the reservation would not be honored. No apologies were made, and the impression we received that this was a normal occurrence. When we got to the room, the room was still dirty from previous guests! We immediately called down to the front desk, and were promised a new room promptly and help to move to another room. After 30 minutes passed, we called down again. Ten minutes later, a hotel clerk came up with new keys and left. At this point, we negotiated for a reduced hotel rate. The new keys did not work. After another 30 minute wait, the manager appeared talking on a walkie talkie to other hotel staff. He had new keys, however was more interested in talking on his walkie talkie than in alleviating our concerns. Again, the apologies were lacking for the poor service. The restaurant service was friendly, quick and without errors. At checkout the following morning, the bill was incorrect and did not include the discount that was negotiated. This necessitated another trip downstairs to talk to the hotel staff. A notation was made on our record so the clerk reprinted the bill. This was a quick, overnight stay so other facilities were not used. Hotels make mistakes, although the number of mistakes was startling. The lack of concern on the hotel's staff art seemed to indicate that mistakes were the norm, not the exception. So, these well seasoned travelers have no compunction about crossing this hotel off our list.

Reviews.Title: “I'm very disappointed and will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: notbob_trip
Reviews.Content: The good news - (1) there is a Starbucks in the lobby; (2) the food in the restaurant is pretty tasty, and (3) the fitness center has enough treadmills that I never had to wait. The bad news - (1) the muzak in the lobby, in the restaurant, and almost everywhere else is loud, intrusive, and unpleasant; I asked the management to turn it off, but they did not; (2) the bathroom was so small you almost couldn't turn around; (3) there was no window and no exhaust fan in the bathroom, so after a shower it felt like the Amazon rain forest; and (4) the humidity and/or steam from the shower set off the smoke alarm, which is located 2 inches above the door going into the bathroom [which genius architect made that decision :-( ]; I had to disconnect the smoke alarm and remove the battery after it went off the first two mornings.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: lavendergirl1962
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nice and has a Starbucks near the registration desk. Apples and cold water infused with fresh fruit were available for guests. The first night we were on the third floor with a view of the pool. The rooms are small, but on this floor they have been recently rennovated. The furniture and linens are nice. Loud music was piped into the swimming pool area and was not turned down until after midnight when I complained. I was told that the music plays 24 hours in the pool area. It was so loud that conversation wasn't even possible nor sleep. The next day I was moved into a room on the 7th floor. The desk chair was actually broken. The bedspread was stained and had a large tear in it. I asked to be put back on the third floor with the promise that the music would be turned down at 11pm. It was! The manager was very gracious. Don't stay here unless you can get a rennovated room. I have never had a problem at a Marriots until this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: blue4funofit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located, with a free shuttle service to and from the airport. The hotel was undergoing renovations while I was there, but I didn't notice anything out of the ordinary. I don't know if it was due to the renovations, but I was upgraded to a suite, which overlooked the airport. I could see the planes taking off and landing, which was fun. I had access to the concierge lounge, which did a nice breakfast, with both hot and cold items. Do be aware that they started tearing down the breakfast a little before the posted closing time, but the server was kind enough to bring me a yogurt after they had been put away. The concierge lounge was open (w/ key) during the day and night, with fridges containing sodas and bottled water (a huge plus in CA). The hotel room was lovely and comfortable, the bathroom size sufficient and the bed comfortable. The internet on the TV was very cumbersome, and terribly slow. The business center was closed for the weekend, and the internet TV was a very poor substitute. I took a bus to Santa Monica Beach, which was a long ride, but the beach itself was fun. The surrounding shopping was lovely, and the persons there fun to meet. I also took a VIP Tour (brand name, not level of service!) around Hollywood and the surrounding areas, and was disappointed. The tour was, in my opinion, overpriced, and the driver mainly told us about how many people lived in each city, and how many miles it was. Each place we stopped we had about twenty minutes to look around, before we were due back on the bus. The tour ended two hours earlier than I had been told it would. It was a good overview, but a waste of money, really. It was a good option for my layover on the way home, but still hugely overpriced. If you're looking for convenience to the airport, and a nice hotel, this is a sure winner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice en route in between New Zealand and London for a ridiculous price (NZD 130 per night) in conjunction with Air NZ fares. The hotel does need a facelift, work is going on and during the daytime there is hammering and drilling, but it was very quiet during the night. The two major advantages which this hotel boasts over its many competitors in the area is friendliness and a great, resort-like, landscaped pool area. I greatly preferred this hotel over the Westin LAX where I stayed last year. The bathroom is small but functional; could do with a power shower, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night.”
Reviews.Author: anonymous5
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here for one night, after having flown cross country with 3 small children. Stayed in a 2nd floor non-smoking, 2 queen room, but could still smell lingering smoke smells. The room had been updated & the additional roll away bed we requested was complimentary, unlike other hotels which charge for the use. The bathroom is a tight squeeze but was clean. What made up for the small room space was the beautiful pool area. It truly has a resort feel. If it wasn't for the planes flying above, you would never know you were at LAX. Nice large hottub too. Perfect after a long day of flying. Towels are provided & the pool even opens at 6am, for those of you still on the Eastern time zone. It also has a Hertz car counter in the lobby, or is in walking distance to the other rental agencies. My kids also appreciated the fact that we could walk to the Burger King 2 blocks away, after sitting on an airplane all day. Other than the room smelling faintly of smoke, this was a good place to stay for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbsprite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LAX Airport Marriott for one night before our flight. The LAX marriott has a beautiful new lobby and pool area. It was more like a resort hotel than an airport hotel! The staff was very friendly. Make sure you request a room overlooking the pool area. You will get a great view and these are the only rooms with balconies!

Reviews.Title: “excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammy1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night en route from London to Auckland. The room and the service were excellent, and we were allowed to check out at 5 pm at no extra cost. The concierge was so helpful, showing us where to catch the 'Big Blue Bus' which goes to the marina, Venice, Santa Monica etc. for 75 cents a ticket. It stops right outside and is very easy to use, allowing you to really see the local area. An excellent stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stop with good beds”
Reviews.Author: vicki1812
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on 30th March 2006 as part of an epic journey from Inverness in Scotland to Kauai in Hawaii. We paid Â£40 for the room via a cheap internet site and we were not expecting much but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious with a king bed which was very comfortable. The room was reasonably quiet, and very clean. Furnishings were of good quality. The bathroom was small and quite pokey, however everything worked and as this was just a pit stop then it was fine - we had very nice freebies in the bathroom - stuff you would want to use and all aromatherapy based. Staff were very helpful and gave us all the info we needed. Did not use the leisure facilities. We ate in the large restuarant (can't remember the name) which was Ok, but thought it was expensive, and next time would just order a pizza - concerige will give you alist of who delivers. Warning - the draft beer in the bar fizzy! Not sure if it was meant to be but it was definatley odd - however the wine was very good. If we had to stopover in LA then we would definately use this hotel again - the shuttle was prompt and efficient and the driver (a lady) was very helpful and actually happy - small miracle for LA! However if you are there for a few days and have a generous budget then I heartily recommend Shutters on the beach in Santa Monica - get a room with a tub where you can look out and see the sun rising and setting - the cafe there is excellent for b/fast and brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTCSS
Reviews.Content: I spent a day at the Marriott and found it to be very relaxing. A nice large room with a king sized bed that had 6 pillows! I had a view of the LAX runway and could see the planes taking off but not hear them. The hotel has a nice workout area and sauna and 3 different restaurants. The only down thing about the place is paying 9.95 for Internet. Other than that, I would not mind staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: tsteichen697
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for the airport. The hotel itself is beautiful and check-in was easy. They let us check-in before check-in time. I don't think the room was worth what we paid. The bathroom was very small and the water temperature in the shower was horrible. It kept going from hot to warm. It never stayed the same temperature. The towels were very rough feeling. Checking out was also very easy and we did not have to wait to be taken to the airport. I don't think I would stay at this hotel again. The food service was very slow. I don't believe that we got our moneys worth for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Marriot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a room at the Marriot Lax based on other reviews I read on here and have to say I was very disappointed with the standards of the room. The bathroom washbasin had a huge hairline cack right through it, the wallpaper was all scuffed, and the furniture looked tired and a little unclean. The concierege was completely rude to some customers before me and completely disinterested in helping me use buses. His explanation was 'everyone uses taxis' and that was the end of his help. The restaurant was good and the service there was excellent. So all in all, I found my experience there below expectations, especially as I use Marriots in other cities and would definately not recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mariott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott for 3 nights in Jan 2006 as it seemed easier to stay by the airport. It was great. It is very close to the airport and there is a free shuttle 24 hours so you don't need to worry about that. You can hear the planes but hardly and it is not disturbing at all. There is a nice big pool area with a spa. The rooms are really reasonable sizes and the beds are amazing!! The nicest softest duvets I've ever seen in a hotel!! We did day trips to Hollywood and disneyland and the tour desk was really helpful, helping us organise buses etc. When booking, one concern was that it might be too far fo either of these places (hollywood and disneyland) but it wasn't at all and was really easy!! We ate at one of the restaurants in the hotel and wouldn't really recommend it strongly but it was okay. Overall I would recommend this hotel for any sort of stay in LA!!
